Friday, September 6, 2019

Are you looking to join a company with a hospitality mindset and a family atmosphere?

Central Mutual Insurance Company is looking for an Administrative Specialist in our Central Support Department with advanced Microsoft Office Skills, administrative experience, and a passion for a fast paced and dynamic work environment that requires continuous multi-tasking and prioritization.

This will also include:
Coordinating various company meetings and events
Conducting tours to employees, agents, special groups, and the public
Creating, updating, and compiling a variety of reports
Organizing and preparing meeting materials
Processing vendor invoices and company reimbursements
Calendar management
Providing administrative assistance across the organization as needed
We are seeking someone with the following skills:
Advanced experience and proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite, with an emphasis on Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook calendar management
Demonstrated success in data management and report generation, including charts, graphs, and spreadsheets using Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
One to three years’ experience in an administrative role
Communicate effectively and professionally
Excellent organizational skills with high attention to detail
Proven time management
Effective multi-tasking
Prioritize tasks and workload efficiently and proactively, while following through to ensure projects are successfully completed by the deadline given in a fast-paced environment
Forward thinker who proactively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions
Do you live by our values of Integrity, Relationships, and Excellence?
Treat others with respect
Do what you say you will do
Work as a team – family
Listen and respond
Never compromise on quality
Pursue continual improvement
Service first mentality that takes initiative to serve others

It is the policy of Central that all recruiting, hiring, training,
compensation, overtime, job classification and assignment, facilities,
promotions, transfers, employee treatment and all other terms and
conditions of employment shall be maintained in a manner which will not
discriminate against any person because of race, color, age, sex,
national origin, ancestry, religion, marital status, military status, or
disability. The applicant should respond to questions on this
application in a way that will not divulge such information.
job_description.1:
Department:

17280_83040 Human Resources Operations

Expected Weekly Hours:

40

Shift:

Day Shift

Position Purpose:

At Mount Carmel, we work to continuously inspire one another. Here, all are welcome. It is this culture of humility and compassion that sets Mount Carmel apart. We see the big picture and do the right thing. That means a dedication to the well-being our both our colleagues and the patients they serve.

Job Description Details:

This HR Business Partner serves as the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) for our Mount Carmel Grove City and Mount Carmel Franklinton locations. They serves in a leadership role providing strategic direction, vision, and guidance in the integration of the Human Resource strategies, operations and services in order to advance and align strategy and structure with talent to achieve organizational goals. This colleague serves as a member of the HR structure in achieving implementation of an HR service delivery model which is responsive to and supportive of organization and business needs, goals and objectives. They partner and lead projects with our regional/field based Centers of Expertise (COEs): Talent Acquisition, Organizational Effectiveness, Colleague/Labor Relations, Colleague Safety, and Total Rewards. They act as a trusted partner to leaders at the System, Regional, and COE levels with respect to individual business needs and organization capabilities, while aligning and advancing HR strategy and operations.

Scope: Depending on the campus, this position is responsible for a large (>$800M) or mid-size (

Responsibilities
Serves as a trusted advisor in providing collaborative partnerships with the operation and business functional leaders in order to understand business needs and strategic approaches in order to ensure alignment with Human Resource system service strategy; Collaborates with leaders in understanding and shaping business system requirements and translating such into specific Human Resource actions and initiatives.
Provides guidance on leadership development, performance management, talent management, organization alignment, and colleague engagement.
Supports the implementation of performance management processes and ensures alignment with organizational goals and strategies. Serves as a technical resource, providing advice and guidance to regional leaders on the effective application of performance assessment methods and approaches.
Develops and fosters effective collaborative relationships with, Regional Ministry leaders, System leaders, System HR Center of Expertise (COE) leaders, HR Shared Service Leaders, and other System-Wide services (i.e. D &I) and internal partnerships (i.e. Legal and Communication) leaders recognizing individual business needs and drivers, and organization capabilities while aligning and advancing Human Resource strategy, operation and services to the assigned region (field) structure.
Partners with Centers of Expertise (COEs) resources: Talent Acquisition, Organizational Effectiveness and Colleague Labor Relations and Safety, and Total Rewards, which includes programs, protocols, providing problem resolution, reporting, negotiating, consulting, implementing initiatives, and supporting general HR services.
Ensures appropriate Human Resource information is provided to business leaders which will support the successful alignment of Human Resource operations, programs and services across the system.
Partners with Regional CHRO - Human Resource Ministry Service Area (HRMSA) and Center of Expertise (COEs) in the delivery of organization effectiveness services. Mentors and coaches leaders by providing performance assessment, coaching, guidance and feedback on professional development and quality performance.
Analyzes and presents workforce measures/metrics to regional business leaders for use in resolving issues and driving business decisions. Accountable for driving performance to agreed-upon metrics.
Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State and local laws/regulations; the Trinity Health Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct; as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behavior.
All other duties as assigned
Requirements
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Organizational Development, or related field. Advanced degree highly preferred (MBA, MA, MHA, etc.)
Certification: HR industry certification(s) preferred.
Experience: Minimum of seven (7) or more years' progressively responsible experience in various areas within Human Resource Management; Knowledge of and experience in health care/faith-based health care preferred. Demonstrated experience as a business partner aligning Human Resource and business strategies with organizational capabilities.
Exceptional oral and written communication, persuasion, and negotiation skills with a strong executive presence; proven educational program facilitator.
Project management skills with the ability to define scope, program, process or project objectives, identify business needs, stakeholders and their interests, plan steps, and provide authoritative advice on coordinating and allocating human, technological and fiscal resources to accomplish goals and objectives.
Strong understanding of organizational structure, business operations and financial impact/analysis.
Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skills. Able to create viable solutions, value propositions, metrics, and practices. Able to organize and prioritize multiple projects and requests.
Extensive knowledge of organization development and process improvement techniques that promote team-based solutions, colleague development and empowerment.
Experience operating as a change agent and empowering colleagues within and outside of functional business area. Experience developing action plans and initiatives focused on driving associate engagement to support departmental and organizational strategic objectives.
Must be able to travel to the various Trinity Health sites as needed.
Discovering opportunities, support and excellence – all while making a real difference in patients’ lives – begins at Mount Carmel. Find a new beginning and advance your career with us.

Mount Carmel and all its affiliates are proud to be equal opportunity employers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, religion, physical disability or any other classification protected under local, state or federal law.

Trinity Health's Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Trinity Health employs about 133,000 colleagues at dozens of hospitals and hundreds of health centers in 22 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions.

Trinity Health's dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

job_description.5:
Customer Success Specialist Success Profile

Major Goals and Responsibilities:


The Customer Success Specialist is responsible for day-to-day administrative tasks that help the vCIO achieve customer revenue goals while providing the very best customer experience. Assist with inside sales activities, managing opportunities, and creating quotes along with scheduling customer meetings and security training for assigned list of customers. Assist Accounting with account reconciliations and collecting on past due accounts for those assigned customers.

Essential Activities and Responsibilities:


Customer Service (20%)

· Answer incoming sales calls and route as needed

· Listen to customer concerns as necessary

· Investigate and resolve customer service issues

· Complete below benchmark customer survey follow-up

Administrative Sales Support (80%)

· Schedule quarterly business review (QBR) meeting, Tech Roadmap meeting and security training with CompleteIT customers

· Schedule annual / semiannual review meeting with EssentialIT customers

· Help prepare Technology Roadmap deliverables and documents for Quarterly Business Reviews

· Create and manage sales opportunities and To Dos in Autotask

· Consult with vCIO to generate day-to-day quotes for customers technology needs

· Ensure profitability on managed services contracts/ hardware/software/project sales

· Track and create quotes for software/warranty renewals

· Reconcile managed accounts quarterly and for annual price increase

· Research and resolve dispute tickets

· Research and attempt to collect un-paid invoices

· Assist vCIOs as needed to create proposals, do product research, and gather sales collateral

· Close support tickets daily

· Answer overflow calls and create tickets for the TAC Team when necessary

· Compile customer specific reports as needed

· Act as customer liaison with other team members and support staff when necessary

· Complete continuing education as required

Behavioral Traits, Attitudes and Skills Required:


Action Oriented: Enjoys working hard; is full of energy for the things seen as challenging; seizes opportunities

Composure: Is cool under pressure; does not become defensive or irritated when times are tough; can handle stress

Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting and exceeding the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect

Decision Quality: Makes good decisions based upon a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience

Drive for Results: Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; steadfastly pushes self and others for results

Ethics & Values: Adheres to an appropriate and effective set of core values and beliefs during both good and bad times; acts in line with those core values

Integrity and Trust: Is widely trusted; is seen as a direct, truthful individual; can present the unvarnished truth in an appropriate and helpful manner; admits mistakes; doesnt misrepresent him/herself for personal gain

Interpersonal Savvy: Relates well to all kinds of people; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact

Learning on the Fly: Learns quickly when facing new problems; open to change; analyzes both successes and failures for clues to improvement; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks

Listening: Practices attentive and active listening; has the patience to hear people out; can accurately restate the opinions of others even though there may be a difference of opinion

Organizing: Can marshal resources to get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; uses resources effectively and efficiently

Patience: Is tolerant with people and processes; listens and checks before acting; sensitive to due process and proper pacing; follows established process

Priority Setting: Spends time (and that of others) on whats important; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal

Self-Development: Is personally committed to and actively works to continuously improve; understands that different situations and levels may call for different skills and approaches; works on compensating for weakness and limits

Time Management: Uses time effectively and efficiently; concentrates efforts on the more important priorities; can attend to a broad range of activities

Written Communication: Is able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles; can get messages across that have the desired effect

Prerequisites

· 2-year college degree or equivalent work experience in areas of customer service/ account management / sales

· Ability to work independently and within a team environment

· Good problem-solving skills

· Exceptional customer service, inter-personal, and communication skills

· Ability to successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously

· Ability to work Monday Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm

· Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for an employer without restriction

Primary people Contacts:


· Customers, Co-Workers, Managers, Vendors

Toughest Part of the Job:


· Adapting skillsets to meet changing technologies

· Juggling multiple projects and tasks with frequent interruptions

· Making quick decisions

Compensation method:


· Salary

job_description.7:
Community Coordinator; Multi-family housing community
Villager Apartments 276 Units
Birge & Held is a national apartment real estate, private equity, investment firm located in Indianapolis Indiana, currently managing over $800,000,000 in multi-family assets across the country.
The Community Coordinator will be responsible for supervising & helping with the completion of the rehabilitation projects at our apartment communities. This person will help coordinate projects, which may include scheduling and providing assistance with office and maintenance administrative tasks.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Conduct all business in accordance with company policies and procedures, Fair Housing, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other laws pertaining to apartments
Provide support in coordinating on-site activities of Company employees, sub-contractors, craftsmen, tradesmen and vendors to ensure that the Company’s goals and standards are met
Maintain a safe work environment, demonstrate that safety is a top priority
Coordinate daily activities by giving progress updates and communicating frequently with operations staff on daily activities
Perform other related duties and responsibilities as assigned
Set appointments, show apartments, certify potential residents and maintain a high percentage of occupancy
Perform primary duties using a computer system and must keep current on system changes
May coordinate the completion of resident renovations and maintenance work orders
Maintain positive customer relations with current and prospective residents
Enforce response procedures regarding resident concerns such as; work order requests, noise complaints, etc.
Develop and maintain positive relations with tenants, contractors, local community and groups or associations
Communicate important information to residents with well-written and professional notices
Carry out other duties as assigned by the Community Manager or other Leadership staff.
Ensure renewal offers are sent according to policy and are accurate, follow up on all offers to meet set retention goals
Demonstrate effective communication skills when answering telephones or interacting with residents
Desired Skills and Competencies:
Above average oral communication skills
Flexibility to work across the portfolio at various properties
You need to have the ability to give direction, adapt to change, establish relationships, build consensus, anticipate roadblocks, and work in a team environment
Able to multi-task and prioritize work orders
Exhibit strong attention to detail
Able to perform at high levels in fast paced work environment and successfully adapt to changing priorities and work demand
Able to think logically in order to troubleshoot, analyze situations, and make sound business decisions
Must be able to communicate effectively in the organization, both verbally and in writing.
A complete understanding of Fair Housing.
Education and Experience:
Must possess a valid driver's license at time of hire and maintain thereafter as a term and condition of continued employment
Experience in residential property maintenance is beneficial
Ability to multi-task and prioritize.
Exhibit strong attention to detail.
Benefits and Compensation:
Competitive compensation, retirement plan option, medical, life, dental and vision insurance options for eligible employees
A collaborative, progressive, team development environment
Paid holidays and paid time off for eligible employees
Opportunities to make a difference in a growing and highly productive environment
Birge & Held is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.
job_description.8:
DECA Health has an exciting and rewarding opportunity for a Front Desk Receptionist to work in Toledo,OH!
The Receptionist is responsible for coordination of all of the front office interactions with patients, including greeting patients and accessing all patient information for correct scheduling, billing and filing information forms. As a critical part of the team, the Receptionist is responsible for practicing within the philosophy and policies of the surgery center, ensuring decisions are made in alignment with our philosophy, and actively participating in the creation of an environment that fosters patient, family, physician and employee satisfaction.
Core Responsibilities:
Must be able to work effectively in a very fast-paced environment
Greet and register all patients at the front desk
Input all necessary patient information into the computer to ensure correct communication and billing of patient appointments
Protect patient confidentiality in all interactions
Distributes new patient packets and other patient information, as necessary
Discharges patients, collections all paperwork and scheduling new appointments as directed by the physician
Applies administrative principles and management techniques in assessing, planning, leading, evaluating, delegating and educating
Demonstrates responsibility for continued professional growth, competence and development
Participates in departmental program of Continuous Quality Improvement and other quality control activities
Complies with the Core Values, Mission and Philosophy of the practice
Collaborates with other health care professionals in meeting departmental goals
Establishes and maintains mechanisms for communication and constructive problem solving with the staff
Utilizes a team approach in decision-making and problem solving
Builds trust and mutual respects; supports and promotes decentralized model for decision-making
Performs all other duties as assigned
Required Education & Experience:
High school diploma or equivalent required
Associate degree in a related field highly preferred
Minimum 1-year experience in medical front office required
Physical Demands / Work Environment:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to / exposed to:
Move about and between workstations.
Continuous standing, walking, bending, stooping, reaching and lifting of medium materials.
Frequent pushing, pulling and squatting; occasional sitting, kneeling and climbing stairs.
Schedule: Monday-Friday; 7:45a.m.-6:00p.m.
job_description.9:
Like working with kids and want to be a part of a boutique Columbus-based tutoring firm? Join the elite BWS Education Consulting team of educational professionals—published authors, college professors, graduate students, and experienced educators.

BWS Education Consulting is accepting applications for part-time tutors for ACT/SAT test preparation and math, science, and writing courses. Extensive paid training is provided with company founder Brian Stewart, author of 11 test preparation books with Barron's Educational Series. Schedule is flexible; we will work with you to achieve your desired tutoring caseload. Here are the job requirements:
Reliable car transportation
Clean background check
Non-smoker
At least a 95th percentile score on a major standardized test (ACT, SAT, GRE) or on our company-administered test
Access to email and cell phone
Able to sit for two hours and stand for up to 4 hours
Able to lift up to 30 pounds
Bachelor's degree and prior tutoring experience preferred
Preference is given to candidates who are qualified to tutor higher level mathematics (AP Calculus, AP Statistics), higher level science (AP Physics, AP Chemistry), and/or English composition.

Compensation starts at $25 per hour—instructors are paid as employees, not contractors. To apply, email your resume (with test scores) to hiring.bwseducationconsulting@gmail.com. Do not call or email our other address. You will receive email confirmation that we have successfully received your resume.

BWS Education Consulting does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, in any of its activities or operations.

Due to recent growth, we are hiring. We are an established, growing health care administration company with an open position for Medical Billing Specialist on our Revenue Management team.

As part of our team, the successful candidate will participate in all facets of medical billing/collections, producing optimal results for our clients. These duties include but are not limited to medical claim review, filing, remittance review & posting, patient invoicing, A/R management, phone customer service and other duties as needed.

We are seeking the right team member who can offer at least the following qualifications:
Meaningful education and/or experience in medical billing and collections for Orthopedics, ENT, OB/GYN, or Primary Care.
Ability to identify and solve problems effectively
Ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently under deadline pressure.
Good analytical, accounting and mathematical skills.
We seek a person who likes to learn, works with integrity, conducts oneself professionally & ethically and strives for excellence in job performance.

A degree in accounting/other quantitative field and/or equivalent experience is preferred. Medical coding certification and/or experience a plus!

We offer competitive compensation, health, life & LTD insurance, PTO, and flexible schedules.

job_description.14:
Executive Chef
We are a growing restaurant company based in Delaware, Ohio that offers its employees an excellent learning environment, ongoing training and opportunity for growth.

The Company: 1808 American Bistro offers superb quality classics with the finest, most local ingredients available. American bistro fare with the occasional twists. We know our fan favorites are a mainstay, but we keep our menu fresh with one-of-a-kind, chef-inspired dishes.

-Our comfortable yet elevated dining experience, attention to detail and carefully crafted menus are unparalleled.
-We believe in creating an environment where providing excellent dining experiences for all our guests comes easily, and our staff is excited to come to work every day.

The Position: We're looking for an Executive Chef with a passion for the restaurant industry and at least three years of experience. This is a salaried position. You'll need to have open availability.
-Paid training and all tools needed for success.
-Creative freedom to develop new menu items.
-Managing all aspects of the kitchen and staff to ensure quality, consistency and efficiency.
-A chance to further your education in all aspects of the restaurant industry.

The Location: 1808 American Bistro was established in 2008 on Winter Street in the heart of historic Delaware, Ohio. As our name reflects, we have always been committed to embracing the rich traditions and heritage of our community while introducing our customers to innovative and modern cuisine.

Why Should You Apply?
-You want to work alongside a team of experienced, passionate, like-minded individuals.
-You are experienced and want to pursue a career with a forward thinking, successful restaurant group.
-You're excited to collaborate with other creative minds to develop elevated dishes which please a wide range of palates.
-You are confident that your work ethic and thirst for knowledge will be an asset to 1808 American Bistro.

Still interested?? Send us your resume!

job_description.16:
The Operations Manager is responsible for the overall management of personnel, equipment, property and inventory of the facility. Developing and maintaining a great team work oriented environment, preserving employee morale, and providing a safe work environment. Recruiting, hiring, coaching, disciplining, and training of employees. Improving branch operating procedures, maximizing efficiency and productivity; by analyzing current systems, modifying, creating, and/or eliminating processes. An Operations Manager is also responsible for the knowledge and ability to perform the duties of the Transportation Operations Manager.
Responsibilities & Essential Functions:
Management of all personnel, equipment, inventory, and for the overall material condition of the facility.
Maximizing efficiency, productivity, and expense management. Closely monitor, manage, and approve expenses (labor, equipment, fuel, repairs, supplies, and utilities).
Participation in the branch warehouse standardization review, with the Regional Operations Manager.
Recruiting, supervising, developing, and cross-training employees on an ongoing basis. Managing work schedules and overtime and approving weekly timecards.
Develop and maintain a team work oriented environment while preserving employee morale and providing a safe and efficient work environment.
Monitoring employee productivity, conducting documented employee reviews and constructively disciplining and documenting unsatisfactory employee performance and/or inappropriate conduct.
Ensuring that all material is received, stored, pulled and loaded safely and accurately.
Minimizing and investigating product damage and handling customer and vendor returns.
Managing the physical condition of the entire facility and maintaining a relationship with the local property manager.
Managing safety programs to confirm training is scheduled, conducted and documented for all employees.
Ensure PPE standards are met at all times.
Investigating and documenting all accidents or incidents and developing processes to correct and/or prevent future occurrences
Interacting with Human Resources on the status of injured employees and restricted duty.
Understanding and compliance with OSHA standards and requirements
Maintaining and upholding the fire prevention program.
Knowledge and ability to perform the duties of the Transportation Operations Manager:
The overall management of all transportation personnel and equipment.
Participation in the branch transportation standardization review, with Regional Manager.
Insuring that public safety on the road is an absolute focus and priority.
Other duties as requested and assigned by management.
Competencies:
Problem Solving/Analysis
Customer/Client Focus
Decision Making
Project Management
Communication Proficiency
Teamwork Orientation
Technology capacity
Work Environment and Physical Demands:
Must be able to be on your feet for an extended period of time.
Bending, stooping, reaching, twisting, lifting, pushing, pulling and moving products, minimum of 50 lbs.
Must be able to get on and off a forklift.
Responding to public address system announcements and warning alarms from fork lift drivers.
Identify and read tickets, SKU’s, UPC labels and reports.
Gripping used to operate machinery or hand tools.
Due to forklifts and other heavy equipment traveling through the warehouse, temporary cracks may appear in the floor, causing uneven walking surfaces.
Exposure to varying types of climate.
Wet floors may occur during rainy or snowy weather or at other times.
Warehouse environment can be dusty and noisy.
Sharp and/or rough edges will typically be encountered.
Warehouse equipment and treated lumber may emit fumes.
Some equipment may require electric voltage.

Required cognitive and psychological characteristics:
Must possess employee coaching & development abilities and excellent team building skills.
Ability to maintain a professional appearance and presentation.
Must be self-motivated and able to work independently to meet or exceed goals.
Ability to learn skills quickly with a mature and customer service oriented attitude.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills.
Basic math and analytic skills
Must be computer literate, Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks.
Dependable and reliable
Required credentials:
A bachelor's degree or relevant work experience.
Three to five years of distribution warehouse management experience with P&L responsibility.
Three to five years experience in sit down fork lift operation (not electric box trucks).
Lumber industry warehouse experience is preferred.
*Not a comprehensive list of duties. Duties may change without notice in management’s sole discretion
*Employment at U.S. Lumber Group, LLC. is on an at-will basis.
job_description.17:
Are you a people person with great organization and time management skills? Do you prefer a lot of variety in your day? Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced, multi-person office environment? Towne Properties, a leader in the property management industry, has an outstanding opportunity for you.

We are looking for a Customer Service Administrator (CSA) at our East Cincinnati District Office in Cincinnati, Ohio.

The CSA is an office professional providing impeccable customer service to homeowners through face-to-face interactions, through email, and on the phone. The CSA supports the Association Managers of various COA and HOA communities through specific administrative functions of a moderately complex nature including: community mailings, inputting work orders, drafting correspondence, assisting with newsletters, and other related functions. Scheduled hours are Monday-Friday 8:00AM – 5PM.

We offer:
Named a Best Place to Work in 2019
Named a Top Workplace in 2018 and 2019
Competitive pay and outstanding benefits
A structured training program designed to help you excel in your career
Unique opportunities for advancement and growth
Family owned business established in 1961


You offer:
2+ years general office experience
Excellent customer service and communication skills
Good clerical skills including modern office communication
Fluent in Microsoft Word and Excel
Basic math skills
High school diploma or equivalent
Valid driver’s license, reliable vehicle and auto insurance
Drug and background check
Towne continues to look to the future and create communities that are “Great Places to Live, Work, Shop, and Play®.” Come be a part of it – apply and join a GREAT team today!

job_description.19:
Company Description

Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and manufacturing company specializing in the design and manufacture of a wide variety of labeling and functional materials. The company’s products, which are used in nearly every major industry, include pressure-sensitive materials for labels and graphic applications; tapes and other bonding solutions for industrial, medical and retail applications; tags, labels and embellishments for apparel; and radio-frequency identification (RFID) solutions serving retail apparel and other markets. Headquartered in Glendale, California, the company employs approximately 30,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Reported sales in 2018 were $7.2 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

Job Description

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:

As a key member of the Label & Graphic Materials - North America (LGM-NA) Operations Finance Team the Operations Financial Analyst will provide analytical and financial analysis, planning and reporting services and support to the LGM-NA Operations and Supply Chain Organization. In this role you will lead the day-to-day activities in regard to the reporting, planning and analysis activities for LGM-NA divisional Total Manufacturing Expense. This will include preparing financial and business-related analyses, forecasts and research, and ensure accurate and timely reporting and analysis of financial data. You will work closely with key Operations and Supply Chain Stakeholders to help establish site and divisional performance targets, lead the Weekly R&O Process, identify productivity projects and other continuous improvement opportunities and eliminate inefficiencies in financial processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Business Partnership:

• Provide Finance and Operations & Supply Chain Management with interpretive and predictive financial information, related primarily to Corporate Total Manufacturing Expense

• Lead the Weekly Forecast Process for Manufacturing Expenses & Losses, including the completion of required schedules/templates

• Coordinate follow-up actions identified during month-end LGM-NA Finance Close Meeting with LGM Locations and ensure these are completed timely

• Provide key insight and financials using BI reports and tools during and post ERP deployment.

• Provide Finance and Operations Management with weekly variance analysis on loss performance.

• Participate in Symphony deployment through loss data and report testing and post implementation loss issue resolution

Planning/Reporting/Analysis:

• Assist in the preparation and review of the Divisional Consolidated AOP, Quarterly Forecast & Weekly R&O Process for Total Manufacturing Expense (TME) & Scrap/Losses, including the collaboration with site and divisional operations leadership

• Lead the Weekly Forecast Process for Manufacturing Expenses & Losses, including the completion of required schedules/templates

• Collaborate with Logistics team to develop Outbound Freight Weekly R&O's, Quarterly Forecasts and Annual Operating Plan

• Evaluate key drivers and root cause(s) and provide meaningful analysis to explain Divisional TME performance and variances to target/commitments and complete monthly bridging process for TME (Flash and Bridge Meetings)

• Complete the various divisional reports at month-end and make necessary enhancements as needed (Dashboards, Inventory Adjustments, Production & Operations Scorecard)

• Lead the process of calculating Quarterly AIP payouts, collecting and consolidating exceptions and providing estimates of future payouts.

• Maintain leadership and analysis of the Scrap Data Mart tool through the end of Symphony deployment

• Identify top loss opportunities by site and reason code

• Monitor and lead resolution on daily methods and system variances

• Prepare and/or oversee the preparation of the business case(s) and associated financial justification(s) for certain capital expenditure requests that involve multiple manufacturing locations and/or divisional-based, larger capital projects

• Fulfill various ad-hoc reporting and analysis requirements, including developing BI reports, analyzing trends, and presenting results

• Work to automate the reporting capabilities where possible, leading to reduced time required to complete reports

Controllership/Compliance:

• Prepare, submit and approve all month end and quarter end close activities including JE, Divisional accruals/reclasses and cost center statements

• Perform required SOX reporting and audit activities to ensure compliance certification for logistics and divisional controls

• Ensure month end reporting for Freight is accurate which includes booking accruals/reclasses, effectively communicating issues to Accenture and ad hoc analysis

Qualifications

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Accounting.

Experience:

3+ years of financial and/or accounting experience with experience in a manufacturing environment

Skills Competencies:
2-5 years of experience working with financial reporting tools and/or Business Intelligence reporting tools with preference given to Oracle Business Intelligence and/or Cognos
Provide actionable insights to the organization which leads to improved results
Ability to build strong relationships and rapport with Operations leadership teams.
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to juggle multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize workload to meet deadlines due to fluid business conditions and request
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Suite and other related software
Advanced proficiency in ERP & business intelligence tools preferred.
Demonstrated project management skills preferred.
Promote collaboration, desire to learn continuously and takes initiative to act on data and intuition
WHERE YOU’LL WORK: Mentor, Ohio (30 Minutes East of Cleveland)

IND123
#GD123

Additional Information

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or other protected status. EEOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Scripps Center
312 Walnut Street
Cincinnati, OH 45202
www.scrippscenter.com
Company Overview
The Mayerson Company is a commercial real estate property management, development and acquisitions company that is in its 70th year. We have owned and managed Scripps Center downtown since it opened in 1990. We are a tenant first driven property management team. We have always operated the building with four full time facility maintenance staff, and we are looking for a new fourth person. The average tenure with our facility staff is 23 years and we are very fortunate to have such a long-standing team to take care of Scripps Center and its tenants. We offer full health benefits and 401k.
Job Title
Facility Maintenance
Job Overview
We require minimum 5 years of experience working in a Class A or B mid to high rise office building. Fix and maintain mechanical equipment, buildings, and machines. Tasks include plumbing work, painting, flooring repair and upkeep, electrical repairs and heating and air conditioning system maintenance. Job entails addressing a wide array of general building maintenance needs.
Responsibilities and Duties
Maintenance- Responsible for maintenance on a wide array of building needs such as: HVAC, safety, plumbing, and electrical system repairs.
HVAC – Maintaining proper function of cooling towers through greasing, and cleaning as well as checking belts, chemical levels, pressures, and closed loop water level.
Safety- Required to trouble shoot alarm systems (this requires basic knowledge of computer systems.) Work on dry and wet sprinkler systems. Run fire pumps, emergency lights, and battery backup.
Plumbing- fixing leaking faucets, toilets, water pressure valves, and sinks. Repairing water line leaks, and replacement of drain pipes.
Tenant Relations - Providing tenants with the utmost professionalism and service in order to maintain a comfortable work environment. Responsible for working on a wide array of tenant requests such as: hanging pictures, adjusting vents, office upkeep, making keys, and replacing light bulbs.

job_description.22:
What you’ll be doing...

The Senior Manager, Revenue Assurance Testing Operations is responsible for ensuring and validating that the Order to Cash experience in all sales channels is presenting/capturing all the proper information and performing all the functions required to bill everything that should be billed and only what should be billed. You will proactively identify, mitigate, and eliminate issues, ensuring the integrity of the revenue stream while balancing a positive customer experience.

The objective of this role is to ensure releases, pricing, promotional offers, products, usage and customer transactions are accurate in terms of billing and free of issues, whether related to software, network, provisioning or other activities. This includes identification of revenue leakage, potential causes of customer dissatisfaction, and managing end-to-end resolution of all issues, processes and solutions taking into account the needs of our business functions and channels.

Revenue Assurance Process Management:
Act as a single point of contact for Testing Operations and Revenue Assurance on all projects as they relate to pricing, promotions, products and releases; validate that the actual experience matches to billing/revenue output and customer experience.
Create and maintain strong working relationships within Bill-to-Cash, up and downstream from the testing process and across Verizon (Network, IT, Marketing, Product, Finance, etc.).
Serve as subject matter expert for Revenue Assurance on Projects.
Manage and provide final approval on cross functional projects that either directly or indirectly impact the rating and billing streams.
Supply executive level updates to illustrate the current status, risk and potentially gating factors for active projects.
Oversee the design and implementation of specific test scripts to ensure the integrity of various customer order flows.
Engage internal stakeholders to refine and improve requirements for all impacted projects related to protecting the revenue stream
Protect proprietary and confidential information. Ensure appropriate approvals are obtained.
Administration, Ad Hoc Support & Reporting:
Ensure all team members are properly trained for new and existing pricing/promotions, processes, and business practices.
Direct the prioritization and allocation of resources for your team.
Continuous improvement of testing process and tools used. Identify and implement ways to automate and streamline processes.
Conduct regular staff meetings, one-on-ones, and mentoring sessions.
Provide regular and timely feedback to direct reports through regular meetings, performance agreements and established leadership development processes.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and troubleshooting support to various business partners.
Complete required training, and continually broaden and strengthen knowledge of manager/leadership skills, technology, tools and best practices.
Manage preparation of Monthly Operations Reports to supply key performance indicator metrics to upper management.
What we’re looking for...

You'll need to have:
Bachelor's degree or four or more years of relevant work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Supervisory experience
Even better if you have:
Master’s degree inFinance, Management Information Systems, Marketing, Business or related discipline.
Two or more years of work experience with wireless point-of-sale systems and pricing reference data models.
Certifications such as: CPA, PMP, CAPM, CISA, CSM, Oracle/Teradata SQL.
Two or more years of wireless experience.
Knowledge of Agile methodology.
Revenue Assurance experience.
Two or more years of supervisory experience.
Knowledge of wireless network technologies like CDMA, GSM, and LTE.
Strong analytical and decision-making skills.
Capability of independent decision-making, with an in-depth knowledge of Wireless networks, rating, billing and pricing.
Organizational, facilitation, negotiation, and communication skills.
Problem solving and demonstrated collaboration with other work groups to solve complex issues.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with all levels of the organization, with strong consideration for varying degrees of technical proficiency.
Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment with the capability to understand, process and effectively plan, execute and work on multiple assignments, with strong attention to detail.
Knowledge of CPI.
Knowledge of SQL.
Willingness to travel.
Willingness to work flexible hours including nights and weekends.
Knowledge of ACSS and/or POS systems, and customer self-serve systems.
When you join Verizon...

You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

We’re more than sales and service; we are strategic innovators. Our logistics team professionals are creative masterminds, forward thinkers, and problem solvers. They collaboratively partner with the business helping to drive efficiencies.

The Logistics Analyst, under the direction of the Delivery Logistics Supervisor and the Sales Operations Manager, ensures that the departmental and organizational strategic objectives are achieved through operational analysis, tactical projects, daily routing maintenance and enhancement of logistic software systems.


Job Responsibilities:

Works daily with the Logistics Software systems including but not limited to: Omnitracs-RTS, SQL Database, Microsoft Power BI, VIP, Pivot Tables, SharePoint, & GreenMile
Assigns appropriate drivers, equipment and regions to delivery routes in the routing system to ensure optimal routing.
Enters routing information into routing system to create delivery routes that meet customer needs and fleet capabilities while maximizing customer service and minimizing delivery costs.
Assists drivers, managers and other employees regarding procedures, order parameters, expectations, and software technical support.
Conducts regular communication sessions with Routing Coordinators and/or Territory Delivery Managers to facilitate operational knowledge and process improvement
Manages and maintains routing and ordering systems; ensures functionality and reliability of Logistics software systems.
Analyzes existing Delivery, Sales, & Merchandiser routes and determines future plans to increase efficiency and meet customer needs.
Responsible for defined periodic reviews and outcomes implementation for delivery territories and sales territories leveraging Omnitracs, VIP, and associated software systems and data.
Responsible for developing, maintaining and enhancing procedural documentation of operational processes.
Maintains and ensures data integrity standards of Omnitracs and VIP software systems
Creates Microsoft Power BI analytics for analysis to enhance operational standards pertaining to: Omnitracs, Delivery, Sales, and Merchandising standards, and mobile platform data
Lead or Co-lead primary change management initiatives
Builds functional relationships with the G & J Pepsi software publisher vendors to maximize and leverage the support & maintenance contracts.
Position may be located in Columbus OH, Hamilton OH, or Lexington KY.
Job Requirements:

Education: Required: Bachelor's degree: Distribution Management, Supply Chain management, or Logistics management, OR Supply Chain Industry Certification: Level 1 CSCMP Certification. Preferred: Industry Certifications: Supply Chain or Logistics certifications, Lean 6-Sigma or Agile Certifications

Experience: 1-3 years of front-end software management experience in a distribution or DSD environment and/or academic studies pertaining to logistics management and logistics analysis.

Computer Skills:

Preferred: Omnitracs - Roadnet Transportation Suite, Omnitracs - Roadnet Anywhere Platform, VIP. SQL & Access Experience. Required: Dynamic Routing / Logistics Software systems, Cloud Software Systems and/or academic studies pertaining to logistics management and logistics analysis.

Certifications & Licenses: Valid Driver’s License; employee must be insurable to operate a vehicle, as a condition of initial and continued employment.

Other Requirements: Presenting operational information or research to executive level management.

Conducting educational training sessions. Database systems management and reporting. Systems and process analysis.

Knowledge of the beverage industry and beverage market sales practices.

Provides high quality Internal customer service. Has the ability to work quickly, independently and efficiently in a busy and pressurized environment. Comfortable with multi-tasking without compromising data or work quality. Places a priority on meeting deadlines. Communicate effectively with other employees and develop good working relationships centered on "Speed of Trust" principles. Adapts to change and a changing work environment.

Exhibits knowledge and proficiency with computer hardware and software.

Is detail oriented, has strong problem solving skills and exhibits strong comprehension, writing, and communication skills.

job_description.28:
Do you love diving into data sets? Would you enjoy telling stories and helping others see the benefit of data based decision-making? As a Senior Data Analytics Manager at P&G, you are a Business Leader: you should be an effective communicator, ambitious, and able to drive insights into actions that improve P&Gs business results. Youll need to mine multiple sources of data, derive actionable insights, and translate complex results or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to take action to win with consumers. You will be a primary driver of delivering insights that will educate and influence key business decision-making with our Customer and Brand teams. Business knowledge, social, and communication skills are therefore needed to thrive in this multi-functional leadership team.

We would like you to lead and improve analytical programs and results of your business unit / category / region together with consumer research.
Deliver analytic insights in several business domains including consumer, customer, digital, market & share performance. With a combination of analytical expertise, data and system knowledge and business insight, youll answer and anticipate critical business questions and opportunities and deliver critical insights to the business in ways that make significant impacts.
Build analytic capabilities to grow organizations knowledge.
Develop in-depth business, analytical and systems knowledge to improve or build analytical solutions, approaches and business recommendations.
Demonstrating data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, Excel), and analytic tools (R, SAS, JMP, Python, Spark) to grasp the business insights from our mountain of data is what you will experience.
Collaboration with multi-functional teams (Consumer Research, Finance, Marketing, IT, Sales)
We believe you are an excellent fit, if you have:
A Bachelor or Masters Degree in a quantitative field (Operation Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Economics, Statistics, Analytics etc)
Experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis with analytics techniques to solve defined business problems.
Ability to communicate and influence agreement to your recommendations
Experience telling stories and selling with data and insights.
You are comfortable working with diverse business scenarios, handling multiple priorities and have a business & consultancy mind-set, while technically (data) savvy.
Passion about discovering new things and ability to learn quickly.
We would also love to find someone who has:
Good social skills, self-motivated, dynamic, reciprocal and "can-do" attitude
Related full-time or internship experience with FMCG, Media, Ecom industry analytics
Data management and visualization skills / tools (SQL, KNIME, Spotfire, PowerBI or similar) is an advantage
Programming languages (Python, R, C# or Java) an advantage
4+ years of related experience

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

All will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.

Applicants for U.S. based positions are eligible to work in the U.S. without the need for current or future sponsorship. We do not sponsor for permanent residency. Wilson Health is looking for a direct hire Environmental Services Specialist for our location in Sidney, Ohio (North Dayton, Ohio) area.

Department Description: Wilson Health's Environmental Services department maintains environmental and infection control standards within established policies and procedures of the hospital. The department is responsible for performing a variety of general cleaning tasks to maintain patient rooms, offices, hallways and other assigned areas of the facility.

Employment Status: Full Time

Hours: 40 hours per week

Shift: 3rd shift with flexible starting time

Position Reports to: Environmental Services Manager

Job Summary: The Housekeeper is responsible for following established procedures to clean and service building areas, perform a variety of environmental services duties to maintain the hospital in a neat, orderly and sanitary condition.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Obtains and retains knowledge of specifications to clean patient rooms, surgery, OB, floor care, outside windows, and attainment of patient goals
Thoroughly cleans areas using proper cleaning materials, supplies and solutions
Always observes established isolation and aseptic techniques in accordance with departmental policy and procedure
Demonstrates knowledge of infection control and strictly obeys the hospital policies for infection control procedures by washing hands regularly
Seeks out work that needs to be done, demonstrates alertness to areas needing attention
Consistently demonstrates an awareness and concern for patient safety, always uses caution signs as appropriate

Pay (Shift Differential, Weekend Differential, Holiday Pay, and Direct Deposit)

job_description.38:
What you’ll be doing...

You will help drive Digital Finance as we expand the number of models utilized across revenue assurance. Through partnering with the modelers you’ll be ensuring clean datasets are provided while maintaining data integrity. Utilizing your expert analytical knowledge, you will develop research methodologies generated from both cyclical and daily trending models. And you’ll use your love of data to help Verizon and our customers make more informed business decisions.

Technical Leader:
Independently manage advanced level analytic projects from design to resolution with minimal oversight.
Focus on automation by leveraging emerging technologies (Big Data) and advanced analytic techniques to create models that identify system risks and failures.
Design, develop and implement sophisticated solutions to ensure the ongoing integrity of our revenue streams and customer experience.
Design and develop standard or ad hoc reporting based on business requirements.
Direct and coordinate ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), data analysis, and reporting with respect to business intelligence efforts.
Identify opportunities for revenue recovery and lead implementation efforts.
Utilizing business knowledge, financial analysis skills and risk management techniques, champion efforts to effect changes within the business to ensure subscribers are billed correctly.
Partner with cross-functional groups across the enterprise in Finance, Marketing, IT, Network and Supply Chain to assess impact and drive critical issue resolution.
Exercise sound judgment in developing methods and techniques that requires data analysis and interpretation.
Direct the identification and use of appropriate analytical technologies.
Ensure analytics are captured using dashboard using statistical means, Teradata, and ETL and critical issues are identified and resolved in a timely manner.
Project Leader:
Lead cross-functional, enterprise level project efforts within Network Assurance. Assess risks and identify control processes, design user stories and drive implementation.
Partner with cross functional Finance organizations, IT, Marketing, and Product teams to identify issues and drive complex issues to resolution. This includes, but is not limited to:
Lead initiatives in the role of a Subject Matter Expert to resolve problems.
Articulate and communicate to broad audience with focus on execution.
Document and communicate resolution action plans.
Stay current with system enhancements by meeting regularly with key stakeholders in IT, Network and Marketing to ensure that controls and processes are adequate.
Learning and Development:
Continually broaden and strengthen team’s knowledge of technology, tools and databases.
Actively participate in team meetings, and facilitate one-on-one mentoring with less experienced teammates.
What we’re looking for...

You’re analytical, organized, and detail oriented. A self-starter and quick learner who can work independently, but you’re also great to have on a team. You communicate well with others. You’re no stranger to a fast-paced environment and tight deadlines, and you adapt to changing priorities and juggle multiple projects with ease. You take a lot of pride in your work, and that’s why people count on you to deliver.

You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Willingness to work a flexible schedule, including nights and weekends as necessary.
Even better if you have:
Bachelor's degree, MBA or related advanced degree or certifications.
Four or more years of work experience in a technical position working with analytic tools including Teradata, SQL, Hadoop, Data Visualization, R, or Python.
Knowledge of systems required: ACSS/VISION, SMART/EPS, MTAS, On-line Charging Systems, SOCO, Enterprise Data Warehouse, eTNI, MARS.
Knowledge of other IT or Network systems preferred: Visible (Matrixx/Vlocity), REVO, Data Mediation, General Ledger concepts.
Experience with relational and non-relational databases, billing systems, and wireless networks.
Analytical, quantitative, and proactive thinking; organizational abilities.
Creativity and flexibility in managing multiple projects and issues simultaneously.
Capability to understand, process and effectively plan and execute in a nebulous environment.
Ability to effectively work in a large organization in consisting of diverse individuals with varying degrees of talent and technical expertise.
Team oriented – proactive communication of direct/indirect issues impacting their processes.
Knowledge in problem mitigation and resolution and ability to drive problems to closure.
Ability to anticipate issues based on analysis and experience.
Collaboration with other work groups to solve complex issues.
Demonstratedeffective time management and prioritization skills.
Effective written and oral communication skills with all levels of the organization, including senior management.
Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment with strong attention to detail.
Willingness to travel.
When you join Verizon...

You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

As one of the world’s largest lift truck manufacturers, we are committed to providing the customer with the safest, most efficient and ergonomic lift truck possible to lower their total cost of ownership.

Provide data analysis for requests from branch personnel, management, branch operations management as well as corporate stakeholders.
Develop performance dashboards which enable staff to accurately gauge results.
Ensure data integrity and credibility of all results that are presented regardless of the format in which the data is represented by correctly understanding business requirements behind the requests, as well as properly qualifying the data which is used for the data analysis as well as by taking appropriate reconciliation steps to tie out results to financial reporting where appropriate
Monitor developments and keep abreast of the technological changes in the Company IT environment so that appropriate efficiencies and reporting can be achieved from the data collected by the Company.
Provide technical support to Branch Operations and other departmental personnel for Company systems as needed.
Increase productivity of others by developing automated applications and coordinating information requirements.

With Unlimited Systems you will have the opportunity to further develop your skills in customer relationship building, software innovation and much more. The Associate Analyst, Data Services is responsible for data and reporting needs for Unlimited Systems' clients. Scope and consult on data-driven projects for internal and external customers and business partners
Provide end-user and technical training for internal and external customers

Strong time management skills

job_description.42:
Company Overview
Bober Markey Fedorovich isn’t your “typical” advisory services firm. In fact, there’s nothing typical about us! Big enough to serve regional, national and international clients, but small enough to foster a family atmosphere – we are the perfect solution if you’re looking for something a little different from the Big Four. From large, publicly held companies to smaller, family-owned businesses, our clients come in all shapes and sizes so you’ll get opportunities to serve a variety of industries in many different ways.
Job Summary
Our clients chose our team of TAS professionals to provide proactive advice from planning to close, helping them stay the course through the transaction process and maximizing the value of the transaction for them. As a Manager in our Transaction Advisory Services division, you will be a pivotal member of the team managing and executing financial diligence project work. From analyzing financial data and identifying key trends behind the performance of a business to discussing business performance and forecast assumptions with senior management, you’ll be integral in making sense of our client’s business profit drivers and trends.
Responsibilities and Duties
Your Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Analyze financial and operational results of businesses to be acquired or sold through reviewing accounting records and conducting interviews with management.
Gathering and managing data pertinent to the engagement, analyzing and inputting the data into financial models, and communicating the status of data with other members of the department.
Analyzing target company data in support of financial due diligence engagements while developing a thorough understanding of business processes, key risk areas, and strengths and weakness of the target company.
Creating reports that set out our findings and recommendations around the key financial and business issues in a transaction.
Identifying negotiation factors for purchase price and deal structuring.
Constantly researching economic and industry trends and technologies, as well as seasonality and cyclicality on cash flow requirements to provide knowledge and insight to clients.
Working with financial models for discounted cash flow, capitalized cash flow, market transaction/multiple, intangible asset valuation, etc.
Performing ad hoc projects as needed.
Participating in selected administrative committees and functions.
Adhering to the Firm’s Mission and Core Values.
Qualifications and Skills
Advanced understanding of economics, financial theory and principals of accounting.
Capable of working in a demanding, deadline-driven environment independently and within a team dynamic while effectively managing unexpected issues and/or questions in a professional manner
Exhibits executive presence, intellectual curiosity and analytical thinking
Capable of initiating and maintaining solid relationships with all levels of client personnel, as well as utilizing network and industry relationships to identify business development opportunities
Strong attention to detail, organization, accuracy and reliability.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
The ability to work independently, multi-task and proactively communicate.
Possesses high standards of work output, delivers on commitments and takes initiative.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office products) and focus on using technology to improve processes.
Entrepreneurial approach with a technical curiosity.
Must be able to travel domestically; up to 15%.
Education and Experience Required
5-8 years of previous public accounting, corporate finance, M&A, or other relevant business experience.
CPA or CFA preferred; Other accounting related credentials are also welcome (i.e., ABV, CVA, CFF, CFE, CM&AA)
Three (3) or more years of previous Transaction Advisory Services experience required.
Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance.

They act as a trusted partner to leaders at the System, Regional, and COE levels with respect to individual business needs and organization capabilities, while aligning and advancing HR strategy and operations.

Responsibilities
Serves as a trusted advisor in providing collaborative partnerships with the operation and business functional leaders in order to understand business needs and strategic approaches in order to ensure alignment with Human Resource system service strategy; Collaborates with leaders in understanding and shaping business system requirements and translating such into specific Human Resource actions and initiatives.
Provides guidance on leadership development, performance management, talent management, organization alignment, and colleague engagement.
Supports the implementation of performance management processes and ensures alignment with organizational goals and strategies. Serves as a technical resource, providing advice and guidance to regional leaders on the effective application of performance assessment methods and approaches.
Develops and fosters effective collaborative relationships with, Regional Ministry leaders, System leaders, System HR Center of Expertise (COE) leaders, HR Shared Service Leaders, and other System-Wide services (i.e. D &I) and internal partnerships (i.e. Legal and Communication) leaders recognizing individual business needs and drivers, and organization capabilities while aligning and advancing Human Resource strategy, operation and services to the assigned region (field) structure.
Partners with Centers of Expertise (COEs) resources: Talent Acquisition, Organizational Effectiveness and Colleague Labor Relations and Safety, and Total Rewards, which includes programs, protocols, providing problem resolution, reporting, negotiating, consulting, implementing initiatives, and supporting general HR services.
Ensures appropriate Human Resource information is provided to business leaders which will support the successful alignment of Human Resource operations, programs and services across the system.
Partners with Regional CHRO - Human Resource Ministry Service Area (HRMSA) and Center of Expertise (COEs) in the delivery of organization effectiveness services. Mentors and coaches leaders by providing performance assessment, coaching, guidance and feedback on professional development and quality performance.
Analyzes and presents workforce measures/metrics to regional business leaders for use in resolving issues and driving business decisions. Accountable for driving performance to agreed-upon metrics.
Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State and local laws/regulations; the Trinity Health Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct; as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behavior.
All other duties as assigned
Requirements
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Organizational Development, or related field. Advanced degree highly preferred (MBA, MA, MHA, etc.)
Certification: HR industry certification(s) preferred.
Experience: Minimum of seven (7) or more years' progressively responsible experience in various areas within Human Resource Management; Knowledge of and experience in health care/faith-based health care preferred. Demonstrated experience as a business partner aligning Human Resource and business strategies with organizational capabilities.
Exceptional oral and written communication, persuasion, and negotiation skills with a strong executive presence; proven educational program facilitator.
Project management skills with the ability to define scope, program, process or project objectives, identify business needs, stakeholders and their interests, plan steps, and provide authoritative advice on coordinating and allocating human, technological and fiscal resources to accomplish goals and objectives.
Strong understanding of organizational structure, business operations and financial impact/analysis.
Excellent analytical, problem solving and organizational skills. Able to create viable solutions, value propositions, metrics, and practices. Able to organize and prioritize multiple projects and requests.
Extensive knowledge of organization development and process improvement techniques that promote team-based solutions, colleague development and empowerment.
Experience operating as a change agent and empowering colleagues within and outside of functional business area. Experience developing action plans and initiatives focused on driving associate engagement to support departmental and organizational strategic objectives.
Must be able to travel to the various Trinity Health sites as needed.
Discovering opportunities, support and excellence – all while making a real difference in patients’ lives – begins at Mount Carmel. Find a new beginning and advance your career with us.

Mount Carmel and all its affiliates are proud to be equal opportunity employers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, religion, physical disability or any other classification protected under local, state or federal law.

Trinity Health's Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Trinity Health employs about 133,000 colleagues at dozens of hospitals and hundreds of health centers in 22 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions.

Trinity Health's dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

job_description.49:
Job Description

Sous Chef/Assistant Executive Chef

Glenlaurel, A Scottish Inn & Cottages — Rockbridge, OH

Glenlaurel Inn, a Select Registry Inn in the Hocking Hills area, is now hiring a Sous Chef for our Culinary Department. For those seeking to build their professional skills as a sous chef and receive a valuable, hands-on education in six and seven-course fine dining menus, this is the place for you!

PLEASE NOTE: LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY. We do not currently provide relocation.

Scope of Responsibility:

Responsible for the consistent preparation of innovative and creative cuisine of the highest quality, presentation and flavor for the dining rooms resulting in outstanding guest satisfaction. In accomplishing this standard, he/she will be directly involved in guest greeting and ongoing guest interaction. An outgoing and well-mannered personality is a must.

Duties and Responsibilities:

1) Helps select/develop menus, create new menu options and ensure all products are prepared in a consistent manner according to appearance, quality, and portion according to Glenlaurel Inn standards. Assists Executive Chef in ordering, inventory control, and scheduling.

2) Displays leadership by maintaining a positive work environment and displays a willingness to cooperate with other team members. Helps dining staff to meet and exceed established serving standards on a consistent basis.

3) Accept responsibilities and direction with professional attitude, meeting defined goals & objectives, and implementing instruction as directed by Executive Chef, but with minimal supervision, once training goals are met satisfactorily.

4) Ensure that all kitchen equipment is properly cleaned, maintained and in working order at all times in accordance with County Health Department and Glenlaurel Inn standards. Follows and enforces all applicable safety procedures specified for kitchen and service areas.

5) Remains at all times appropriately groomed and wears the uniforms provided by Glenlaurel Inn.

Compensation will be dependent upon experience. 2 – 4 years of experience is preferred and you must be willing to become ServSafe certified. Flexible schedule and paid vacation. Must have reliable transportation. Please send a resume with all current contact information and references. NO PHONE CALLS or impromptu/unscheduled visits, please.

Professional appearance
