job_description.59:
SUMMARY

The Kennel Technician is responsible for providing quality care of the dogs and puppies housed in the kennels as well as the cleaning and maintenance of the kennels, dog exercise yards and kennel complex.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following:
Sanitation/Maintenance
Daily clean and disinfect kennels, exercise, training areas and grounds and other kennel facilities using approved cleaning supplies, tools and methods.
Clean and sanitize toys, beds, feeding bowls, crates and other equipment.
Report maintenance problems or repairs to the supervisor.
Dog Feeding
Prepare and dispense food in appropriate amounts and time intervals, including feeding of special diets to kennel dogs and puppies per feeding instructions and guidelines.
Prepare specific diets for individual dogs and oversee the preparation of special diets and amounts.
Understand and able to identify the clinical signs and symptoms in a dog that indicate a change of diet may be required; suggest and understand appropriate transition protocol
Ensure that records of dog feeding are appropriately documented.
Dog Care
Provide quality care and a safe environment to kenneled dogs and puppies.
Provide immediate response to a dog or puppy in distress.
Understand approved commands and leash etiquette for all dogs whether in professional training, puppy or graduate program.
Administer approved medications orally, topically or by injection under the direction of veterinarian or supervisor.
Provide and assist in emergency first aid, wound treatment, tests, and exams.
Groom dogs including bathing, trimming hair and nails.
Keep records of dogs coming and going from kennels.
Exercise and socialize dogs and puppies in approved locations.
Provide behavioral correction, as necessary.
Transport dogs and puppies using crates or approved methods.
Provide breeder information (swabs) to vet clinic, if applicable.
Inventory
Monitor, store and inventory kennel supplies and replenish as needed.
Report needed supplies to supervisor.
Administration
Record keeping and special projects.
Work with and coach kennel support volunteers, such as bathing and walking.
Work with staff and volunteers with special events and tours as needed.
Provide quality customer service.
Communicate and log all health or veterinary concerns, needs and problems.
Be accountable not only for direct responsibilities outlined in this job description but also to serve fellow staff and other constituents with whom position interacts. Ensure actions and communications are honest and transparent.
Other duties as assigned by supervisor or department.
REQUIRED CHRACTERISTICS
Able to perform several tasks concurrently, time management and good organizational and communication skills.
Must be able to safely lift 45 pounds and safely handle, hold and restrain active dogs weighing up to 110 pounds. Employees should seek assistance when lifting dogs or objects weighing more than 45 lbs.
Able to remain on one’s feet, standing, walking, bending and/or stooping on cement for extended periods.
Able to work different day and weekend shifts – weekend and holiday work may be required.
Able to complete necessary paperwork and meet deadlines.
Able to use computers including email and database applications.
Take direction and show initiative; cooperate with coworkers.
EXPERIENCE: Prior dog handling, training and dog health care experience preferred but not required.

EDUCATION: High school graduate, GED or equivalent preferred but not required.

LICENSES: Current driver’s license and insurability at normal risk rates.

job_description.64:
Partnership Development Consultant

Cincinnati

SUMMARY:

At 84.51°, people are the key to everything. We are dedicated to always doing what's right and never compromising on our values. That's why we have created a culture where every opinion is respected, and contrary thinking is encouraged. Making life more rewarding for our community and our associates is an essential part of the process. Our team is known for their enthusiasm, camaraderie and sense of fun. We work hard and we play just as hard. That's why we engage in a range of official and unofficial activities to get together, serve the community, and have fun. We continually seek people who make us better. In order to continue to grow, we need more great people who want to join us in doing cool, industry-changing, brain-stimulating work.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Partnerships team at 84.51 is responsible for driving growth by identifying, executing, and managing strategic alliances in collaboration with business leaders and cross-functional teams throughout Kroger. We are seeking a senior associate to play a critical role in supporting the identification, execution, and integration of high-impact strategic alliances in the retail financial services space. The ideal candidate will possess leadership experiences driving strategic business initiatives and working with external partners, an ability to work well cross-functionally and the desire to roll-up their sleeves and execute plans that move opportunities from strategy to execution.

This individual will lead key aspects of Kroger & 84.51 business alliance initiatives, from identifying and vetting new partners to increasing the strategic value generated by existing partners across our business.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work closely with assigned business leader(s) to help shape Kroger's retail financial services growth strategies and determine the potential role of partner(s) to meet strategic objectives
Source potential partners through broad landscaping and partner cultivation
Liaison with Finance business partners in financial modeling exercises to support each business case, establishing revenue targets for new business opportunities and securing resources for opportunities as needed

CT Consultants, is a nationally recognized consulting engineering firm that is seeking a highly motivated full-time Project Surveyor for our Mentor, Ohio office. CT Consultants, Inc. is an innovative, growing and reputable Engineering Consulting Firm who has been providing clients award winning projects and ground breaking solutions since 1922. This individual is required to be versed in the day to day operational functions of a field and office survey organization. Responsibilities include review and process data, mapping field data, writing proposals, ALTS surveys, construction computations and staking, reviewing and preparing survey plats, easements and legal descriptions, the understanding to operate a Trimble Robotic Station, performing courthouse research, conducting topographic surveys and boundary surveys.

Experience with a Robotic Total Station, Survey grade GPS and leveling equipment
Processing software such a Trimble Business Center
Experience with AutoCAD Civil 3D and or Microstation

OR

This position offers a competitive base salary and benefits program which includes: Medical, Dental, Prescription Drug, 401(k) Plan, Life, and tuition reimbursement. Applicant must have a valid Ohio Driver’s License, good driving record as well as proof of insurance.

job_description.71:
Position Summary

Descartes is seeking a Product Analyst for the Descartes MacroPoint Capacity Matching solution. Customers of this product are typically freight brokers as well as carriers with complimentary business needs.

This position is responsible for assisting Product Management to execute on the strategy guiding the Descartes MacroPoint SAAS delivery of software releases. This position writes feature requirements, creates user stories and acts as the product liaison in daily stand-ups and SCRUM meetings. The successful candidate will quickly understand priorities and be able to coordinate feature backlogs for all releases of the platform.

Leads the translation of software features into technical requirements (Features) and follows Agile Scrum based Software development. This role serves as part of the Product Management Team and reports to the Capacity Matching Product Manager.

Responsibilities
Aid in assessing value and prioritization of stories, epics and themes by working alongside Product Management to ensure work focus aligns with comprehensive product strategy.
Clearly define User Stories and Acceptance Criteria per feature.
Effective and groomed backlog.
World Class Program & Project Execution.
Effective Agile Processes (Scrum and Agile Hybrid) and Cross Functional communication.
Efficient and Effective Solution Delivery Process.
Promotes Continuous Improvement.
Scope
Responsible for conversion of internal and external customer requests into feature descriptions and user stories.
Responsible for weekly reports to Product Management translating weekly Scrum activities for broader audiences.
Groom the backlog in preparation for sprint and release planning post-development start through QA.
Work with Product Management to properly set backlog in an Agile environment.
This position will also raise risks / impediments to the Product Manager and Technical Product Manager.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s (BA or BS) in business, computer science, or related field
Two years previous experience as a business analyst or in a related field.
Certification for Pragmatic Marketing or Product Ownership preferred but not required.
Solid understanding of the product lifecycle.
In-depth understanding of Agile methodologies, technical understanding of products, and up-to-date on industry standards and best practices.
Proficient computer skills, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel); working knowledge of software development.
Comfortable working with multiple teams and leadership, in-house and remote.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Accurate and precise attention to detail.
Able to build strong interpersonal relationships with business analysts, UI/UX team, leadership, senior management, and internal and external stakeholders.
Significant depth of knowledge of the transportation processes of freight brokers and shippers in North America strongly preferred.
Offer

We offer a flexible and casual work environment in an international team, as well as mentorship and on-the-job training to support your personal growth. You will have an opportunity to contribute new ideas and we welcome your fresh perspective

Application Instructions

Please forward your resumes to Human Resources by email at jobsna@descartes.com citing “Product Analyst” in the subject of your message. We sincerely appreciate and thank all who apply to this exciting role, however, only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Descartes Systems (USA) LLC, inclusive of any of its American subsidiaries (Descartes), is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age or any other characteristic protected by law.
job_description.72:
Wyandot is a national manufacturer of great-tasting, better-for-you, plant-based snack foods. Founded in 1936, we are over 80 Years proud!
With our focus on better-for-you products, consumers have a healthier choice when buying snacks for themselves and their families. We produce great tasting and award-winning products for leading and emerging branded food businesses, including first-to-market chickpea puffs and baby snacks, weight maintenance products, and snacks under the Incredi-Puffs and Munch Rights brands.
Our team-based culture is committed to customer success, sustainability, and excellence, with a need for teammates who are passionate about innovation, quality, reducing waste, and finding ways to add value.
Our growth plan is to double in size over the next three to five years, including additional locations throughout the US. If you are looking for a company that can provide a great work environment, opportunities to contribute to our success immediately, as well as opportunities for career advancement, Wyandot is the place for you!
Join our growing team, where we recognize the vital importance of everyone in the organization. Regardless of the task, we all work together and realize that each link is as important as the next.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Establish sales forecasts per account. Work with team to establish a sales strategy. Attend trade-shows, conferences, sales training, and other job-related events as required.
DUTIES:
Know and understand all Terms & Conditions of each project, expressed and implied commitments, all customer expectations, and schedules (address any and all deficiencies prior to accepting the project, contract or sales order).
Lead internal customer-specific teams.
Communicate to the team all expressed and implied commitments, all customer expectations, and schedules.
Communicate all details of projects, contracts and sales orders.
Consult with Scheduling/ Operations/ Quality/ Materials to meet targeted objectives/ completion dates.
Review production schedules to make sure they will meet customer expectations.
Support customer follow-ups for reworks and provide continued support in the event of a non-compliance, quality-related issue.
Partner with customers for growth opportunities and strategic objectives.
Develop and maintain contract manufacturing relations that foster growth for Wyandot and our customers.
Engage with all customers employing professionalism at all times, representing the company and unconditionally maintaining clear ethics in all actions and interactions with customers.
Good time management with the ability to balance multiple complex projects with little supervision.
Communicate via telephone and email with internal and external customers.
Performs other duties as assigned.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The individual will work closely with the technical and production contacts of customers, as well as our internal sales/marketing/production/warehouse/quality and technical teammates to achieve project objectives. Much of the work is detail-oriented and requires the ability to manage multiple priorities and projects with minimal supervision, in a high-energy team environment. Must be able to think and plan strategically. Must be able to assume responsibility and make sound decisions. Must have excellent communication skills. 6-10 years of industry experience with a proven track record is required along with a Bachelors of Science Degree in Food Science, Chemistry or other related fields. Sales or customer relationship experience is required. Management experience is a plus. Must be able to communicate in English clearly in both verbal and written form. Must be able to access, input, and retrieve information from a computer and be proficient in Microsoft programs to include Excel and PowerPoint.
job_description.73:
Our Opportunity

OhioHealth Physician Group Heritage College Obstetrics and Gynecology is hiring an OB/GYN to join a well-established, hospital-employed practice in Athens, Ohio.

·
This reputable physician group services a broad patient mix

·
Hospital privileges at OhioHealth O’Bleness Hospital

·
The hired physician will receive support from dedicated office staff include medical assistants and well-tenured nurses

·
Call is 1:5

Enjoy the stability of employment along with highly competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, relocation assistance, and student loan reimbursement.

Partnering for Healthcare Excellence Today and in the Future

Today’s complex healthcare environment requires physicians and hospitals to work together to achieve excellence in clinical quality, patient safety and service quality. One of the ways we achieve that kind of partnership is through the OhioHealth Physician Group (OPG), a medical group of OhioHealth physicians, advanced practice providers and associates.

We value the expertise of our strong physician network. We seek out your ideas for improving the patient experience and implement them. It’s one of the reasons why we are regularly ranked in the top 10 percent of Press Ganey’s hospital experience survey, which measures physician engagement and satisfaction.

You can contribute to a culture that has repeatedly made OhioHealth one of the Fortune “100 Best Companies to Work For.” And you can collaborate with MD Anderson Cancer Network-certified physicians, use telemedicine to seek the real-time advice of experts across the system, be a part of our state-of-the-art Neuroscience facility, Level 1 Trauma Center or Primary Stroke Center, or find your fit in any of our ambulatory or specialized care sites across the central region of the state.

We Never Stop Learning

At OhioHealth, we want to do more than support the careers of our physicians — we want to grow their talents and help them reach their highest aspirations. We see your education not as an expense, but as a strategic investment in the health system.

We know growth isn’t limited to just education, so we rely on the voices and leadership of our physicians. We have Clinical Guidance Councils, a Physician Diversity Workforce Group, and the OhioHealth Physicians Leadership Institute to help you lead, grow and innovate in all facets of your career.

We Want to Talk About Your Future

Columbus is one of the top locations in the country for young professionals, with a mix of big-city amenities and small-town affordability. OhioHealth offers a wide range of professional experiences in communities throughout central and southeast Ohio, giving you the opportunity to find the perfect fit for your family and your career.

For more information, please contact Jessica Federer at (614) 544-4355 or email your CV to Jessica.Federer@ohiohealth.com.
job_description.74:
Accounts Receivable Manager | Cleveland, OH | BrightEdge
As the industry pioneer behind Content Performance Marketing, BrightEdge has thoroughly redefined the concept of SEO and corporate digital marketing. By developing an award-winning platform that precisely measures and optimizes marketing content performance and ROI across all digital channels, companies can “cut the fat” and focus on producing compelling digital content that truly performs in the virtual marketplace. BrightEdge has emerged as the leading international provider of cloud-based SEO Enterprise solutions due to its dynamic and results-oriented entrepreneurial culture, which is defined by the following values:
· Customer Success
· Career Growth & Development
· Consistency in Performance, Because Excellence Never Rests
· Strive to make a positive impact every day
· The will to win all the way (or how to beat the competition by raising or changing the game)
BrightEdge is currently seeking an AR Manager who will manage the daily operations and strategic objectives of the Company’s SaaS businesses, including design, implementation, maintenance and management of all accounts receivable business functions and procedures including key metrics reporting.
Your Key Responsibilities:
· Manage day-to-day collection team’s activity, including hiring, training, and assignment of responsibilities.
· Review daily / weekly AR aging report with each collection analyst, ensuring all past due invoices are collected timely, in addition, partner with sales on past due invoices.
· Prepare weekly AR aging, key metrics and cash update reporting package for management.
· Work closely with AR Specialist to ensure invoices are generated and mailed to customers promptly, including reconciling and updating NetSuite system to match contract changes processed in SFDC.
· Oversee monthly AR close process with strict adherence to deadlines.
· Review with management 90 days past due customer aging and work with legal to prepare ‘final demand’ letters.
· Review with management if final demand letter does not yield collection, thereafter, send the account to collection agency.
· Assist in the development and implementation of new tools and platforms to meet the needs of our ever-changing business model.
· Properly and timely record & apply cash, process credit & debit memos, and oversee interaction between billing team, client services and customers on collection matters and dispute resolution.
· Assist with management of merchant account for credit cards processing.
· Assist with annual financial audit.
· Special projects, as required.
We’re Looking For:
· Minimum 5 years work experience in Credit & Collection and three years supervisory experience preferred.
· Bachelor’s Degree or a commensurate level of directly related experience.
· Well-developed analytic and problem-solving skills.
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Highly organized with ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver assignments on time.
· Ability to exhibit poise, composure and confidence when confronting stressful or high-pressure situations.
· Experience with Salesforce and NetSuite is preferred.
· Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
· General knowledge of revenue recognition, preferred but not a requirement
About BrightEdge:
BrightEdge Technologies, Inc. (www.brightedge.com) is privately held and the leader in cloud-based SEO and Content Performance Marketing solutions for over 2,000 enterprise, corporate, and agency customers and 10,000 brands. The BrightEdge platform boosts their marketing performance by streamlining, automating, and integrating search optimization, social marketing, and content performance management capabilities for its customers. Advanced BrightEdge technology delivers visibility, executable recommendations, competitive insights, and dynamic performance metrics. With the largest technology, sales, and customer success teams in our industry, we help customers innovate and execute to achieve superior marketing performance.
About BrightEdge

BrightEdge Technologies, Inc. (www.BrightEdge.com) is privately held and the leader in cloud-based SEO and Content Performance Marketing solutions for over 1200 enterprise, corporate, and agency customers and 9000 brands. The BrightEdge platform boosts their marketing performance by streamlining, automating, and integrating search optimization, social marketing, and content performance management capabilities for its customers. job_description.77:
Position Title
Inkjet Test Technician

24-Jun-2019

Position Description
Kodak is Hiring!

We are looking for an Inkjet Test Technician to support our Enterprise Inkjet Systems Division in Dayton, OH.

As an Inkjet Test Technician, you will focus on continuous improvement for the Kodak Prosper S-Series and Press products. This technician will be responsible for operating test stands and presses to run experiments, collect data, and report back to the responsible engineer. Work will primarily include runability testing of inks in Kodak’s printers, as well as the upkeep and maintenance of those printers. Secondary work will include printhead and printer component failure analysis, laboratory testing of existing and prototype parts and software, writing system troubleshooting and manufacturing process improvement. Close interaction with other engineering disciplines is required due to the complex printing system consisting of fluid mechanics, electronics, software and materials.

PRIORITIZED SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Technical proficiency in the following areas: Ability to operate and understand complex systems, including system integration, troubleshooting, and testing skills.
Written and verbal communication skills including assisting in the creation and delivery of technical presentations.
Has good knowledge of area of responsibility and uses judgement to make decisions and achieve objectives.
Organizes personal schedule for deliverables. Demonstrates initiative and resourcefulness.
Focuses and encourages team involvement. Constructive interpersonal skills by listening and checking for understanding
Education and Experience:
Associate degree in an Engineering discipline (preferred) or equivalent work experience;
2 – 5 years’ experience in a technical contributor role
System operation, troubleshooting and repair, preparing test documentation, use of analog and digital instrumentation.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Preferred/Nice to have:
Continuous inkjet knowledge, software knowledge, failure analysis knowledge, reliability engineering.
Printing press operation & maintenance experience
Position Number
19955BR

Career Area
Engineering

Minimum Education Level
Associates Degree or Equivalent Work Experience

Position Type
Full Time

Geographic Location
USA - OH - Dayton

Experience Level
3-6 Years

EOE Policy Statement
Kodak is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Applicants are free to apply without regard to race, color, religion, sex/gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, national origin, age, disability or veteran status or any other Federal or State legally protected classes. Driver Managers are right in the center of the action as they team up with our professional drivers to drive our business. Our Driver Managers work with a team of professional drivers in all aspects of safe, on-time delivery, and are also responsible for meeting the commitments to the career success of their drivers.

Knowledge of U.S... geography and map reading
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Good interpersonal skills and service attitude

job_description.79:
.

Do you dare to reinvent the future of education?


At Cengage, we are harnessing the power of tech to build a future where all learners have the tools and confidence to achieve their goals.

As a Cengage employee, you will pioneer transforming the way people learn. Collaborating with the best of the best, you will feel challenged and inspired to do breakthrough work. With the support of our united team, there is no limit to what you can imagine, create and set in motion.

Are we right for you?


We bring our “A” game, unique talents and point of view to the table every day. We are curious and comfortable with change and are willing to take risks to transform education. Most importantly, everything we do, we do for the learner.

What You'll Do Here:


We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Higher Ed and Skills Operations Product Data group, to help deliver data-driven insights across the finance, product, strategy, technology, and legal groups. The Data Analyst will be a critical contributor to the team, focusing on deriving business outcomes from data, driving improvements in data quality, building out new proof of concepts, engaging and communicating analysis to cross-functional teams, and providing analytic and operational support to multiple areas. Further duties and responsibilities include:
Form a deep understanding of Cengage Learning’s processes, systems/tools, personnel, and strategic direction
Create and maintain dynamic models and visuals
Assist in consolidating, standardizing, and automating data workflows
Collaborate with business stakeholders and data engineers to define and provide high quality, synthesized outputs
Capture and communicate findings within broader project structure; maintain healthy project management, coding, and workflow practices
Skills You Will Need Here:


BA/BS with high proven achievement and data analysis proficiency
Demonstrated ability to conceive and execute quantitative analysis and deliver data-driven insights
Strong understanding of data analysis and data mining tools (for example SQL, Python, R) and techniques with experience working with Business Intelligence (BI) platforms to deliver synthesized reports and data-driven insights
Collaborative problem-solving and working style to drive change through influence
Able to self-manage progress against milestones and deliverables with a high degree of accountability and personal urgency
Travel expected (primarily domestic, less than 10%)

Crown Equipment Corporation is a leading innovator in world-class forklift and material handling equipment and technology. job_description.83:
Job Summary
Our SUTQ star rated early educational centers in Mentor and Willoughby, OH are looking for loving, compassionate, dedicated Teachers (Infant, Toddler, Preschool, PreK, and School Age) who have experience caring for children ages 6 weeks to 12 years and would like to make a difference in children’s lives every day! Little Scholars is committed to providing quality care and education to children enrolled in our program. Our goal is to enhance the lives of EVERY child and family that attends our center.
A teaching position with Little Scholars requires HARD WORK, PASSION, FLEXIBILITY, and PATIENCE!
Are you ready for this rewarding challenge?
Responsibilities
Design and follow a classroom schedule filled with age appropriate learning activities
Implement weekly lesson plans utilizing set curriculum
Use a wide range of teaching methods to enhance child’s learning experience including relevant literature, indoor and outdoor games, music, art, hands-on play, intentional teaching activities
Complete on-going evaluations of children’s academic and social/emotional progress utilizing assessments and screenings
Build strong rapport with parents through constant communication and daily updates using the Brightwheel app
Observe & take anecdotal notes on children’s developmental milestones and interactions
Collaborate closely with other teachers at all times to ensure a child’s smooth transition from one classroom to another
Participate in ongoing professional development to meet licensing and SUTQ requirements
Maintain up-to-date health care plans, lesson plans, and individual child plans
Adhere to teaching standards and safety regulations as established by state licensing and SUTQ
Create a FUN, clean, memorable, loving, interactive environment for our children EACH and EVERY DAY!!
Benefits
Paid Vacation, Personal Days, and Holidays
Dental Coverage Available
Paid Professional Development Training
Requirements
Proven experience as an Early Education Provider
Values and nurtures imagination and creativity in children’s play
Shows respect for all children, families, and colleagues by maintaining confidentiality at all times
Responds to challenges/changes with flexibility and cooperation
Accepts responsibility for his/her actions
Eager to learn new knowledge and skills as related to the Early Education field
Appreciates and supports the vital role of caregivers/parents in their child’s lives
Willingness to ask for help and collaborate with colleagues
Communicates clearly, professionally, and respectfully with all children and adults

Associates or Bachelor’s Degree in Early Childhood Education or related field preferred (but not required for all positions)

Job Type: Full-time
job_description.84:
Title:Bilingual Customer Loyalty Representative

Company Overview:


Pure Romance is the largest direct seller of relationship enhancement products in the United States. Its premiere line of products is marketed through a distinctive network of in-home parties organized by more than 20,000 independent sales Consultants.

You will find a challenging and rewarding career working with a group of motivated professionals in the United States, Canada, Australia, Puerto Rico, and South Africa. Our staff enjoys generous benefits including an onsite gym with full-time trainers, flexible work schedules, and numerous activities throughout the year to boost friendship and camaraderie between departments. Pure Romance rewards exceptional performance with accelerated salary increases and promotion through increased responsibility.

Job Summary:


The Bilingual Customer Loyalty Representative will support independent contractors (Consultants) and clients across the nation by speaking BOTH English and Spanish. They are responsible for researching and recommending product information; tracking and following up on orders; and coaching Consultants on their day-to-day direct sales business operations.

Essential Functions:Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Promotes excellence by providing superior service to all Consultants and customers.
Responsible for establishing rapport with each and every Consultant and providing them with a high level of knowledgeable support.
Consistently completes the full cycle of a service call, which includes:
Greeting and establishing a positive rapport with each caller, actively and attentively listening; and providing excellent follow through and follow up.
Take on and act immediately on complaints by using customer-oriented telephone techniques and providing options and solutions for the Consultant or customer.
With the help of the Customer Service Manager, is responsible for making business decisions that adhere to the companys policies and missions.
Use comparative analysis skills to identify appropriate solutions for each customer.
Will maneuver within various order processing and tracking systems.
Acts as product knowledge expert who can explain the features and benefits of our products.
Will be point of contact for all Spanish speaking Consultants and customers.
Translates daily sales, specials, and other material that needs to be written in Spanish.
"Other duties as assigned."

Competencies:

Warm and engaging approach
Extreme attention to detail
Ability to think on your feet and respond quickly, as well as, reprioritize to meet ever changing needs.
Flexible, with the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Client Focus Providing service excellence to internal and/o external clients
Work Environment:


This is not a typical call center position in which every call is cookie cutter. Office environment where you would be sitting at a desk working/typing on a computer. 7-8 hours using various computer programs daily while concurrently on the phone with Consultants and customers.

Required Education and Experience:

2 or more years in Sales/Call Center/Phone support role, supporting external and internal customers.
Previous inside sales, recruiting, or direct sales experience a plus.
Working knowledge and experience within the following Microsoft Office applications: Outlook, Word and Excel
Must be fluent in BOTH English and Spanish (oral and written communication skills). Must have the ability to translate emails, written communication, etc. into English. Convert that from English to Spanish in a flyer form.
Strong conversational phone skills, and experience working with customers.
Solid knowledge of basic math principals/functions.
Solid understanding of proper grammar usage, sentence structure with average (or above average) spelling skills

job_description.86:
When looking for the right place to take your career, what's important to you?

Big enough to serve regional, national and international clients, but small enough to foster a family atmosphere, Bober Markey Fedorovich is the perfect solution if you're looking for something a little different from the Big Four. From large, publicly held companies to smaller, family owned businesses, our clients come in all shapes and sizes so you'll get opportunities to serve a variety of industries in many different ways.

With 60 years in business, Bober Markey Fedorovich is one of the region’s premier accounting and advisory firms with a long history of serving leading public and private organizations in Northeast Ohio and around the country with reach throughout North America and the world.

We're committed to hiring the BEST and the BRIGHTEST - and that's why we're looking for talented Senior Audit Professionals to join our extraordinary team, and help continue building Bober Markey Fedorovich's respected and long-standing reputation.
Participates in audit, review and compilation engagements from planning through issuance.
Assists in the preparation of financial statements and notes to the financial statements.
Performs Self Review of own workpapers prior to submitting to direct supervisor.
Prepares audit programs, time budgets and planning documentation.
Develops staff and provides on the job training for them.
Provides timely feedback to Supervisors / Managers in preparing performance evaluations of staff accountants.
Demonstrates a strong working knowledge of accounting, tax and other applicable software.
Participates in selected committees and functions.

The successful and ideal candidates will possess:
A proven track record of academic and professional excellence
A Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting and eligible to sit for the CPA Exam; CPA Licensure is highly desirable, but not required
Minimum of 2 years of recent audit experience in a public accounting firm REQUIRED.
Big 4 Experience or Regional is great!
Demonstrated skills and experience in managing goals through collaboration and teamwork
Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills required
Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills required - ability to create formulas (including V-lookups a plus)
Excellent mathematical and computational skills
Ability to apply strong problem solving techniques
A GREAT and POSITIVE attitude, outstanding client service skills, and a desire to learn and grow!
Experience with Non-Profit/Yellow-Book Audits a PLUS!

Why You Should Consider BMF

Bober Markey Fedorovich is passionate about our employees and their well-being. Our highly competitive benefits package is what sets us apart from so many Firms. We are proud to offer our employees these distinctive benefits:

PAID TIME OFF: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) Policy to cover vacation, illness, non-firm scheduled holidays and personal days

HEALTH/WELLNESS: Medical, dental & vision plans (dental & vision covered 100% by the firm), Wellness Incentive Programs, Free Fitness Center Access, Short/Long-Term Disability and Life Insurance, 401(k) with generous match

EMPLOYEE DEVELOPMENT: Continuing Professional Education - in house and off-site training provided, Tuition Reimbursement for credits needed to earn your CPA license, CPA Incentives- BONUS when you pass within 1 or 2 years of your hire date and 100% of Becker Review covered by the Firm, Peer Liaison Program, Advisory Council Program with ongoing year round performance feedback and leadership development training at all levels, Professional Dues Reimbursement.

OTHER BENEFITS: Financial Incentive Plan for staff-initiated new engagements, Monthly cell phone stipends for Supervisors+, Annual Bonus Program, Latest in state-of-the-art technology and software, including laptops, dual monitors, portable scanners so you have the tools to do your job from anywhere! And, an Enjoyable, Fun and Flexible Environment- where everyone from interns to partners are part of the team.

job_description.88:
Business Development Manager

Project Technologies & Services is a growing project management and engineering services company based in northeast Ohio. We serve customers in the industrial, manufacturing, and commercial business sectors. We are seeking an experienced full-time Business Development Manager. The role is to develop strategies and approaches to secure additional new business essential to the growth of Project Technologies and Services (PTS). The main goal of this position is to drive growth to positively impact the work flow for the company by creating, maintaining and managing client relationships and identifying new projects to pursue. This includes prospecting for new clients by networking and other means to generate interest from potential clients. The individual must develop rapport with new clients and provide support that will continually improve the relationship. The Business Development Manager must be tenacious, highly motivated and an energetic self-starter. The ideal candidate should possess a mix of technical skills, communication skills, networking skills and resource management skills and possess a strong network of vendors, contractors, clients, managers, engineers and designers. Also, this individual must have excellent verbal and written skills and have the ability to interact professionally and effectively with all levels.

Essential functions/Major duties:
Analyze existing and potential clients and markets to identify and secure business development opportunities
Develop good customer relationship by personal visits, phone calls, follow ups etc.
Collaborate with PTS team to achieve targeted business goals
Maintain strong relationship with customers for future business growth
Carry out market research in order to develop strategies and plans to promote PTS products and services to secure business relations
Establish and maintain customer data base which includes marketing lists
Identify new sales leads and proactively seek new business opportunities
Attend marketing campaigns, trade shows, conferences and industry events to maximize PTS exposure
Advise on market conditions
Develop and utilize customer satisfaction surveys and campaigns that will help increase recognition of PTS
Develops new clients using prospective client lists. The candidate will use a mixture of email, phone, networking events, personal appointments and/or meetings to discuss present services
Ph: 844-877-4219

Fx: 440-236-8916

www.project-technologies.com

Requirements:
Industry experience preferred with proven abilities and expertise in
marketing and business development
Bachelor Degree preferred
High level of business acumen
Ability to prioritize tasks, recognize opportunities, influence and persuade
others to achieve desired outcomes
Ability to work under minimal supervision
Successful track record of B2B sales and negotiation
Must be able to work a flexible schedule
Must be able to develop fresh ideas and strategies
Proficiency in Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, Excel
and PowerPoint

Excellent salary, competitive benefit compensation, 401K match and paid time off

package offered. Send resume to:

Glenn McCarthy at: gmccarthy@project-technologies.com

Our Mission Statements:

To our clients

To provide our clients with direct and honest information they need to assist them in

making an educated and informed decision regarding their business and assist

them through the project, as they request, in order to ensure their success.

To our employees

To provide our employees with a fun and friendly environment that allows

opportunity to grow and learn and more importantly to maintain a balance with

the rest of their life commitments.

As a Miller-Valentine Project Manager, you provide the daily technical direction of the design, estimate preparation, and execution of multiple construction projects with the collaboration of the Senior Project Manager and Project Superintendent. It is your job to understand, communicate, and ensure that the vision of the customer is met on every project.

Why MVG?

At Miller-Valentine Group, you join a team of dedicated Associates that work together to deliver a rewarding, worry-free experience to fulfill a wide range of construction needs. As a nationally recognized contractor, Miller-Valentine has developed and/or built over 16,000 multifamily units and 100 million square feet of commercial space over its 55+ year history. We are committed to quality and integrity in all aspects of our business. We offer competitive wages, benefits, career advancement possibilities, and an engaging culture based on excellence. With offices in Dayton and Cincinnati, OH, as well as Columbia and Charleston, SC, we offer a variety of employment opportunities in multiple locations. If you are ready to take your career to the next level, consider joining our team of highly successful individuals. BUILD DREAMS. CHANGE LIVES.

Project Pursuit:
Assist in the strategy creation for all project estimates
Preparation of “scope of work” for vendor solicitation

Create technical specification for project proposals
Assemble bid analysis
Provide direction of project design team
Project Execution:

Ensure all construction drawings are complete (seek input from Superintendent)
Prepare project cost projection updates

Research cost effective solutions to project problems
Manage overall project profitability with collaboration with the Project Superintendent
Facilitate client meetings (with meeting notes)
Foster client relationships
Mentoring of Assistant Project Managers and Project Technicians
Participate in sales strategy sessions
Continuous pursuit of cost saving and process improvement strategies
Capable of handling multiple projects/estimates simultaneously
Ability to identify problems and present solutions to leadership.

Experience using Microsoft, Viewpoint, Procore, and Bluebeam.

job_description.96:
Title: On-Call Concierge, Columbus

FLSA Status: Non-exempt

Best Upon Request Corporate Inc., headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, is a national provider of on-site concierge services as an employee benefit to innovative organizations and as a patient amenity in healthcare. We improve organizational culture by decreasing stress for employees and taking care of patients’ non-clinical needs.

A Best Place to Work finalist, Best Upon Request is a growing, values-based company that creates life-enriching experiences for our clients and customers, team members and community.

Position Summary/Objective:

This position is based on-site at our client’s location in your area. A Best Upon Request concierge proactively generates requests from the eligible population he or she serves. Utilization of the service is key to a successful concierge program. In addition, a concierge responds to incoming customer requests, either fulfilling directly or partnering with our many local and national vendors. The on-call concierge is very similar to being a substitute teacher. The ideal candidate has the ability to work without guaranteed hours and be available when called upon.

Accountable for:

Concierge

· Delivering excellent customer service

· Anticipating and addressing customers’ needs

· Fulfilling customer requests, running errands, coordinating travel needs, performing and presenting information research and various other personal service requests

· Managing effectively a fast-paced environment with numerous projects

· Achieving daily and monthly metrics regarding customer utilization, satisfaction, volume of requests, and usage of our service management platform

· Maintaining confidential and proprietary company and customer information and assets

· Living out our core values

Success Management

· Connecting regularly with Concierge Coach

· Developing and maintaining positive working relationships with our client liaison, executive sponsor, customers and vendors

· Participating in BEST and Client meetings

· Recording accurate data and operating point-of-sale service management platform daily

· Closing daily and monthly petty cash

· Reconciling corporate credit card accounts

· Reconciling site inventory

· Verifying site charges for invoicing

Marketing and Customer Engagement

· Attending benefits fairs, new-hire orientations, BEST grand openings and open houses

· Presenting to departments or other groups

· Educating potential customers on enrollment process

· Rounding to potential customers and customers for marketing purposes

· Garnering customer feedback form responses

· Leveraging BEST’s customer marketing team to produce and distribute communications to potential customers and current customers

Vendor and Program Development/Maintenance

· Qualifying new vendors

· Negotiating vendor discounts for customers

· Creating special promotions in collaboration with vendors to encourage customer and service utilization

· Ensuring fully-stocked inventory such as stamps, tickets, gift cards, etc.

· Developing vendor fairs

Qualifications:

· One year of customer service experience

· Must be able to meet the availability and flexibility requirements

· Point of sale system experience and strong data entry accuracy skills

· Proficient in Microsoft Office; Word, Excel, Outlook

· Knowledge of excellent customer service techniques through means of being a servant-leader

· The ability to demonstrate trustworthiness within the customer interfacing environment

· Ability to communicate effectively within a team environment through listening and responding appropriately

· Demonstration of excellent time management skills when handling multiple tasks

· The ability to analyze a situation and respond appropriately with a solution

· Strong entrepreneurial skills in terms of marketing services and customer engagement

Preferred Qualifications:

· Three to five years of customer service experience

· Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree

Other:

· Daily reliable transportation; Ability to meet minimum vehicle insurance liability coverage

· Ability to pass a background check, credit check and drug screen

· Compliance with quality assurance standards, expectations and all company policies and procedures

· Must be able to stand, sit and walk for extended periods of time, and move, lift, carry, push and pull objects weighing 25 pounds on a regular basis and up to 50 pounds on occasion.
job_description.97:
Business Analyst Job Overview & Purpose:
The role of the Business Analyst is to work with multiple project stakeholders to effectively gather, document, configure, test, and deliver trainings on the solution as it relates to the implementation of our flagship product, AmpliFund. In the event that new features are requested by the customer, this role would document the new requirements and transition this knowledge to the Product Development team. This individual will become a product subject matter expert to best understand and apply client goals to product abilities. Additionally, the Business Analyst may assist in additional project responsibilities, including but not limited to, project planning, creation of status reports, time tracking, project financials, creation and delivery of training materials, product support, etc.
This position works closely with the Implementation Team Leads, Project Managers, Customer Service Representatives, Product, and Development resources to ensure the successful implementation of AmpliFund. This position would ultimately report to the Director of Delivery.
Essential Job Duties:
Leads or actively participates in all requirement workshops
Responsible for documenting all findings and outcomes of requirement workshops
Work with AmpliFund Implementation Team to identify and document functional gaps
Elicit, document, and communicate functional and technical requirements
Analyzes functional system processes. Provide guidelines on business process mapping and process workflow documentations
Documents mapping of requirements to AmpliFund base and configurable system functionality
Builds and maintains requirements traceability matrix, gap analysis, issues and enhancement logs, and other internal and external facing tracking tools
Provides AmpliFund functional expertise to support client
Configures AmpliFund functionality per client’s requirements
Create and execute test cases to ensure solution meets the documented requirements
Documents any issues identified during testing and provides results to appropriate project team personnel for resolution
Deliver implementation, train-the-trainer, and end user training sessions based on team developed training strategies and scenarios
Communicate with the Product Development team to document new features and enhancements
Review and validate project-related new development to ensure the functionality meets the approved requirements
Document application defects that are a result of requirement non-conformance
Participate in project status meetings
Report project status and potential project risks to stakeholders on an ongoing basis
Non-traditional hours may be needed, but not weekends
Perform other job-related duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
2+ years implementing software solutions, ideally in an Enterprise-wide setting
2+ years related experience, preferably in within grants management, a nonprofit or public sector environment
2+ years experience in working directly with clients
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, particularly with requirements gathering and documentation for concurrent projects
Strong communication skills with the ability to present information in verbal, written or visual form to a variety of audiences, from the internal team to client executives
Ability to self-manage and be an independent member within the larger project team
The ability to interact with business clients and internal teams simultaneously to bridge gaps and manage communications
Ability to translate an idea or need into a completed solution
Familiarity with software design and development
Experience training or teaching customers/clients
Experience with database and report development preferred
Ability to travel up to 25%
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Preferred:
Experience in the Nonprofit Sector & Public Sector
Basic Accounting knowledge a plus
Experience teaching and training—specifically virtually
Stable work history
Professional in nature, reliable and punctual
Passionate about exceeding goals and delivering a result
Team oriented and comfortable with regular performance feedback
Organized, focused and persistent
Flexible, adaptable and dedicated
Bilingual in Spanish a plus
Compensation Package:
A competitive base salary plus bonus
Unlimited PTO
The ability to immediately join our benefits plan, including a 401k plan
A newly renovated office environment in downtown Cleveland, overlooking Progressive field
Supplemented parking
Supplemented gym membership
Detailed attention to your personal development plan
Opportunity for advancement, based on performance
Sound like a good fit? Contact us to apply.
job_description.98:
Job Description
Are you looking to join a company with a hospitality mindset and a family atmosphere?

Central Mutual Insurance Company is looking for an Administrative Specialist in our Central Support Department with advanced Microsoft Office Skills, administrative experience, and a passion for a fast paced and dynamic work environment that requires continuous multi-tasking and prioritization.

This will also include:
Coordinating various company meetings and events

Creating, updating, and compiling a variety of reports
Organizing and preparing meeting materials

Calendar management
Providing administrative assistance across the organization as needed
We are seeking someone with the following skills:
Advanced experience and proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite, with an emphasis on Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook calendar management
Demonstrated success in data management and report generation, including charts, graphs, and spreadsheets using Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
One to three years’ experience in an administrative role
Communicate effectively and professionally
Excellent organizational skills with high attention to detail

Effective multi-tasking

Company Description
Founded as the Central Mutual Insurance Company in 1876, the Central Insurance Group of companies has evolved into a successful property and casualty group operating on a strong foundation of core values including Integrity in the way we operate our business; Relationships we develop working as a team and sharing in each other's successes; and Excellence achieved by never compromising on quality, providing superior performance, and pursuing continual improvements.
job_description.100:
C&E Advanced Technologies, an Ohio-based distributor of automation products used in manufacturing, is growing and building an inside sales team. We’re looking for talented people who are passionate about work and solving customer challenges in a fast-paced, high energy work environment. You will be a key member of a new team focused on the execution of innovative sales campaigns that drive revenue and market share growth.
We offer great benefits and a competitive compensation package, including:
Competitive salary, commensurate with skills and experience
Dental, Vision, Disability, and Medical coverage with HSA option
401k/Profit Sharing
Paid Time Off
Paid Holidays
A collaborative, empowering, and positive company culture
As an Inside Sales Coordinator based in our Dayton, Ohio corporate office, you will be responsible for promoting automation products and solutions across a four-state area.
The successful candidate will be part of a team making outbound calls to develop new and existing customers. You’ll be working with field Technology Consultants, that will be your eyes and ears in the field when the customer needs that level of attention. This position will report to the Campaign Coordinator.
Expectations and responsibilities:
Work directly with maintenance, engineering and procurement clients discussing their needs and then developing customized solutions.
Driving sales growth by facilitating the end-to-end sales process, from prospecting to completion of the sale.
Ability to utilize technology to engage clients.
Meet and exceed individual daily, weekly, and monthly goals.
Outbound calls (60-80 per day).
Promotion of products and systems; Product demonstrations via the web.
Opportunity Management & CRM utilization.
Working collaboratively with other departments to solve customer challenges.
Coordinating the activities of an outside Technology Consultants.
Completing tasks accurately and with a sense of urgency.
Basic requirements include:
High aptitude with technology, in general.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to details.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, Word, and Outlook.
What’s a typical day look like?
After the morning sales huddle where you review the active product campaign and refine your sales approach, you start calling prospects and existing customers.
During one of your calls, you are told the prospect doesn’t need the specific product that you were promoting, but you also learn that the prospect failed an OSHA visit this week and they need to improve their equipment safety or face heavy fines. After a conversation with the customer, you realize that the customer needs someone onsite to determine how the safety improvements will impact work flow. You schedule a field Technical Consultant to visit the next day.
After the appointment, the Technical Consultant advises you of the types of products needed. You record the details of the appointment in the CRM, develop a bill of material, checking with safety specialists on the products you weren’t sure about, and then provide that bill of material to customer service for quotation.
You follow up with the prospect immediately after they’ve received the quotation to answer any questions and make sure they’re happy with the solution you provided. The customer provides you with a purchase order, which you forward to customer service for processing; while you schedule a follow up call to the customer after they’ve received the equipment.
Every day you will be doing work that really matters, helping customers solve their business challenges. You will have an opportunity to do your best work and have a real impact.
Let’s talk. If you are passionate about work and solving customer challenges in a fast-paced, high energy work environment, and looking to further your knowledge and skills, then let’s have a conversation. We’ll keep it confidential.
This is a non-exempt, hourly, full-time position. You will be eligible to share in the quarterly team bonus after your 3rd quarter of employment.

Position Summary
SSOE Group is seeking a talented Project Controller and/or Assistant Project Manager for our Toledo or Midland office. In either role, the candidate will help support Engineers, Project Managers, and design professionals support internal and external clients.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Assist Project Managers with day to day project tasks.
Creating and maintaining project status reports, including meeting with project team members to gather information.
Assisting with developing schedules for proposals and projects.
Monitoring engineering budgets, costs and schedule.
May attend meetings with clients.
Manage single / two discipline projects while being mentored by Project Manager.
Responsbilities may include working the with estimating and cost group to help develop estimates and manage cost.

Minimum Education and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree / ENTRY / 3-5
OSHA 10/30-hour Construction Certificate preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

For APM:
Bachelor Degree in Engineering which qualifies for licensure in the state of practice or an Associate degree in the engineering field is preferred.
CAPM Certification is encouraged
A minimum one (1) year experience as an Engineer 1 or a minimum three (3) years related experience.
Travel required.
Good facilitator with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experienced in the following software packages: (Microsoft Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint and CADD). Primavera P6 is a plus.
For PC:

Must be a quick learner, detail-oriented and possess strong interpersonal communication skills.
Experienced in the following software packages: (Microsoft Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint and CADD). Primavera is a plus.

About SSOE Group

As a Top 10 Engineering / Architecture firm for the past 6 years (BD+C), SSOE focuses on delivering Great Client Service to clients through a full range of project delivery solutions. They have been named a "Great Workplace" (Great Place to Work®) and one of the "Best AEC Firms to Work For" (BD+C).

With more than 20 offices around the world, SSOE is known for making its clients successful by saving them time, trouble, and money. Over the company's 70-year history, it has earned a reputation for providing quality project solutions to semiconductor, automotive, food, chemical, glass, manufacturing, healthcare, power, and general building industries—with projects completed in 40 countries. Visit www.ssoe.com for additional information and career opportunities.
SSOE was founded in 1948 and currently has more than 20 locations worldwide.
We are a global project delivery firm for architecture, engineering, and construction management.
SSOE offers program management services from design through construction, to commissioning and start-up, for seamless project delivery.
9 out of 10 clients surveyed would recommend us to a colleague.
95% of our fee has been returned to our clients in project savings over the last 5 years.
150 of our clients have been with us for over 20 years.

Equal Opportunity and Disability Accessibility Statement

SSOE is an equal opportunity employer and provides fair and equal treatment to all individuals, employees, and applicants for employment, regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, disability, genetic information, military / veteran status, or any other protected group status under federal, state, or local law. SSOE complies with the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986 and related laws. SSOE does not make employment decisions based upon any protected status under applicable federal, state, or local law.

Applicants with a disability, who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, may email their request to hrassist@ssoe.com for assistance. Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodations will be made on a case-by-case basis.

Job Title: Senior Investment Analyst - Member Directed Plan & External Management

with opportunity to participate in the OPERS Incentive Compensation Program

Accepting Applications Internally: Yes
Accepting Applications Externally: No

*Please read the OPERS Personal Trading Policy prior to applying. All candidates must be able to abide by the policy in order to be considered for employment.

SUMMARY: This position in the External Public Markets Group will work primarily on the OPERS Member Directed Plan and the sourcing and oversight of minority, women and disabled veteran majority owned firms. Additional work on externally managed assets in the OPERS Defined Benefit/Health Care Plans would also be required. This individual will work under the direction of the Senior Portfolio Manager-External Public Markets with latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Responsible for the OPERS Member Directed Plan and serves as Chairperson of the Defined Contribution Funds Staff Investment Committee (“DCFSIC”).
Serves as the primary subject matter expert on Defined Contribution (“DC”) trends and issues.
Presents to the OPERS Board on the OPERS DC Plan and DC trends.
Responsible for innovating/improving the OPERS Member Directed Plan. Sources investment strategies and, if necessary, risk systems.
Acts as the primary point of contact for the OPERS DC consultant.
Assists the OPERS Benefits and Investment Accounting/Finance divisions with the DC Plan.
Produces high quality reporting on the DC program for internal and external users.
Sources investment talent for OPERS External Public Markets team; Notably minority, women and disabled veterans’ majority owned investment firms.
Monitors existing external investment managers including leading manager portfolio review calls and meetings. Assists in other monitoring and searches for the External Public Markets team as needed.
Interacts with internal and external parties including existing external managers, prospects, consultants, external legal counsel, OPERS Benefits, Investment Accounting, IT and Legal.
Works with OPERS Communications on the DC Member newsletter and OPERS website.
Assists or leads projects related to External Public Markets and/or the Investments Division.
May assist with training of analysts.
Must comply with OPERS Personal Trading compliance procedures.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Education
High school diploma or GED
Required

Bachelor’s degree
Required

MBA or Master’s Degree in Related Field
Preferred

Qualifications
Strong multitasking, writing and time management skills
Required

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Required

Self-starter with leadership skills and strong interest in global financial markets
Required

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Required

Ability to apply advanced mathematical concepts such as applying mathematical operations to such tasks as probability and statistical inference, test reliability validity, analysis of variance and correlation techniques
Required

Must have ability to travel both domestically and internationally
Required

Experience
5 years of investment related experience.
Required

Experience working with member directed issues/ plans, external managers and/or direct management of investment portfolios.
Preferred

Proficient, with intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Windows operating system; MS Word; MS Excel; MS PowerPoint; Internet Explorer (browser software) and MS Outlook
Required

Aladdin, Bloomberg, and MSCI Risk Manager software experience
Preferred

Certifications/Licenses
Chartered Financial Analyst or progress towards completion; Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst
Preferred

Within six months of hire, the candidate must meet the eligibility requirements to be licensed as a State Retirement System Investment Officer (SRSIO), which requires either:

job_description.104:
The Operations Manager is responsible for managing and directing daily inbound and outbound warehouse operations including but not limited to product receiving, product replenishment, order selection, order loading, facility expense and revenue management and adherence to company policies and government regulations while ensuring superior customer service and the safety & security of designated facility.

• Manage the daily workload and safety of Warehouse Supervisors and associates. Review and set priorities to ensure orders are correct, complete and leave on time to ensure excellent customer service.
• Manage the proper selection, purchase and utilization of Company assets in support of warehouse operations. Coordinate with other departments as necessary to ensure upgrades and repairs are completed efficiently and effectively.
• Proactively look ahead to meet/exceed anticipated workloads. Establish and implement processes and systems to efficiently meet inventory management goals and work with the Regional
Director to help improve service levels for the facility, region, and the company.
• Suggest efficiency ideas, cost reduction measures and assist with the implementation of changes with inbound and outbound warehouse operations. Identify problems and propose solutions to other members of management and promote cooperation with other departments.
• Daily review shipping and loading audits ensuring all required documentation is accurately completed and material is handled and stored correctly with minimum potential for loss.
• Ensure day to day management and associate activities are in alignment with safety strategy. Maintain safe and healthy work environment.
• Direct, coordinate and monitor the daily activities & performance of Operations team to assure compliance of standard Company policies, procedures, quality and safety. Coach and develop
team in balancing the delivery of high productivity, quality and customer service. Maintain a positive and safe work environment.
• Oversee employee relations and participate in staff selection, performance and compensation evaluations, corrective action and terminations, as necessary. Establish performance goals, monitor progress and provide feedback as necessary. Manage employee performance through motivation, delegation, development, mentoring and resolving conflict. Take corrective action as necessary on a timely basis and in accordance with company policy. Provide and/or coordinate training as needed. Consult with Human Resources Department as appropriate.
• Conduct regular department meetings to foster employee engagement, communicate any changes to company policies and procedures, address employee concerns, foster idea sharing and
suggestions for improvement.

Strong understanding of budgeting and ability to interrupt P&L’s.
Excellent communication (verbal and written), interpersonal and professional interactive skills are necessary to perform at a high degree of proficiency. Ability to effectively write reports, present information and respond to questions from suppliers, customers, management and inter-department staff. Capable of working with internal staff from other departments in a proactive and constructive manner.
Strong leadership skills, including the ability to mentor and develop individuals and teams. Able to engage and lead team discussions and meetings. Understands team dynamics and works well within a team structure. Collaborative management style and strategic team player. Delegates responsibilities effectively.
A mastery of organizational and project management skills, including the ability to plan, prioritize and execute multiple initiatives/deadlines autonomously and shift priorities as necessary. Able to manage large, complex projects. Uses time effectively and able to work independently.
Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills.
Ability to build working relationships with internal business partners, vendors and customers.
Customer Service – Respond promptly to requests for service and assistance as needed. Follow up as needed.
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner. Expertise in gathering and analyzing information skillfully. Develops alternative solutions.
Judgment - Displays willingness to make decisions. Exhibits sound and accurate judgment. Makes timely decisions.
Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner. Reacts well under pressure. Follows through on commitments.
Detail Oriented – Attention to details and accuracy.
Ability to understand and execute all relevant policies and procedures in a consistent, timely and objective manner.
Strong understanding of financial concepts (including pricing and forecasting)
Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time. Ensures work responsibilities and customer requirements are covered when absent. Arrives at meetings and appointments on time.
Proficient use of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Project, and Outlook) required.
Familiarity with High Jump, People Soft, Voice Recognition and RF devices preferred.
5-7 years of related operations and management experience in a warehouse or distribution environment.
Travel (approx. 10%) may be required to visit other Warehouses Distribution Centers and office locations, customer meetings, company events, staff meetings, training sessions, and/or industry or vendor trade shows
May be required to utilize personal vehicle for business travel. Must maintain a valid driver license and provide proof of current automobile insurance coverage as set forth by Sysco.
This position may require evening, weekend or other shift work depending on business needs.
Must be familiar with OSHA regulations.
Bachelor’s Degree required or 10+ years’ equivalent education and experience.
job_description.105:
Bold Penguin is a fast growing Software as a Service company building innovative solutions using modern technology for commercial insurance agents. We favor modern but proven technologies and our stack currently includes Linux, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Ruby on Rails, Angular, Puma, MySQL, PostgresSQL, Redis, and Capistrano.
JOB SUMMARY
We’re seeking a full stack Software Engineer who will serve as a cross-functional member of the engineering team who embraces DevOps culture and practices. We’re at a pivotal point where we’re building the platform that will serve as the foundation for the business for years to come.
SKILLS
Builds web frontend applications using technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and TypeScript including frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue
Engineers backend services and APIs using Ruby on Rails
Integrates with third party APIs such as Twilio and with various insurance carriers
Creates automated tests to ensure our applications are reliable
Automates the deployment pipeline to enable frequent deployments and consistent builds from development through production
Shares responsibility for site reliability engineering first designing resilient systems and applications, troubleshoots performance or availability issues, and participates in the on call rotation
Creates relational database schemas and performs query optimization as well as using in memory data stores
Collaborates closely with Systems and Security Engineers to build secure and reliable applications

QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years relevant experience building scalable and functional applications, including two years of Ruby.
Experience in technology companies and startups using open source technologies including Linux, Git, AWS, and modern development environments
Expert in either frontend or backend but capable with both.
Familiar with a microservice architecture

To learn more about Bold Penguin’s results-focused culture and employee-focused perks, read more on our jobs page.

Metal-Matic, Inc. is a progressive and major manufacturer in highly engineered steel tubing. We provide products to OEMs in multiple industries including automotive, construction, agriculture, appliance, energy, recreation and many others.
Position Overview
The Quality Manager position is responsible for the development, management and improvement on new and existing Metal-Matic quality system components that ultimately supports continued value to our customers.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Translates applicable industry standards or customer specific requirements into the organizational structure and processes.
Develops an understanding of core processes that supports specified requirements, including gap identification and helps facilitate continual improvement across all functional areas.
Supports Metal-Matic in the support of customer and regulatory audits and visits. Drives closure and the coordination of reported non-conformities.
Assists in the completion and or submission of APQP, PPAP Control Plans, FMEA, Gage R&R, Capability Studies, Layout, etc. for new and existing product.
Ensure compliance to ISO/IATF management system requirements and keeps abreast to changes.
Supervises and assigns duties to Quality Inspectors.
Responsible for coordinating and maintaining all Calibration activities, both internally and outside services.
Oversees laboratory activities, including chemical testing of processing fluids.
Drive continuous improvement activities that support Key Performance Indicators
Desired and/or Required Skills/Experience
Leadership experience
Good mechanical aptitude
Sound problem solving skills with familiarity with 8-D, 5-Why, Fishbone, etc.…
Ability to manage time efficiently and address multiple tasks
Proficient computer skills and demonstrated competence to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.…
Knowledge of calibration, inspection methods, blueprint reading, GD&T, statistics, and process capability
Strong written/verbal communication skills
Familiarity with ISO/IATF 16949
General understanding of Automotive quality requirements, i.e., APQP, PPAP, FMEA and MSA
Education Requirement
Bachelor’s degree in an Engineering discipline
Metal-Matic is an equal opportunity employer. We offer a competitive compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefits including healthcare, 401(k) match, profit sharing, education reimbursement and annual bonus potential. Relocation assistance is available for the ideal candidate.
If you are looking to align your career with a strong and stable company, please submit your resume to careers@metal-matic.com.
