job_description.108:
Senior Billing Consultant

Cincinnati, OH

Job Summary

The Senior Billing Consultant is responsible for the operational oversight of the billing application with focus on invoice accuracy for all Paycor clients. The Senior Billing Consultant is responsible for creating, performing, and monitoring audits to ensure client billing is accurately stated. This position will monitor and pursue improvement by evaluating, reporting and driving resolution for system issues and inaccuracies. The Senior Billing Consultant will excel in developing reporting metrics which will include Billing and Adjustment reporting. In addition, this position performs user acceptance testing prior to all billing system releases. The Senior Billing Consultant has primary contact with internal Client Service representatives, Sales representatives and on occasion with clients.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Develops creative solutions when evaluating complex system issues & inaccuracies and drives to resolution
Reviews and audits all clients set up in the billing system to ensure accuracy of invoices and correct billing for services performed
Reviews, monitors and approves billing adjustments; uses sound judgment by appropriately applying and adhering to the companys delegation of authority policy
Analyze current processes & procedures and streamline using techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results
Keeps functional leaders informed of emerging issues
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of Paycors products, pricing models and billing system configuration
Performs user acceptance testing prior to system releases by testing new functionality, changes to existing program logic and regression testing
Supports the annual audit process by providing data samples and other billing information as needed
Performs month-end responsibilities that focus on accurate revenue recognition
Sets the semi-annual price increase process for existing clients
Partners with Sales on pricing deals
Requirements
5+ years experience in a system support role including one or more of client service, problem solving, invoicing or billing responsibilities
Bachelors degree in Accounting or Business strongly preferred
Intermediate to advanced Excel user
Strong knowledge of billing processes
Excellent analytical, interpersonal & communication skills
Demonstrated accountability for a high degree of accuracy
General understanding of system configuration and data base structure
Knowledge of Paycor products and pricing strongly preferred
Join our team to make a difference in peoples lives, every day. We empower our clients to spend less time on administrative tasks and more time developing their teams. We rally around our colleagues and succeed together. And we support and give back to our communities. Together, we can make a difference.
job_description.109:
Make a difference with a career in insurance
At The Cincinnati Insurance Companies, we put people first and apply the Golden Rule to our daily operations. To put this into action, we’re looking for extraordinary people to join our talented team. Our service-oriented, ethical, knowledgeable, caring associates are the heart of our vision to be the best company serving independent agents. We help protect families and businesses as they work to prevent or recover from a loss. Share your talents to help us reach for continued success as we bring value to the communities we serve and demonstrate that Actions Speak Louder in Person®.
If you’re ready to build productive relationships, collaborate within a diverse team, embrace challenges and develop your skills, then Cincinnati may be the place for you. We offer career opportunities where you can contribute and grow.
Start your journey with us
The Cincinnati Insurance Companies' Commercial Lines department is currently seeking candidates for an underwriting assistant class beginning October 2019. Underwriting assistants support underwriters in all aspects of renewal and post-issue transactions.
Starting Hourly Rate of Pay: $16.50/hr
Be Ready To:
underwrite and process smaller renewal policies
apply knowledge of coverage forms, rating plans and guidelines in selection and pricing of individual risks and change requests
ensure adequate pricing through proper classification, predictive modeling, accuracy of information and adherence to company underwriting standards and philosophies
support underwriting decisions on all other accounts through file preparation and documentation by gathering information and analyzing and evaluating risk exposure
manage agency requests and communicate directly with the agency to gather needed information
research and gather needed information in regards to coverage questions, state issues, workflows and refer to underwriter and team leader when necessary
handle a rating territory in addition to the responsibilities listed above
act as a resource for team assistants and help to strengthen their processing skills and assist with processing rating work as needed
handle special projects and assignments as directed
Be Equipped With:
strong verbal and written communication skills to explain, persuade and present information
the ability to multitask and the ability to prioritize work
excellent attention to detail
the ability to work independently and proactively in an orderly and timely manner
highly developed analytical and problem solving skills
the capacity to develop positive working relationships with team members and agents by working to find possible solutions and options that are beneficial to all
proficiency in Microsoft® Word, Excel and Outlook is preferred
AINS certification is preferred, but completion within three years of start date if selected for the position is also acceptable
You've Earned:
an associate's or bachelor's degree is preferred
or two or more years of insurance related work experience; Associate in General Insurance (AINS) designation preferred
Enhance your talents
Providing outstanding service and developing strong relationships with our independent agents are hallmarks of our company. Whether you have experience from another carrier or you’re new to the insurance industry, we promote a lifelong learning approach. Cincinnati provides you with the tools and training to be successful and to become a trusted, respected insurance professional – all while enjoying a meaningful career.
Enjoy benefits and amenities
Your commitment to providing strong service, sharing best practices and creating solutions that impact lives is appreciated. To increase the well-being and satisfaction of our associates, we offer a variety of benefits and amenities. Learn more about our benefits and amenities packages at www.cinfin.com.
Embrace a diverse team
As a relationship-based organization, we welcome and value a diverse workforce. We grant equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race; creed; color; sex, including sexual orientation; religion; national origin; age; disability; or any other basis prohibited by law. job_description.111:
Position: Financial Business Analyst

Business: Aspire Energy

Location: Orrville, OH

Responsible for exhibiting Chesapeake Utilities Corporation’s Mission, Vision and Values, regarding external customers, agencies, vendors, internal departments and co-workers. The position provides financial analysis for the Aspire Energy unit, functions as the main point of contact for the Corporate Financial Reporting department, coordinates with other Business Planning Analysts to meet department goals, and is responsible for the development of capital reporting requirements. Responsible for the efficient operation of the business planning process including strategic planning, budgeting, financial review, and forecasting. The financial services aspect of this position will focus on financial statement analysis, capital budget management, forecasting, the annual budget process, and the business unit’s internal controls and processes. The administrative services aspect of this position will focus on administrative support and assistance for the operations personnel, including such areas as capital project reporting, accounts payable processing, inventory control, and vehicle fleet management. Actively supports and participates in Aspire Energy’s short and long-term strategic planning efforts.

Primary duties and responsibilities include:
Responsible for the timely and efficient administration of the budget and planning process.
Responsible for preparing monthly reporting and meeting with appropriate management to discuss department expense summaries and performance metrics.
Actively participates in strategic and financial planning strategies that accomplish the goals and objectives of the business unit. This includes the development of written business plans and presentations along communicating these plans
Prepares the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statement analysis for the business unit, including the income statement and balance sheet. General focus is on actual to actual and actual to budget comparisons.
Prepares the income statement and balance sheet forecast process, including the capital budget forecast in conjunction with the requirements of the corporate office.
Presentation of all analysis shall be compiled and presented in a clear and concise manner.
Analyze and evaluate all relevant business unit financial information and present any findings and recommendations to improve performance and/or maintain financial and operational consistency within the business unit.
Responsible for the preparation of the monthly margin analytics.
Responsible for updating margin, customer& volume reporting.
Coordinate financial activities and maintain effective and efficient working relationships with Accounting and Financial Performance departments at the corporate office.
Prepares the Company’s quarterly financial and disclosure certification process.
Prepares the business unit’s annual operating and capital budgets. Works with all business unit departments to develop department budgets during this process. Responsible for presentation of this material to management.
Directly support internal business unit operations with capital project management reporting tools along with inventory management reporting tools.
Directly support internal business unit operations with administrative assistance with respect to paperwork processing, accounts payable management, and other areas such as vehicle fleet management.
Additional Responsibilities:
Perform other duties as necessary within the department and the business unit to fulfill the obligations and responsibilities of the department in meetings its goals, objectives, and strategies.
Perform special projects as assigned and make recommendations to business unit and executive management teams as necessary.
Support the goals, objectives, and strategies of other departments within the business unit, other business units, as well as the overall corporation.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Requires……a total commitment to Chesapeake Utilities Corporation’s Mission, Vision and Values and:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting.
Five to Ten Years’ experience.
Strong ability is required in communicating, both orally and in writing.
A high level of visual acuity is needed to work with numbers.
Strong organizational and analytical skills required to handle several projects at one time.
A high level of mental activity is needed in order to analyze data and make judgments. A strong ability with math is necessary to ensure accuracy of data.
Must be able to prepare clear and comprehensive written document and convey detailed or important information to others. Responsibility of position also requires in depth analysis and reasoning.
Ability to handle stress is required in order to function effectively.
Knowledge in the Microsoft Office suite of software.
Knowledge of Microsoft FRx suite of software.
Knowledge of company tariffs.
Must have a high level of initiative and be able to be self-directed.
Working Conditions:
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Ability to spend many hours working at personal computer. Not a physically demanding position. Ability to travel occasionally at different times.
MENTAL REQUIREMENTS: N/A
HAZARDS:
SURROUNDINGS: Office surroundings
Requirements
Five to Ten

Founded in 1971, MRI Software is a leading provider of innovative real estate software applications and hosted solutions. job_description.114:
Trellis Rx is a technology-enabled service provider that partners with health systems to fund, build, and operate world-class specialty pharmacies on their behalf, with their brand. Trellis enables health systems to deliver enhanced experiences and outcomes by helping them offer concierge level clinical and administrative support to patients throughout their course of therapy. We believe pharmacists and pharmacy technicians are critical additions to the care team and that an exceptional pharmacy team makes superior results possible.

Trellis is seeking highly motivated and customer service oriented pharmacy professionals who want to elevate their career to the next level. We are currently building a team of Pharmacy Liaisons at Summa Health Systems in Akron, OH to provide outstanding service to patients with complex, specialty diseases to help them achieve improved clinical outcomes.

* * Pharmacy Technicians are highly encouraged to apply! * *

You would be responsible for:
Educating our health system customer's leadership and clinic staff on the Trellis model to gain their support
Initializing and leading ongoing work in our customers' clinics and ensuring that the patient/Trellis engagement is appropriate and consistent with their preferences. This includes:
Ensuring that every patient who can benefit from specialty pharmacy services is identified and met in clinic upon arrival
Explaining the benefits of enrolling into our customer's specialty pharmacy program without impeding patient choice of pharmacy, and achieving patient participation
Successfully enrolling patients into the program
Performing all benefits investigation, prior authorization, and financial assistance work needed to ensure patients have access to the medication they need
Overseeing services provided to enrolled patients ensuring that everything from order entry to final verification is completed quickly, accurately, and in accordance with patient's needs
Providing direct support to enrolled patients to ensure that they are supported throughout their therapy regimen and achieve their intended outcome. This includes:
Conducting outbound phone calls for patient support, adherence checks, and refill reminders
Accepting inbound calls from patients, as needed and sharing in on call coverage to ensure 24/7 patient support
Appropriately triaging any clinical questions to an appropriate clinician (pharmacist, nurse, or provider)
Designing clinic workflows to help our customer deliver the Trellis experience to patients and developing new and improved processes for efficient, safe fulfillment of specialty medications
Participating in conferences and workshops to help promote Trellis Rx
Here's what we'd like to offer to you:
A platform to practice at the top of your license, and build a practice that could become the destination of choice for the best pharmacy technicians
The chance to work with a patient-centered, clinically oriented, collaborative team to deliver second to none specialty pharmacy patient care
An unmatched opportunity to grow as part of an early stage startup
Competitive compensation including a performance bonus
Generous benefits package including:
Health, Dental & Vision that are effective on day one of employment
401K with company match
12-week maternity leave with 100% of salary
6-week parental leave with 100% of salary
Short & Long-Term Disability
Generous Paid Time Off plus holidays and bereavement leave
Life insurance
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Fitness Reimbursement
Employee Assistance Program
Employee Discounts (retail, hotels, food, restaurants, car rentals, and much more)
We are excited to speak with someone who has:
Experience as a specialty pharmacy liaison or technician
Registered, or the ability to become registered as a pharmacy technician in the state of Ohio
Experience working with physicians, nurses, and other healthcare professionals (preferably in a medical clinic)
Knowledge of benefits investigation, prior authorization support, and patient financial assistance work
Strong people skills and the ability to work with teams across customers
Proficiency in standard workplace software (e.g., MS Office), EMR systems (e.g., EPIC, Cerner, or Meditech), and dispensing systems (e.g., QS1, RX30, or Computer Rx)
The ability to start from scratch, execute quickly and accurately without pre-defined processes and protocols, and an interest in defining such processes for the future
The patience to adapt to patients' and customers' preferences and processes, while always upholding Trellis standards
And bonus points if you have a couple of these, too:
Knowledge in the oncology and/or dermatology space
Experience in a health system specialty pharmacy as an in-clinic liaison

job_description.116:
We are SafeAuto:
SafeAuto is a thriving insurance company based in Columbus, Ohio. For over 25 years we have continued to provide our customers with engaging customer service and technology that makes insurance easy to understand. At SafeAuto, our culture, values, and commitment to diversity define who we are and what we do. We strive to provide a culture that is forward-thinking and inclusive. Here at SafeAuto, we value providing affordable car insurance to every customer so they can enjoy the road ahead.

The Road Ahead:
Our Product Management team is a culturally diverse group of inquisitive people charged with developing competitive product offerings that evolve to meet the needs of our customers, and managing those products state by state to meet our profitability objectives. As a member of the Product R&D Team, you will be uniquely situated to drive company performance as you apply advanced data and statistical modeling techniques to the effort of analyzing the performance and improving the design of our pricing segmentation model.
We seek people who are comfortable leveraging data and statistical skills combined with business knowledge and curiosity to explore structured and unstructured data from a variety of sources in the design of pricing and decision models that optimize risk selection, underwriting and pricing of insurance. Product R&D team members influence business decision-making by way of effective presentation of data and predictive analytics to educate business leaders at various levels of authority and technical knowledge. R&D analysts play a lead role in advancing the decision science capability of the company by way of direct and indirect leadership and mentorship of other data and business analysts.
The Nuts and Bolts:
Manages multiple projects to develop analyses and maintain models to provide the functionality necessary to drive profitable growth
Drives the initiative in developing and improving statistical models to solve business problems.
Follows a peer review and testing strategy.
Gathers, analyzes and interprets a wide variety of industry data, both internal and external, to support pricing, business, customer and/or financial objectives
Interprets statistical and analytical results and follows a feedback loop for model improvement including, but not limited to, comparison to prior model performance and competitor models
Designs proper statistical analyses to provide modeling support to meet Product Management’s objectives
Validates and updates models periodically and provides validation reports
Maintains model development and factor selection documentation

The Specs:

Bachelor's or higher degree with an emphasis in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Quantitative Research or 2-4 years business experience
In-depth knowledge of at least one of these tools or other relevant language (such as SAS, R, or Python)
Statistics – Applied experience in various areas in statistics including, but not limited to, descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, linear models, non-linear models, predictive analytics, forecasting, survival analysis, etc.
Visualization - An understanding of various methods for visualizing analyses and presenting data in a way that can be easily consumed by less technical staff
Unstructured data - It is critical that the candidate is proficient in working with unstructured data, from both internal and external sources and can perform quality checks on data sets to assess usability in a research and production capacity
Data Platforms / Data Access - Experience using SQL and SQL-based databases (MS SQL Server and/or DB2) is mandatory.
Some exposure to other data management platforms is desired (Hive, Pig, Hadoop, MongoDB, etc.)
Actuarial principles and techniques - Actuarial experience and credentials are a plus but not required.

Other Values:

Intellectual Curiosity: The spirit of data science is discovery. The candidate is motivated by an innate need to explore data in very creative ways to discover new truths and insights. Good at answering questions, and asking questions to move research forward
End-to-end problem-solving skills: Experience in utilizing the scientific method in a business setting to holistically define a problem, create an analysis plan to address the hypothesis, and formulate conclusions and actionable next steps
Business Acumen : Experience with different business processes and able to distill down “objective function” for a given problem. Is it an inventory management problem, a forecasting/prediction problem, investment optimization problem? How does the process influence the outcome? What levers are available to be changed and does the analysis point to specific actions that can be taken to change the outcome?
Communication Skills: Candidate can clearly and fluently translate their technical findings to a non-technical team, such as the Marketing or Sales departments, and provide quantitative, actionable conclusions and recommend next steps.
The Perks:
Comes Standard:
· Great benefits the day you start – health, dental, and vision
· Location, location, location! Go shopping on your break at Easton or hop on 270 for a quick trip home to say hi to your pets.
· Paid time off and eight (8) paid holidays so you can visit your family, take a trip, or enjoy a staycation
· 401k with company match
· Rewards for great work – yearly performance-based bonuses
· Opportunity for advancement in a growing company and industry
Included Luxuries:
· Casual dress – jeans and T-shirts encouraged
· Wellness Incentive program – coaches, fitness counseling, classes included
· Onsite café – late sleeper who never makes breakfast? We’ve got you covered. Breakfast and lunch available five days a week.

Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We give consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

job_description.118:
Overview


U Pull-&-Pay (UPAP) is a dynamic company with a nationwide network of retail self-serve used auto parts stores. As a customer focused organization, UPAP exists to provide low cost, used auto parts to our customers. Our inventory and interchange information services enhance the customer experience. Customers bring their own tools into UPAP stores and remove valuable auto parts from an environmentally processed inventory of autos. These auto parts are purchased according to a specific price list shared with our customers. UPAPs inventory of autos is rotated continuously.

UPAP is a wholly owned subsidiary of The David J Joseph Company (DJJ) which was founded in 1885 and is a world leader in scrap metal recycling & trading. With over 80 locations, the Joseph Company is headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio and is a wholly owned subsidiary of Nucor Corporation (NUE) a Fortune 200 Company. DJJ has a well-earned reputation for safety, integrity and innovation. We are recognized as a good community citizen who is trustworthy, financially strong and environmentally proactive.

job_description.120:
P&G is the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. We have operations in about 80 countries, building 65 trusted brands that make life better for 5 billion consumers in more than 180 countries. This brings many advantages, including the opportunity for our employees to enjoy a diverse and rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges.

From Day 1, youll help fulfill our purpose of improving lives for 5 billion consumers in 180 countries through leading, billion-dollar brands. We believe great ideas emerge from the creative connections that happen between our talented employees and we encourage our multi-functional teams to work together to come up with new ideas to address challenges we face.

Our Opportunity

We have a unique opportunity for a Digital Transformation Leader in our Lima, Ohio Manufacturing facility. The facility is one of our most technologically advanced facilities, one of our highest producing sites, and is known as a cradle for building technological mastery and leadership development. You will partner with Product Supply Project Leadership for P&Gs Solid Unit Dose (Tide Pods, Gain Flings, etc.) business. The role will serve as the Technology Platform Single Point Of Contact (SPOC) for the Site and will develop overall strategy for Lead Line Pilot Execution.

Ongoing Partnership will be required with the Leaders to
• Build specific execution plans and prepare/execute lead line deployments.
• Execute site specific start-up requirements, i.e. change management, initial and operational qualification.
• Support lead line pilots to include develop plans of deployments on additional Lima lines.
• Support digital fluency across the organization and broader supply chains.
• Own eSystems supporting Integrated Work Systems (IWS) Defect Elimination (eDefect), Loss Elimination (eLE) , Daily Direction Setting (eDDS)
• Be the site PDP Key User to drive greater usage across the sites
• Lead Proficy projects to deploy LEDS for Perfumes and MOQ1.

• Lead the Lima Site Transition from Maple to Proficy and build OT capability in the technician leaders at the site.
• Partner with PS Project Lead, SUD Platform SPOC, and St. Louis Site SPOC to develop overall strategy for Lead Line Pilot Execution

We are currently looking for a passionate and technology savvy individual to join our Product Supply Team. In Product Supply you will not only utilize your current skills and capabilities, but you will also have an opportunity to grow your expertise.

We use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it, and how we can influence them through immersive exploration, in-depth analysis, and good research. We use state of the art analytics tools to deliver operational excellence. We use big data sources, AI, and analytics to maximize productivity and minimize costs.
Must have:
Project Management skills.

Leading Technical Deployments

Six Sigma/Process Mapping experience

Defect Identification

Preferred:
PMP certification
Previous experience in Information Systems would be a benefit.
Experience in plant environment - specifically understanding of how operations work and utilize data.
Experience coaching and building technical capability in others. Ideally this includes experience leading teams of technicians.
This is a complex program and you can expect high visibility and the opportunity to build project management and collaboration skills at the largest P&G manufacturing site.

The Value of a P&G Career
•Ongoing coaching and career development you will work with passionate people and have access to best in class training through our P&G Leadership Academy as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
•We provide a market-competitive salary benchmarked against the finest companies, so you'll be able to spend your generous vacation time doing more of the things you love with the people you love.
•We offer a suite of benefits, including but not limited to: flexible working arrangements, remote working options, generous paid vacation increasing with service, generous parental leave policies, group life insurance, health insurance, and dedicated support to help you find the right child care or elder care.
•Additional perks include discounted P&G products from our company shops and a discount platform offering you unbeatable savings on everything from groceries to exotic holidays.
•What's more, your financial package might include things like interest-free loans, a tax-advantageous share purchase plan, a contributory pension plan, and financial education and advisement on topics including purchasing real estate and generating wealth.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.
No immigration sponsorship is available for this position. Procter & Gamble does not sponsor candidates for permanent residency except in some areas that in Procter & Gamble's sole discretion require highly specialized backgrounds.
Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law.
Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.

job_description.123:
The Step2 Company is currently seeking a full time maintenance technician to join our night shift team (6pm to 6am).

The technician will help install, maintain and repair machinery, equipment, physical structures and electrical systems.

Primary duties include, visually inspect and test machinery, listen and detect malfunctions and work with team members to diagnose problems and repair, perform preventative maintenance and building maintenance

Skills needed:
3+ years’ experience preferred
Troubleshooting and understanding PLC experience preferred
Strong mechanical aptitude
Excellent troubleshooting skills
Ability to lay out, assemble, install and maintain pipe systems
Ability to read and work off of electrical schematics
Able to read measuring instruments
Must be able to use electrical testing equipment
Able to operate machinery such as tow motor, lifts welders, drill press and saws
Mill and lathe experience a plus
Must have own tools
Our continuous operation facility provides 12-hour shifts on a rotating schedule. One week you work 48 hours, the next week you work 36 hours.

Step2 offers the following benefits for this position:
Pay rate based on experience

job_description.124:
About you. About us. About us working together in the future?
Do you find small companies too small and large firms too impersonal? Are you looking for a company of a manageable size so you feel at home but with an international element so you can develop? Do you really enjoy the challenge of complex requirements – and don't just say that because it sounds good? Are you aware that independent working means more responsibility? Have you always wanted to grow with a company – and to have the feeling that you've really contributed something?

We are looking for a committed Customer Service Representative for our Chargin Falls, OH location.

Customer Service Representative

Job Summary: The Customer Service Representative (CSR) is responsible for achieving aftermarket sales targets for replacement parts and providing excellent customer service to our customers by collaborating with Engineering, Purchasing, Operations, Accounting, and Collections to meet corporate goals.

Specific Job Functions Include:
Identifying and pursuing aftermarket sales opportunities with existing customers and new prospects.
Performing technical research and preparing quotations for replacement parts.
Reviewing the purchase orders for accuracy while handling any discrepancies and entering the orders as required.
Maintain strong customer relationships and providing post-order customer service. These activities include providing the order acknowledgments, expediting purchasing and operations, tracking orders and documentation, resolving invoicing issues, and supporting collections.
Processing change orders, Return Material Authorizations (RMA’s), and Credit Material Authorizations (CMAs).
Supporting the Regional Sales Managers and Outside Sales Reps with Aftermarket related activities.

Required Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or a minimum of 5 years of customer service, sales, or marketing experience in a technical setting.
Ability to remain calm under difficult and high-pressure situations.
Working knowledge of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software like SAP and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems.
Solid experience with Microsoft Office products especially Outlook and Word; accurate data entry skills.
Excellent written and verbal communications with strong interpersonal skills.
Must be highly motivated, self-starter with a strong sense of urgency that is results-driven, and well organized.
Ability to travel domestically approximately 5-10% of the time.
To apply please email resume to: hr@schenckprocess.com

Schenck Process is a global technology and market leader in applied measuring technology. With over 2,500 employees around the globe and companies in 22 countries on all five continents, the Schenck Process Group has a turnover of approx. €550 million.

Schenck Process LLC is a leading supplier of industrial equipment, systems and process solutions. We develop and manufacture solutions by applying extensive knowledge of our customer’s processes including weighing & feeding, screening, conveying, pulverizing, classification & sieving, thermal processing, dust collection, mixing & blending. We serve a wide range of industries such as aggregates, cement, gypsum, mining, food, pet food, grain, chemical, pharmaceuticals, plastics, power and steel. We make processes work in all areas of industry throughout the world.


Schenck Process LLC | 16490 Chillicothe Road | Chagrin Falls, OH 44023, USA | T +1 440-543-6000 | F +1 440-543-3697 |
hr@schenckprocess.com |
www.schenckprocess.com/us

Lifestyle Communities’ (LC) LPM team activates the company’s purpose each day by building meaningful connections that create real-life community in Ohio, Tennessee, and Kentucky, and future markets in North Carolina, South Carolina, Texas and Colorado. You’ll join a community team - including leasing, maintenance, The Goat and wellness team members - committed to reinforcing the brand and creating a participation-driven environment for residents, guests, and neighbors.

The Maintenance & Facilities team at LC is looking for a talented individual to elevate our resident and community experience in a values-based manner reflective of our purpose. In this role, you’ll perform a wide variety of general maintenance repairs and services for an assigned community.

job_description.126:
Job Description
Title: Reception/Admin Support Coordinator

At Faber-Castell USA, we believe in enriching lives through creativity & self-expression! Internationally known for superb quality, innovation and creativity, the Faber-Castell family of products remain unique throughout the world. Faber-Castell offers a “Companion for Life” portfolio of quality branded products with true points of difference. Our widely acclaimed brands include: Creativity for Kids® craft kits, Premium Children’s Art Products, Creative Studio for aspiring artists and adult students, Art & Graphic art materials, and Faber-Castell Fine Writing brands.

Located in our office and distribution center in Valley View, Ohio, Faber-Castell USA is currently hiring for the position of Receptionist/Administrative Coordinator. This multi-faceted role is integral to ensuring Faber-Castell USA’s operational efficiency and coordination on a daily basis. The position is the initial first contact for all visitors & guests to the Faber-Castell USA headquarters. The ideal candidate will embrace and embody the company “why”: enriching lives through creativity & self-expression and demonstrate the company’s core behavioral values of creativity, collaboration, communication, culture, contribution & competency.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:

· Manage the front-desk/reception area for the organization

· Welcome and greet all visitors and ensure sign-in/out of guest registry

· Manages company switchboard, answering all calls and directing to the appropriate staff; manage voicemail box including out-going messages

· Order and maintain office, kitchen, mailing/postage and printers/fax machine supplies; serve as point person for maintenance, replenishment & agreements

· Distribute mail, prepare postage for out-going mail, including bulk-mailings and specialty mail via courier service

· HR assistance and support including: payroll, on-boarding, benefits administration, company communications, employee product allowance, time & attendance, announcements, inquiries and various special projects as needed

· Administrative support for the Accounting department, including mailing of customer invoices, filing of supporting paperwork (pick-tickets) and credit references

· Administrative support for Sales Service department, including maintenance of new-customer database, correct customer addresses (USPS compliant)

· Event planning and coordination support; logistics and planning for company sponsored events, including hospitality arrangement for guests

· Coordinate and stage lunch orders for meetings as needed

· Various administrative support and special ad hoc projects for Graphic Design, Sales, Purchasing, IT, Facilities and Operations departments

· Provide executive assistance and admin support to company executives, including the CEO and CFO for Faber-Castell USA

· Book travel/hotel arrangements for guests and applicable staff; negotiate rates

· Collect and distribute incoming faxes; send out-going faxes as needed

· Maintain updated employee phone list, facilities map, bulletin boards

· Become an active member and ambassador of the CIA (Culture-in-Action) team

· Perform all other duties as assigned

Requirements:

· High School diploma with a minimum 1-3 years of experience in an administrative position required; consumer goods industry a plus

· Human Resources experience preferred

· Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience preferred

· Must be highly proficient in Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Outlook, Access & Microsoft SharePoint a plus

· High ethical standards and the ability to exhibit a high level of confidentiality

· ADP Workforce Now® experience highly preferred

· Superior customer service, time-management and organizational skills

· High-energy with a positive attitude, a warm demeanor; polished, professional

· Dynamic self-starter with initiative to follow tasks through to completion

· Must possess strong adaptability skills; able to multi-task and prioritize as business needs evolve

· Highly productive with a strong sense of urgency

· A team player that understand the big picture & focuses on organizational goals

· Strong, consistent attention to detail

· Ability to work as a team player but also independently

· Excellent verbal & written communication skills, interpersonal skills; intrinsically emotionally intelligent

· USPS postal compliance knowledge a plus

· A passion for arts & crafts, and/or fine arts a plus
Company Description
Faber-Castell is one of the world's leading manufacturers of fine writing, professional art & crafting products, and children's art supplies & craft kits.
job_description.127:
As the industry pioneer behind Content Performance Marketing, BrightEdge has thoroughly redefined the concept of search engine optimization (SEO) by developing an award-winning platform that precisely measures and optimizes marketing content across online channels. Our cloud-based platform is powered by big data analysis that allows our customers to plan, optimize, and measure campaigns based on real-time content performance. BrightEdge has emerged as the leading international provider of cloud-based SEO Enterprise solutions due to its dynamic and results oriented entrepreneurial culture.
We're currently seeking a motivated DevOps Engineer to join our growing team. Our goal is to ensure high performance and availability of the BrightEdge S3 platform through operations monitoring and automation of processes.
In this role, you'll have the opportunity to be involved with continuous integration and delivery of the top, industry-leading SEO platform. You will be responsible for maintaining and scaling our cloud infrastructure, as well as troubleshooting and developing solutions for complex problems.
Core Responsibilities
Ensure up-time, data-availability, and performance of the BrightEdge S3 platform, 24/7/365
Debug critical problems on production environment with minimal turnaround time
Automate the operations of thousands of machines that are constantly collecting/crunching/querying data
Build and enhance the in-house monitoring and maintenance software
Provide tools to monitor performance, deploy code and provision machines
Auto-scaling our global cloud network to cover 100+ countries
Support 50% of Fortune 500 companies that leverage our platform for their SEO success
Manage our hybrid environment of both cloud (AWS, GCP) and Data Center
What It Takes To Be Successful
B.S. in Computer Science or related field
UNIX/Linux systems knowledge and diagnostic skills
MySQL, Python, PHP, and database experience required
Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and networking experience preferred
Google Cloud Platform or other cloud technology experience is a plus
Benefits & Perks
Competitive Salary with Stock Options
Medical / Dental / Vision Insurance / PTO
Team networking, social events, Friday company lunches
Hackathons
Release celebrations every 5 weeks
Fully stocked kitchens
Comfortable working spaces
About BrightEdge

BrightEdge Technologies, Inc. (www.BrightEdge.com) is privately held and the leader in cloud-based SEO and Content Performance Marketing solutions for over 1200 enterprise, corporate, and agency customers and 9000 brands. The BrightEdge platform boosts their marketing performance by streamlining, automating, and integrating search optimization, social marketing, and content performance management capabilities for its customers. Advanced BrightEdge technology delivers visibility, executable recommendations, competitive insights, and dynamic performance metrics. With the largest technology, sales, and customer success teams in our industry, we help customers innovate and execute to achieve superior marketing performance.
job_description.128:
We advance human potential.

Recognized by Fast Company, The New York Times, Wired, McKinsey and others, Catalyte is one of the fastest growing software engineering providers. If you are passionate about technology, mentorship and continuous learning, we want to hear from you.
Overview

We are seeking an enthusiastic Technical Trainer in several of our office locations to lead our intensive technical onboarding program that teaches qualified candidates how to be full-stack web developers. The Trainer will teach, coach, and mentor qualified candidates throughout the training program to ensure they are prepared to be hired into the organization as entry-level software developers. To achieve success, the experienced software developer must have a passion for teaching and mentoring aspiring programmers. The trainer must be extremely knowledgeable in full-stack development and software engineering practices, and be willing to constantly learn new, and strengthen existing, programming languages. Candidates must be able to explain complex topics in an understandable, interesting manner to aspiring software developers. The trainer will also have opportunities to transition from training assignments to working on internal or client-based software development projects.

Your Contributions
Deliver technical training programs to aspiring software developers
Collaborate with software developers, technical leaders, business analysts and project managers to determine program topics, skills and knowledge to teach
Provide ongoing technical support and guidance to trainees (e.g., conduct code reviews)
Evaluate trainees’ deliverables (e.g., projects, exercises, etc.) and provide targeted mentorship, coaching and feedback to improve performance
Facilitate the growth of essential non-technical (i.e., soft) skills in trainees
Coach new instructors and teaching assistants in the subject matter, content and instructional strategies
Evaluate current training programs and make iterative improvements
Identify innovative approaches to teach software development and professional skills
Provide feedback to and collaborate with curriculum design team to increase the effectiveness of training curriculum
Communicate with management to provide updates on progress of trainees
Continuously research and learn new technologies, and expand depth of understanding with known technologies
Work in an Agile environment
Serve as a technical resource for client projects
Contribute to functional specifications and detailed design documents for client projects
Deliver timely project execution and project work products that exceed customer expectations
Perform other duties and responsibilities, as assigned
What we’d like to see
5+ years of experience in software development
2+ years experience in training
Excellent communication and team-building skills
Excellent coaching and mentoring skills
Excellent attention to detail.
Familiarity with adult learning principles and multiple pedagogical strategies
Experience teaching adult learners
Experience with project management and/or leading software teams
Experience developing full-stack web applications
Experience with source control, specifically Git
Minimum 3 years experience developing custom solutions using Java, C# or .NET
Experience in a back-end programming stack using Java Spring, C# .NET or Node.js
Experience with Agile software engineering practices
Experience with Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Automated Testing.
Experience developing web services, utilizing REST and microservices.
Familiarity with cloud environments such as AWS.
Familiarity with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB or Cassandra
Familiarity with RDBMS (SQL Server or Oracle)
Experience with Web Development including JavaScript, CSS, HTML and associated frameworks such as React or Angular, and LESS/SASS
Management experience preferred

Join us to advance your potential and make others successful

Apply

We're excited to meet you!
job_description.129:
As
a working Maintenance Service Manager, this individual coordinates and
participates in the activities of the property maintenance staff and
contractors engaged in the maintenance and repair of physical dwelling
structures, buildings, appliances, swimming pools and the maintenance of grounds
through the performance of the following duties.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide prompt and superior customer service to all residents,
prospective residents, visitors and vendors.
Oversee the maintenance service technicians and consistently
participate in the preservation of the asset to include capital projects, unit
turn policy compliance, and work order processing in addition to inspection of
all units to ensure quality standards & resident compliance.
Daily communication with the Property Manager
Ensure excellent curb appeal through daily inspections of the
entire property
Perform periodic inspections of the property at the direction of
management, investors or governmental agencies
Process all work orders and emergency maintenance calls promptly
Walk occupied units within 30 days of move-in and quarterly
thereafter to perform preventative maintenance
Complete unit turns within five business days of move-out
Ensure all maintenance service technicians perform his/her job within
approved safety standards.
Maintain a neat, orderly, and safe maintenance shop
Maintain OSHA and MSDS sheets and logs
Train, direct, motivate and develop maintenance service
technicians to ensure proper performance is obtained to achieve established
goals.
Ensure all employees are following policies and procedures.
Assist property manager in documentation of performance that is
substandard with the purpose to help improve such performance.
Inspect completed work for adherence to accepted specifications
and workmanship standards
Establish and modify maintenance staff work schedules.
Make recommendations regarding working conditions and equipment
use so as to maximize the efficiencies of the maintenance staff
Train and motivate the maintenance staff on an on-going basis
Maintain maintenance staff time sheets and production records
Follow established purchase order procedures to effectively manage
and monitor expenditures.
Request and obtain the approval of the Property Manager to
purchase tools, equipment and supplies from approved vendors, as required, with
an approved purchase order
Maintain control over the property’s inventory of maintenance
tools, supplies, parts and equipment
All other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
Individual
must be available for emergency on-call (rotating schedule).
Must score a
minimum of 80% on the T & R Maintenance Service Test
Must possess
at least five (5) years of experience in 4 of the following 7 major trades,
i.e., 1) carpentry, 2) electrical, 3) plumbing, 4) HVAC, 5) roofing, 6) siding
or 7) painting.
Must possess
three (3) years of supervisory experience in a residential or commercial
(commercial property, not industrial) environment
Valid
driver’s license and proof of auto insurance


CERTIFICATES,
LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS

Minimal requirements include, but are not limited to: valid driver’s license, HVAC EPA
certification of Class 2. (Class 1
certification is preferred and must be obtained within twelve (12) months of
employment with T & R).

PHYSICAL
DEMANDS

Individual
is required to stand, bend, stoop, crawl and walk and occasionally climb
ladders for the repair of pole lighting, siding and or roofs up to a height of
two stories. Weight lifting requirements include lifting or moving up to 75
pounds from the floor to waist, from floor to chest, from floor to shoulders
and also being able to drag or carry 75 pounds over a distance of 50 feet.
Individual is also required to life 20 pounds overhead and needs the ability to
move around while laying on his/her back while performing repairs. Since our
properties have multiple stories, being able to climb 3 flights of stairs
repeatedly is also an essential function. Reasonable accommodations will be
made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential
responsibilities.

T&R
Properties is a Smoke Free Employer.

T&R Properties, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Employment
Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon
race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth,
or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender
expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a
disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. All
employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

At Church & Dwight, we value talented professionals with a strong desire to make a positive impact in our company. As a rapidly growing organization, we are always seeking passionate and creative individuals whose action-oriented mindset will foster continued growth throughout our leading brands.

Job Code

2479

Apply Now

Business Analyst

Job Location: Columbus, OH

Join our team

Centric Consulting is not the typical consulting company. We live our core values and bring them with us in all we do for our clients and community. Our core purpose is simple: every day we strive to provide unmatched customer and employee experiences and foster a culture of respect, diversity, and transparency. It’s this culture, our people, and delivery that come together to make Centric a trusted advisor to local businesses.

Our Columbus business unit is guided by the goal of creating unmatched experiences for our clients, employees and community. We are committed to doing great things for clients while making a positive difference in the community because it’s where we live, work and serve. We’re looking for ­­­­­­­­­­­­­a Business Analyst to join our growing team.

In this role, you will:
Work with business stakeholders to gather business needs and translate them into operational requirements.
Facilitate planning sessions, creating testing scenarios, developing testing plans and creating user and system documentation.
Create testing scenarios and develop test plans.
Create user and system documentation.
A successful candidate will have the following characteristics:
Ability to create unmatched experiences, for both clients and employees, is what we do. You should revel in doing the unexpected and extraordinary for others.
A learning mindset, ready to experience new ideas and situations regularly.
Consulting experience is strongly preferred. That said, you will also be considered if you have a strong industry background. We like to work in the communities we live in.
We want someone who likes to solve problems. Clients don’t come to us when the problem is easy. You should enjoy taking on the hard stuff.
And because we work with clients, excellent communication skills are important – both written and verbal. Translating technical concepts into layman’s terms is an essential skill.
Initiative is important. We don’t hand hold – you should be comfortable working independently in an entrepreneurial environment. That said, collaboration is equally important. Our Boston team and other [technologists or consultants] at Centric will give you an amazing support system. You will lean on them daily.
What makes Centric different?
Special Culture – Our people make us different. We have highly talented, intelligent individuals across a broad variety of disciplines – who are eager to learn from you and share their own expertise. We embrace fresh perspectives and each other. Don’t take our word for it – check us out on Glassdoor, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to get a glimpse inside what makes us different.
Growth opportunities – As a mid-size firm, there is more flexibility when it comes to career paths. Figure out what you want to do and we'll help you figure out how to get there.
Impact – We think of ourselves as a big company with a small company feel – a local player with global reach that combines business, technology and industry expertise.
Unmatched Experiences – We are allowed to be ourselves here. We are encouraged to be human. It’s at the root of who we are as a firm and why we’re here.
Innovation – We value passion, determination, perseverance, and innovation. We are inspired because we believe in what we are doing and where we are going.
Passion for the greater good – We are steadfast in our devotion to the communities we serve and in actively promoting employee involvement in community improvement projects.
Centric believes the best solutions come from diverse teams. We strive to have an environment where everyone has an opportunity to be successful regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity.
job_description.134:
Educare Academy has 12 Toledo area locations that provide child care and early education to prepare children to be lifelong learners. Our program and locations are all award winning 5-Star centers.

Maintenance Worker Job Description:

Essential Functions:
Maintain buildings and grounds in top condition to ensure full and productive use of Educare facilities.
Ensure that all activities conform to company guidelines.
Communicate effectively with all members of the building/grounds team, supervisor, and administration.
React to change productively and handle other tasks as assigned.
Appropriately operate all equipment and machinery as necessary.
Identify and correct any red risk licensing violations as illustrated in the maintenance checklists.
General Responsibilities:
Assist in promoting the safety, health, and comfort of students and employees in and around buildings and grounds.
Maintain a high standard of safety, cleanliness, and efficiency in all maintenance and repair projects.
Perform preventive maintenance, repair, and installation in connection with:
Electrical, plumbing, and HVAC systems.
Exterior and interior of buildings
Act as a custodian when necessary.
Observe Educare policies at all times.
Adhere to all health and safety policies, including all precautions of the Blood borne Pathogens Exposure Control Plan.
Other duties as assigned by the Buildings and Grounds Supervisor or Administrative staff.
Physical Requirements/Environmental Conditions:
Requires physical exertion to manually move, lift, carry, pull, or push heavy objects or materials.
Requires stooping, kneeling, crawling, bending, turning, and reaching.
Requires climbing and balancing.
Must work indoors and outdoors year-round.
Must work in noisy and crowded environments.
Must work in and around dust, fumes, and odors.
Must be able to drive a vehicle.
Must be able to work in high places.
Requirements:

A successful maintenance worker must be able to adequately perform each essential duty and have the following education and experience:
A high school diploma or a general educational development (GED) certificate
Two or more years of experience in the maintenance field preferred
Ability to follow verbal and written instructions
Successful completion of the required background checks including Child Abuse, Criminal, and FBI
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $12.00 to $16.00 /hour

Experience:
Maintenance: 2 years (Preferred)
Education:
High school or equivalent (Required)
Work Location:
Multiple locations
Benefits offered:
Paid time off
Health insurance
Dental insurance
Other types of insurance
Retirement benefits or accounts
Child Care benefits
Commuting/travel assistance
Employee discounts
job_description.135:
Karvo Companies, Inc. is seeking an experienced, heavy highway construction mechanic to join our team. At Karvo, we pride ourselves in creating an environment that allows for personal and professional growth while providing multiple opportunities for advancement and achievement. Requirements & Responsibilities:

Highly motivated, self-starter, demonstrating the ability to work in a goal oriented environment while capable of completing multiple tasks.
Equipment expertise includes but is not limited to the following: asphalt pavers, concrete pavers/slip form machines, roadway milling machines, dozers, excavators, backhoes, rollers, utility vehicles, pickup trucks and other support equipment.
Identify and repair equipment, capable of performing detailed inspections on fleet equipment in order to keep the machines working in a safe and productive manner.
Basic welding and fabrication skills.
Neat and organized

job_description.136:
Kettering Health Network is a not-for-profit network of eight hospitals and over 120 outpatient facilities serving southwest Ohio. Patients have access to high quality maternity care, state-of-the-art cancer fighting technology, Ohio’s leading heart hospital, as well as revolutionary brain and spine surgery. With nearly 12,000 employees and 2,100 physicians, Kettering Health Network is committed to transforming the healthcare experience with world class health services for every stage of life.

Responsibilities
The Registered Nurse utilizes the nursing process in providing nursing care to patients in all settings in collaboration with other health care providers.
The RN is accountable for his/her own professional development and practice within the scope of care defined by law.
Utilizing organizational resources the RN acts as a patient advocate for the delivery of safe care including delegation of care and participation in performance and practice improvement activities.
The delivery of nursing care within the Kettering Health Network reflects the missions, vision, values and philosophies, of the organization and nursing departments
Qualifications
Applicants Must Have:
Licensed in the state of Ohio as a Registered Nurse
Graduate of an accredited school of nursing (ACEN or CCNE) if they are a new graduate nurse.
Bachelor of Science in nursing preferred (must be completed within 5 years of hire).
A nurse who is returning to the acute care setting after five or more years may be required to provide evidence of successful completion of a refresher course.
BLS certification
ACLS, NRP, PALS as determined by unit scope of practice
**Sign-on bonus eligible to external candidates only
**Must be an experienced nurse with at least one year of RN experience in an acute care setting
job_description.137:
Position: Project Manager

Job Summary:


The Project Manager is a key part of the team responsible for the excellent and efficient delivery of regional marketing solutions for our clients. The primary focus is on managing projects from start to finish, which includes project timeline and budget management, creative freelancer management, and vendor research & procurement. Additional areas of responsibility will be assigned as needed.

Duties / Responsibilities:

Develops and manages project plans using Smartsheet by incorporating timing, process, resources, communications, and risk management
Partners with the account teams to identify and manage project issues while driving projects forward
Becomes the timeline owner, communicating to team members and clients when milestones are slipping and works to develop alternative solutions
Hires and manages freelancers throughout each project
Focuses on efficiency and ensures processes are adhered to across the team
Manages project budgets including freelancer time and ensures accurate invoicing
Recognizes risks/issues that need escalation, provides recommendations, and arranges for appropriate assistance
Works closely with internal team and freelancers to route projects and ensure all steps are followed
Focuses both on the immediate task at hand while also proactively thinking through the next steps for the day, week, month, and beyond
Seeks opportunities to increase team and client satisfaction and deepen team, client and vendor relationships
Effects positive change in Relevate project management processes through personal effort and influence within team
Utilizes understanding of projects to assist in the evaluation and redesign of client offerings
Modifies core processes and supporting systems to optimize quality of service delivery
Skills / Qualifications:

Ability to work independently and as a team member
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects
Possesses great organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to manage a lot of detail and data in a fast-paced environment
Ability to understand the project, client objectives and adapt process when necessary
Professional writing and customer service skills
Excellent communication (written and verbal) with internal customers as well as clients
Self-motivated, positive and proactive attitude
Willingness to adapt to change
Ability to cope with pressure, stress and deadlines
Works within budget and timeline parameters
Utilizes project management skills
Displays excellent time management skills
Thinks strategically and executes with proven ability to achieve plans while maintaining the highest ethical standards
Demonstrates strong hands-on experience with a variety of basic computer programs (MS Office, Outlook, Adobe Acrobat) and the ability to quickly pick up project management and finance software (Smartsheet, Intacct, and Salesforce)
Availability for occasional travel
Education / Experience:

Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university (preferably in Business, Project Management or Marketing)
3+ years of project management leadership experience
Prior agency experience preferred
Prior healthcare experience is helpful; pharmaceutical experience is a huge plus
Familiarity working within small / fast-paced / growth-oriented business environment
Workplace Requirements:

Work in an office environment in close proximity to coworkers (cubicle environment)
Relevate strives to have high-performing, well-balanced individuals who are generous community contributors
This job entails the above requirements but is not limited to them.

job_description.139:
This is the starting point of a career path that could lead to franchise ownership for a talented, hard-working and goal oriented individual!
The Franchise Managers responsibility is to increase revenue and market share, deliver exceptional customer service, and protect our franchise brand by: overseeing the hiring, training, and professional development of franchise employees; executing sales and marketing plans; controlling costs to improve profitability; and consistently exceeding customer expectations. An individual in this role should have strong knowledge of functional support areas, including our core business, sales and selling, regulatory compliance, human resources, training, marketing, and cost management. What a qualified applicant doesn't possess at time of hire will be a top priority in getting started. We believe in: hire for attitude, train for skills.

What We Offer
Starting salary range: $50,000-$55,000 annually
Performance based bonuses
Health insurance, dental, and vision coverage
401(k) with company match
Paid time off
Career advancement opportunities
RESPONSIBILITIES

Assures effective team effort to exceed revenue and customer service goals
Directs operations and support staff to pursue excellence in every area of our business
Responsible for employee accountability and adherence to franchise and system standards and policies
Responsible for the direction and day-to-day supervision of all management and office staff
Works with the operations manager to assure exceptional customer service and vigilant adherence to established processes and expectations
Responsible for employee development, accountability, and corrective action programs
Responsible for maintaining staffing requirements, conducting interviews, new hire processes, and training of new employees
Oversees all workers compensation and unemployment claims
Ensures franchise compliance with all DOT regulations and FMCSA guidelines
Actively participates in community, industry, or other relevant associations
Drives communication upward through monthly reports of all functional areas for executive review
Other duties as assigned by the Franchisee

REQUIREMENTS
Infectious enthusiasm, energy, and attention to details
Driven to exceed goals and to be the best
Demonstrated leadership skills, enthusiasm, and pursuit of excellence is required
Bachelors Degree in business, management, or other related field is preferred but not required
Must have previous management experience. TWO MEN AND A TRUCK® or moving industry experience is preferred but not required
Extensive knowledge of TWO MEN AND A TRUCK system policies, procedures, and industry (this may be learned vs brought)
Understanding of and commitment to customer service and TWO MEN AND A TRUCK core values and mission statement
Excellent oral and written comprehension and communication skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Demonstrated ability to lead by example to motivate, develop, and direct people
Ability to assess the performance of self, employees, and franchise to make improvements or take corrective action
Strong decision-making ability
Must be proficient with the following Microsoft applications:
Excel
Word
Outlook
job_description.140:
PROGUARD WARRANTY, INC. (Ohio)

Automotive consumer coverage provider offering a comprehensive menu of fully insured new and pre-owned protection products is seeking a sales representative to support our rapidly growing enterprise. ProGuard Warranty is a family-owned business with over 70 years of automotive experience and core values promoting a culture built on transparency, flexibility and accessibility. With a focus on innovation and industry-leading customer service, ProGuard aspires to be the partner of choice for F&I products as we expand our reach across the country. We are currently looking for a motivated sales representative to market our products and services to prospective independent and franchise automobile dealers. The ideal candidate will be a motivated self-starter who will drive new business, manage existing accounts, and build a territory. We offer training, cutting-edge sales tools and innovative technology that will contribute to your success. This opportunity offers solid earning potential, including a starting base salary, semi-monthly paid commission and monthly expense allowance.


Responsibilities:
• Establish sales strategies to increase territory revenue through new account development
• Develop and nurture relationships with new and existing dealer accounts in designated territory
• Utilize sales process to uncover customer needs and perform presentations illustrating the benefits of vehicle protection products to dealers and customers
• Employ effective negotiation skills to close sales and secure new business
• Perform daily territory management and revenue growth through visits and calls to customer sites
• Meet or exceed established monthly sales targets, new account acquisition, and retention goals
• Complete account status reporting requirements accurately and in a timely manner
• Follow up on commitments with dealers to ensure 100% satisfaction

Qualifications:
• 1-2 years of outside sales experience
• Consultative sales skills based on ability to build and sustain relationships
• Self-motivated and comfortable establishing new business
• Well-organized, with the ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
• Strong sales skills building and sustaining relationships
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
• Working knowledge of Microsoft Office including: Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
• Displays professionalism and exceptional customer service skills
All qualified candidates must have a valid driver’s license, a good driving record and a reliable vehicle as daily travel within the territory will be required.

Ideal Candidate:
• Results driven, highly competitive, with strong desire to achieve sales objectives
• Takes on the role of a true solution provider and trusted advisor to clients
• Offers superior service and product knowledge, including that of competitors
• Multi-tasking individual who uses project management skills to grow existing accounts
• Possesses an out-going personality with dedication, passion, and a drive to succeed

Benefits:
• Health insurance
• Dental insurance
• Vision insurance
• Life insurance
• 401(k) retirement plan
• Monthly expense reimbursement
job_description.141:
Overview


Be Here. Be Great. Working for a leader in the insurance industry means opportunity for you. Great American Insurance Group, a member of American Financial Group, is a Fortune 500 company. We combine a "small company" culture where your ideas will be heard with "big company" expertise to help you succeed. With over 30 specialty property and casualty operations and a variety of financial services, there are always opportunities here to learn and grow.

The Property & Casualty IT Services department is looking for an Administrative Assistant. The person in this role will handle a variety of administrative functions.

Responsibilities


This position will provide general administrative support. Tasks may include:
Prepares, receives and responds to correspondence.
Prepares PowerPoint presentations, answers, takes messages and screens telephone calls.
Schedules and maintains calendar of appointments, meetings and travel itineraries.
Organizes and provides information as needed for the managers and staff.
Orders office supplies as needed.
Help to coordinate meetings and events, book conference
Qualifications
High School diploma or equivalent required.
Administrative experience in a corporate environment is preferred.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Ability to effectively multi-task when needed.
Must be proficient in MS Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint.
Excellent oral and written communication skills as well as the ability to work with individuals at all levels.
Must have the ability to maintain confidential information.
job_description.142:
Position Overview:
Evergreen Cooperative Laundry currently has an exciting opportunity for a Machine Repair Technician in our Maintenance Department. This position will be responsible for maintaining highly automated, brand new, state of the art laundry equipment in our air-conditioned facility. This position is best suited for an energetic, highly motivated and results-driven individual who is looking to join a solid company and team. If you have mechanical aptitude and some experience along with a desire to learn and succeed, we will work together with you for the success of all involved. This position is full time, includes full benefits and an opportunity for profit sharing after one year.

Essential Duties:
Perform routine repairs and preventative maintenance on laundry processing equipment, conveyors, and other mechanical needs in the facility.
Troubleshoot and repair production machinery and equipment.
Perform basic electrical troubleshooting and repair as required.
Communicate effectively with Engineering, Managers/Supervisors, Production Staff and Outside Vendors regarding projects and repair problems.
Fabricate and weld machining parts.
Work with dryer, angle grinder, and needle scaler.
Essential Experience/Knowledge:
Strong troubleshooting skills
Two years minimum industrial maintenance experience with automated equipment
Must be able to work with 3 phase motor controllers, read schematics and troubleshoot PLC's.
Strong grasp of the mechanics of gears, bearings, lubrication rolls
Experience working with electrical motors for removal to repair or refurbish
Preferred Experience/Knowledge:
Knowledge of and proficiency in all OSHA and local requirements related to all assigned work
Experience with Photo eyes, Electrical, test 220/240/480 circuits
Plumbing experience
Working Requirements:
Must have own tools.
Steel toe safety shoes are required.
Must be physically able to work in confined areas, work in high areas of the plant, climb ladders, and work with all climate conditions due to outside temperatures.
About the Evergreen Cooperative Laundry:
Evergreen Cooperative Laundry (ECL) is the only employee-owned commercial laundry firm in the United States. ECL is committed to delivering the highest quality laundry services and building the wealth and careers of the individuals it employs. We use our state-of-the-art facilities to offer laundry services to hospitals, nursing homes and hospices as a critical part of delivering healthcare to Cleveland residents. The ECL is part of the Evergreen Cooperative Corporation, a family of firms that works to build a stronger Cleveland economy by sharing its profits with its employees.
job_description.143:
Job Description
Critical Business Analysis, Inc. in Perrysburg, OH is seeking a part-time Office Assistant to assist with internal office management and miscellaneous activities. Candidates will be responsible for learning and effectively using internal software programs, phones, and procedures in order to assist the various departments when needed. Must have a High School diploma or equivalent, excellent written and verbal communication skills, a demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented environment and be highly detail-oriented with a great ability to multi-task. This is a part-time hourly position with no benefits and pay is commensurate with experience.

Responsibilities:

Set up and coordination of monthly in-house training classes
Answering phones
Help maintain internal office activities and supplies
Input data into CRM and other internal office systems
Assist other departments as need
Requirements
High School diploma or equivalent
Familiar with Microsoft Office: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.


Benefits
There are no benefits associated with this position.

Company Description
Critical Business Analysis, Inc. (CBA), located in Perrysburg, Ohio, has over 32 years of growth and success in providing skilled support staff, software solutions and professional services for capital intensive industries. Safety is a core value for CBA and is essential to all of our business activities. Our goals are to provide a safe work environment, to maintain an accident-free, injury-free workplace and to promote and maintain public safety. For more information on the company, visit www.cbainc.com.

CBA provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.
