job_description.196:
Overview


The Administrative Assistant has broad administrative responsibility to support Company Executives and other members of the staff. The Admin must be extremely professional and experienced and possess the ability to manage a demanding workload. This position requires thorough knowledge of Company operations, policies, and procedures and handles details of a highly confidential and critical nature. The Admin collects and prepares information for use in discussions/meetings of executive staff and outside individuals. The Admin will make high level contacts of a sensitive nature inside and outside the company, including scheduling meetings; working on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors; and exercising judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. The Admin will have the ability to take on project management assignments and coordinate meetings in support of the team. The Admin must have excellent communications skills, both written and verbal.

Responsibilities


The Admin will be accountable for the following day-to-day activities and results:
Provide comprehensive, high-level administrative support to the executives including extensive and complex scheduling, as well as detailed travel plans and meeting agendas
Provide administrative support to other members of executive staff and team
Prepare expense reports and reconcile bills
Manage multiple calendars; plan and schedule meetings with internal as well as external participants
Make high-level contacts internally and externally regarding sensitive subjects
Edit and create professional presentations and project plans
Ensure that all company information – strategy, plans, proposals, quotes, clinical information is kept completely confidential
Qualifications
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in similar high-level administrative position.
Ability to develop, implement and understand general company operations, work flows and procedures as appropriate.
Ability to work with little or no supervision, but with the good judgment to know when to involve others or ask for guidance.
Relieve the Executives of as much day-to-day work as possible; anticipate needs, and involve the people you support as appropriate to ensure synchronization of thoughts about work.
Excellent communication and project management skills. Strong interpersonal skills
Must be able to handle highly sensitive and confidential information. Discretion is of utmost importance in this position.
Excellent computer skills required including Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, Project and advanced PowerPoint
Strong organization skills with attention to detail.
Ability to set example and maintain a positive culture and environment for company.
Ability to work in fast-paced environment; Fast learner.
Accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent problem solving skills; ability to quickly arrive at appropriate solutions to problems,
Ability to work independently; good judgment.
Professional, helpful, friendly approach to all interactions both internal and external.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Flexibility and resourcefulness; ability to wear several hats and process multiple tasks simultaneously.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; talk; or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and stoop; kneel; or crouch The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and depth perception.

About Our Company


Myriad Genetics Inc., is a leading personalized medicine company dedicated to being a trusted advisor transforming patient lives worldwide with pioneering molecular diagnostics. Myriad discovers and commercializes molecular diagnostic tests that: determine the risk of developing disease, accurately diagnose disease, assess the risk of disease progression, and guide treatment decisions across six major medical specialties where molecular diagnostics can significantly improve patient care and lower healthcare costs. Myriad is focused on three strategic imperatives: maintaining leadership in an expanding hereditary cancer market, diversifying its product portfolio through the introduction of new products and increasing the revenue contribution from international markets. For more information on how Myriad is making a difference, please visit the Company's website: www.myriad.com.

Myriad is an equal opportunity employer and as such, affirms in policy and practice to recruit, hire, train and promote, in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status or status as a protected veteran.

Reasonable accommodation will be provided for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. We believe that diversity lends a regional, national, and global advantage to the clients we serve. Our workforce consists of dynamic individuals, with a range of backgrounds, talents, and skills.

job_description.200:
Description

Buckle up, hit the open road and start making hungry people happy as a delivery driver for Pizza Hut®. That's right, we'll pay you to cruise around in your mobile office your car listening to your own tunes and delivering great pizza and pasta. What more could you want? Independence, good music and great food with tips! Sound good? Besides your smile, energy and reliable set of wheels, here's what you'll need for this job:
Requirements

The good news is that your training will teach you everything you need to know to succeed on the job. But here are a few skills you should have from the get-go, as well as some requirements:

A clean driving record: If you're on a first name basis with the people at traffic court, this probably isn't the right job for you. Safety is our priority. You'll also need a valid driver's license, insurance and reliable vehicle.
Friendly demeanor: Smile, tell a joke treat our customers like you would your family and friends. Think of it this way - a smile and a kind word can mean the difference between a wallet full of tips and just some extra change for your cup holder.
Keen sense of direction: You should know how to read a map and find your way around your delivery area. Think of all of the short cuts you'll learn!
Age restrictions: Our delivery drivers need to be at least 18 years old.
Dress the part: We'll provide you with a uniform. We just ask that you keep it clean and come to work wearing it.
Just a few more things: You'll need some basic math skills, the desire to work as part of a team and enthusiasm for learning.

2019-097-INT: Software Engineer

Directorate Intelligence & Defense Solutions
Location Beavercreek, OH
Riverside Research's Intelligence and Defense Solutions Directorate (IDS) has a full-time opening in the Dayton, Ohio area for a Software Developer. The candidate will be responsible for working with the program lead and other team members to research, develop, build, and demonstrate a virtual proof of concept web-based software application system (prototype). Team members will contribute to the design, development, documentation, testing, and debugging of the prototype software system.

Riverside Research is seeking a full time Senior Software developer in the Dayton, OH area. This position supports Defense Intelligence Agency programs.

All Riverside Research opportunities require U.S. citizenship.
HIRES WITH AN ACTIVE TOP SECRET CLEARANCE ARE ELIGIBLE FOR A $5,000 SIGN-ON BONUS.

Job Responsibilities:
Software Developer will be responsible for incorporating system outputs into a containerized software based test harness supporting sensor integration using all recommended standards. The prototype will include a basic web-based architecture for data visualization so users can perform the following actions:
Search for and view availability, health and status (i.e. availability for tasking, GPS position, etc}, and, if applicable, error codes of deployed systems/sensors
Task sensors with the full range of documented command and control commands
View raw data and reports issued by the sensor
View sensor metrics, workflow status, and scheduled tasks
View incoming and outgoing messages along with feedback on whether external messages comply with message format and valid data ranges
Complete other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
• Clearance required: Secret Clearance Required with Eligibility for Top Secret with SCI
Bachelors degree required in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Science, or Information System Management
Minimum of 4 years of experience.
4+ years of Java software development experience
Ability to quickly learn new concepts, data formats and standards formats
Candidate should be a self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team player, and exhibit exceptional relationship management skills
Desired experience with: CXF SOAP and REST web services; Karaf/ServiceMix; JavaScript; HTML5, CSS3; Windows and Linux; Relational Databases (i.e. Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL); Eclipse + Maven; Code Management Software (i.e. CVS, SVN, Mercurial)
Riverside Research strives to be one of America’s premier providers of independent, trusted technical and scientific expertise. As we continue to add experienced, technically astute staff, we are looking for highly motivated, talented team members that can help our DoD and Intelligence Community (IC) customers continue delivery of world class programs. As a not-for-profit, technology-oriented Defense Company, we believe service to customers and support of our staff is our mission. Our goal is to serve as a destination company by providing an industry-leading, positive, and rewarding employee experience for all who join us. We aspire to be a valued partner to our customers and to earn their trust through our unwavering commitment to achieve timely, innovative, cost-effective and mission-focused solutions.

All positions at Riverside Research are subject to background investigations. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history and identity check.

Department:

90012_76308 Clinical Engineering

Expected Weekly Hours:

40

Shift:

Position Purpose:

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Food & Nutrition Services, the Executive Chef (EC) will lead the Food and
Nutrition culinary team in delivering best in class food and nutrition services for patient dining, retail café and
catering services for the Mount Carmel Health System. The EC will implement all culinary and procurement
systems and programs designed to support the Hospitality shared services model to promote standardized
practices, care delivery and consistency in how service is delivered to all patients and customers.

POSITION PURPOSE
Under the general direction of the General Manager, Food & Nutrition Services, the Executive Chef is responsible for the oversight and day-to-day culinary operations of the Regional Health Ministry's (RHM) Food & Nutrition Services (FANS) Department with a Total Managed Volume typically ranging from $500,000 to $2,000,000. The Executive Chef is responsible for successfully coordinating and directing all culinary functions, quality control/improvement and culinary personnel within the department as assigned and Helps develop and maintain a culinary integrity program in a single campus environment.
Trains and develops existing kitchen staff and develops and cultivates further talent to drive excellence through staff training and engagement. The Executive Chef leads by demonstration through proper cooking techniques and possesses a working knowledge of regulatory and food safety/sanitation practices and principles based on HAACP, Health Department, Joint Commission and THS standards. The Executive Chef coordinates the day-to-day food production and is responsible for the quality, preparation and presentation of all menu items while maintaining a high level of food quality utilizing THS standards and systems. The Executive Chef also interacts, engages and coordinates efforts with clinical dietitians to ensure optimal patient care as well as co-develop and promote wellness, educational and community initiatives.
Under the direction of the General Manager, FANS, works collaboratively with all levels of FANS leadership and management team disciplines at RHMs and within the region. Develops and implements plans and implementation processes that support Trinity Health and RHM FANS goals, objectives, strategies, policies, and procedures. Ensures cost reduction targets and productivity improvement objectives are met, while cultivating service/product quality and customer satisfaction. Ensures the General Manager is kept abreast of issues or problems impacting program efficiencies and effectiveness. Attracts, develops and trains talent to ensure program quality, sustainability, long-term growth, and development. The Executive Chef leads by exemplifying the mission, vision and values of Trinity Health and the Regional Health Ministry.

Job Description Details:

1. Knows, understands, incorporates, and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices, supports and endorses senior leadership decisions, goals, objectives, and strategies.

2. Oversees the day-to-day management of the culinary and sanitation activities for the FANS department and ensures program service support objectives are met. Provides a work environment that fosters positive energy, creativity, and teamwork among associates across all functional areas. Provides operational and technical support to RHM FANS management stakeholders in support of the overall management of FANS programs. Develops, implements and coordinates within the RHM:

 Implementation of core program systems (Menus, Food Formularies, Cleaning Practices, auditing tools, competencies, etc.)

3. Participates in monthly budget reviews with the Regional Manager and RHM stakeholders to identify budget variances; and prepares related reports for senior management review.

4. Keeps the General Manager informed of issues affecting program costs, service capabilities, effectiveness and efficiencies, as well as issues noted during Performance Improvement audits in areas of responsibility. Presents findings and recommendations for improvement to the General Manager.

5. Meets with direct reports and support staff, as required, to review overall culinary operations goals/objectives, to address shortfalls and open issues and to encourage open dialogue for suggested process improvements. Outlines expectations, accountabilities, and measurables used in determining success.

6. Develops and administers Program Quality Evaluations and reviews Patient and Customer Satisfaction Survey scores for discrepancies and overall customer satisfaction for FANS. Prepares Performance Improvement Plans (PIP) where necessary to resolve customer satisfaction issues and address program quality deficiencies in the culinary area(s).

7. Interviews, hires, trains, appraises, counsels, and supervises staff; handles disciplinary actions. Reviews and approves expense reports and holds direct reports accountable to Trinity Health and THS policies and procedures. Reviews hiring justifications to ensure financial cost saving merit.

8. Ensures timely completion of annual performance appraisals; addresses associate problems and issues related to their work or environment. Fosters the development of diverse teams at all levels as appropriate and outlines annual skills development, career growth opportunities and improvement objectives with direct reports. Establishes and monitors progress on objectives and takes the necessary actions to resolve and prevent recurring issues. Provides the necessary leadership and oversight in cases where disciplinary action or termination is warranted.

9. Manages multiple projects and tasks in a fast paced environment and possesses the ability to adapt to change. Demonstrates the ability to develop a project plan for major projects with milestones to determine schedule of deliverables to advance project outcomes.

10. Participates in Trinity Health FANS regional Advisory councils to develop best in class programs and identifying best practices; driving change to positively affect operational, financial, and service performance at the RHM.



11. Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State and local laws/regulations; the Trinity Health Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct; as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behavior.

12. Ensures all aspects of departmental operations including but not limited to all culinary functions and standards, Patient/Retail Production and Catering and Retail operations as assigned. Leads and ensures that all areas function in a compliant, optimal and efficient manner that ensures patient and customer satisfaction

13. Ensures the existence of effective quality improvement programs within the department, as assigned, inclusive of the food borne illness, safety and infection control aspects in the appropriately assigned areas of the department.

14. Ensures all cash handling policies are followed appropriately as assigned and that all cash is accounted for.

15. Ensures that all menus are reviewed annually (Patient, Retail, etc.) and adjusted according to patient/customer preference. Works with assigned clinical nutrition staff to ensure that Nutrient Analysis for all menus are accurate and updated as needed.

16. Ensures that all catered functions are approved, planned and executed per policy in a timely fashion with a customer centered focus.

17. Ensures safe conditions and procedures are followed at all times to minimize/eliminate workman’s compensation claims and create a safe working environment for all Food & Nutrition colleagues.

18. Displays the ability to plan and direct food production personnel regarding type and quantity of food to be prepared and any special techniques to be employed for modified diets. Ensures that all menu items follow a THS approved recipe and that all recipes are accessible to culinary staff.

19. Maintains accurate and appropriate records as required.

20. Demonstrates a cost-conscious attitude to time usage and consistently makes the best use of time.

21. May handle additional duties and responsibilities as needed or assigned.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

1. Completion of an accredited culinary institution program or equivalent degree and a minimum of three to five years progressive experience in the general culinary or healthcare foodservice management field or an equivalent combination of education and work experience. LEAN certification preferred.

2. Ability to work effectively in a diverse, collaborative, and team oriented culture.

3. Ability to develop methodologies for collecting and analyzing relevant data; to audit program processes; monitor quality; identify, problems and their root causes, and make recommendations for improvement.

4. Excellent leadership, analytical, organizational, planning, delegation, coaching, communication (verbal, written and interpersonal), and computer (MS Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) skills; with a continuous improvement mindset and ability to challenge conventional thinking at all levels of the organization.

5. A personal presence characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health.

6. Ability to be a self-starter and independent worker able to manage multiple conflicting priorities and demands.

7. Ability to delegate responsibilities effectively and provide regular follow up to ensure objectives is met.

PHYSICAL / MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS

1. Works in a well-lighted, well-ventilated area.

2. Occasionally exposed to normal food service conditions such as noise, heat and humidity.

TRINITY HOSPITALITY SERVICES MISSION STATEMENT

In the spirit of our guiding behaviors and as stewards of Trinity Health, our pledge is to deliver culinary, nutritional and hospitality excellence in a compassionate and innovative manner to all we serve across our ministry.

TRINITY HEALTH MISSION STATEMENT AND GUIDING BEHAVIORS

Mission: We serve together in Trinity Health, in the spirit of the Gospel, to heal body, mind and spirit, to improve the health of our communities and to steward the resources entrusted to us.

The Guiding Behaviors are the behaviors necessary for all of us to achieve our Vision. They are:

1. We support each other in serving our patients and communities.

2. We communicate openly, honestly, respectfully and directly.

3. We are fully present.

4. We are all accountable.

5. We trust and assume goodness in intentions.

6. We are continuous learners.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by persons

Trinity Health's Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Trinity Health employs about 133,000 colleagues at dozens of hospitals and hundreds of health centers in 22 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions.

Trinity Health's dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

Looking to progress your current sales career? Do you want to work in a fast-paced, dynamic sales environment with real opportunity for career growth and advancement? Do you thrive in a performance driven environment where your results are directly recognized and rewarded?

National General Insurance is the fastest growing Property & Casualty (P&C) insurer in the United States and is recognized for our experienced leaders, entrepreneurial culture, and energetic environment. NatGen is searching for enthusiastic, motivated, and dedicated Inside Sales Agents to join our growing team in the Cleveland, OH office. Prior sales experience is not necessary but the motivation and passion for being a successful salesperson is a must! We offer a multi-tiered and in-depth paid training program to provide you with all the tools you need to be successful in our inbound sales center environment. Training covers the Property & Casualty insurance industry, National General Products and Systems, and proven sales techniques to empower you for success.

Our high performing first year sales agents earn an average of $60,000 to $70,000 per year with an hourly base pay and uncapped commissions and incentives. Second and third year agents’ average yearly earnings of up to $85,000. Top agents earn $115,000+!

Company paid training

Plentiful, highly-converting qualified leads
Internal advancement opportunities – grow with us!
Agent, Senior Agent, Executive Agent

Job Description
PURPOSE OF ROLE:

The Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing administrative support to ensure the efficient operation of the office. The role supports managers and employees through a variety of tasks related to organization and communication and is responsible for confidential and time sensitive material.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

· Greet and assist guests in a professional, friendly, and hospitable manner

· Professionally administer and direct all incoming calls; maintains facility extension list

· Oversee the professional image and cleanliness of the lobby, conference rooms, front office restrooms, and front office lunchroom

· Organize and schedule meetings and appointments; coordinates breakfast and luncheons upon request for associated meetings

· Prepare conference rooms and beverage stock for scheduled meetings

· Accounting: prepare and monitor invoices; assist Management with purchase order generation and maintenance. Assist with month end accounting review and P&L statement preparation/reporting.

· Negotiate and order office, kitchen, and janitorial supplies; maintain usage and inventory reports for supplies ordered

· Assist in the preparation of regularly scheduled reports

· Coordinate repairs and maintenance of office equipment

· Follows and enforces all company and legal guidelines of document retention, protection, retrieval, transfer, and disposal or records.

· Produce and distribute correspondence memos, letters, and forms

· Coordinate and distribute incoming deliveries and mail

· Carry out administrative duties such as filing, typing, copying, scanning, etc.

· Coordinate facility/company sponsored events such as holiday party, summer picnic, sporting events, etc.

Job Description
Duties:

Responsible for understanding product, business, and technical requirements as they relate to ongoing implementations. The Analyst will be responsible for understanding Web Services (SOAP/REST) and creating API mapping requirements for real time integration of the applications. The Analyst will create data mapping requirements for projects involving data migration by using database querying tools like AQT. The Analyst will participate in system design, development, testing, and deployment and be responsible for creating SQL to extract reports and create/review test data from the database for UAT/System testing.

Requirements:

Skills / Qualifications:

· Minimum of 5 years of related experience in Technology or Business Analysis that includes testing, debugging, documenting and maintaining applications or using applications in a business setting;

· Minimum of 5 years of experience in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and collaborating with IT Development/QA/Release Management teams for successful project implementations;

· At least 5 years of experience in managing requirements, writing test cases, coordinating SIT and UAT using the HP Quality Center (HP QC)/Application Lifecycle Management (ALM); or tools such as TFS, Jira or VersionOne.

· Strong SQL knowledge with at least 3 years of hands on experience working on databases;

· A minimum of 3 years of Business Analyst experience documenting system processes, data mapping, requirements gathering, and Gap analysis;

· A minimum of 2 years prior Quality Assurance experience in ETL/Mainframes/Web Services applications;

· Strong written, oral, and presentation skills.

Eligibility Requirements:

· Ability to work individually and as part of the team in a fast-paced environment

· Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, business, or related field of study required.

To apply:

Email resume to elisheba.brown@ascendum.com with job title (Implementation Business Analyst) and

job# 04222019 in subject line.
Company Description
About Ascendum:

We are a global IT services company leveraging technology to solve business problems. Our clients include small, medium, and large firms with small, medium, and large problems. Ascendum's approach is built on the success of using the right combination of strategy, people, processes, technology, and infrastructure for each client situation, to meet specific business needs/challenges and deliver expected results.

High levels of technical expertise, commitment to exceeding customer expectations, a dedicated and highly motivated global workforce, coupled with a seamless onsite/offshore delivery model and a state-of-the-art worldwide infrastructure, gives us the competitive edge to provide comprehensive, end-to-end IT solutions to our diverse clientele.

Headquartered in the heartland of America (Cincinnati, OH) Ascendum has delivery, sales, and support offices worldwide including its offshore development center in Bangalore, and a BPO Center in Ahmedabad, India.

We welcome inquiries from applicants only (We will not accept third parties or agencies for this opportunity). Candidates must be authorized to work permanently in the United States. Due to the volume of resumes that we receive, only those candidates selected for review will be contacted. Ascendum is an equal opportunity employer.

job_description.210:
Job Description
Your Role:

As a Business Analyst, Payroll for O-I you will be accountable for the administration and support of various payroll processes and initiatives while ensuring compliance with all Canadian and U.S. company policies, collective bargaining agreements, labor laws, and tax laws including but not limited to Federal, Provincial, State, and Local regulations. You will implement workable solutions to business issues/problems with minimum referral to management is expected. In this position you will collaborate with outsourcing partners and internal customers (Human Resources, Benefits, Compensation, IT, HRIS, Finance, etc.) to ensure alignment on policies, processes, and initiatives will be key. You will also lead projects related to payroll and cross functional improvements.

Your Responsibilities:
Serve as technical expert for payroll issues through a deep understanding of payroll law, tax regulations, and accounting principles.
Identify and recommend opportunities for process improvements related to the payroll department while adhering to company pay policies and utilizing current technologies.
Review payroll processes to identify opportunities to increase process efficiency and lower transactional costs
Leverage the payroll tools, identify opportunities to standardize input to payroll operations with forms/workflow
Develop process/tools to understand, analyze, solve, and control daily issues with a standard procedure
Apply subject matter expertise to deliver high level support in the department and to other business partners.
Configure, update, and audit earning/deduction codes, forms, workflow, and other payroll data points.
Assist in the maintenance of the payroll system and time & attendance system; provide guidance that demonstrates an understanding of payroll compliance and taxation as it relates to the company.
Test, validate, and document all payroll system updates as it relates to the duties of the payroll department.
Train staff and business partners on new or enhanced operational policies and procedures.
Assist with and/or provide coverage for payroll processing when needed.
Provide a high level of service and effective communication with internal and external customers and vendors.
Establish and maintain open and regular communications with Plant HR and Paymasters.
Analyze payroll metrics for trends/root cause and work with Department manager to propose corrective actions / communication plans to drive improvements
Escalate potential service issues to Payroll Manager.
Reporting Relationships:

In this position you will report to the Payroll Manager.

About You:
Bachelor’s degree required
Minimum of 3-5 years payroll, HRIS or similar related experience required.
Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) designation required. Consideration will be given to applicants willing to acquire the designation within 18 months
Knowledge of U.S. and Canadian Payroll law required
Experience with multistate payroll/tax laws required
Union and contract environment experience preferred
Experience collaborating with payroll outsourcing partners
Experience working with an ERP system, SAP
Intermediate to advanced level of proficiency using Microsoft Office (Access, Excel, Word), reporting software, and payroll systems
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to effectively work independently with minimal supervision from Manager
Acute attention to detail and accuracy
Effective organizational, project, and time management skills

Company Description
Remember the last time you opened a bottle of champagne? A cold beer after a hard day’s work or a bottle of sparkling mineral water to quench your thirst? Well, it was probably made by us. We are O-I and we love that we make more glass containers than anyone in the world

O-I has more than a century of experience crafting pure, sustainable, brand-building glass packaging for many of the world’s best-known food and beverage brands. We are proud to provide high-quality glass packaging for beer, wine, spirits, food, non-alcoholic beverages, cosmetics, and pharmaceuticals.

With nearly 27,000 employees and an unparalleled footprint spanning almost 80 plants in 23 countries, O-I is a truly global maker of glass packaging.

From engineering and manufacturing to brand development, design and innovation, we are dedicated to providing unique solutions to exceed our customers’ expectations and fuel consumers’ desire for glass.

Do you have an entrepreneurial spirit and desire the excitement that comes with a startup? In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to be an intrapreneurial member of a distinctive team focused on developing the future of glass packaging, within an already established Global, Fortune 500 organization.

This is a unique opportunity to be part of this exciting, breakthrough initiative reimagining glassmaking with transformational technology and new processes. Called MAGMA (Modular Advanced Glass Manufacturing Asset), the initiative leverages R&D work that we’ve been pursuing over the last few years to develop new melting technology that opens up a world of possibilities for us.

MAGMA builds on O-I’s history and heritage of innovation, and you will be part of a special team working to enable us to continue pursuing new growth opportunities across categories and geographies.

To learn more about MAGMA please view the video linked below:

https://youtu.be/xkoBJhbO6pE

Smile Brands Inc. is one of the largest dental service organizations in the United States. We provide comprehensive business support services to our affiliated dental groups throughout the nation, so dentists can spend more time caring for their patients and less time on the administrative, marketing and financial aspects of operating a practice. At Smile Brands which includes the Bright Now!® Dental, Castle Dental® and Monarch Dental® brands every employee and affiliated dental provider shares a common vision: Delivering Smiles for Everyone®!

At Bright Now! Dental, we are dedicated to serving patients and providing quality dental care in a group practice setting among high-caliber dental professionals. If you are seeking clinical autonomy with the backing of a full support team and the latest technology, we have the ideal opportunity for you in Dayton, OH.

Your Role as a Dentist

As an integral part of a hardworking dental team, we encourage you to give guidance and direction to your dental assistants, hygienists and other support personnel. And while youll have the support of the entire office, youll have full autonomy over your patients, a steady stream of patients to keep you busy and exposure to all types of procedures. We also offer top-of-the-line technology and safety equipment to help you give high quality, compassionate care.

Whats It Like to Work at Bright Now! Dental?

We believe in building a happy, harmonious work environment where you love what you doand our culture supports that. Youll have the opportunity to advance in your dental career and the chance to explore continuing education programs.
Well give you your own built-in network of referrals
Youll work in a group practice with GP dentists and specialists, ensuring your patients are well taken care of
We have dedicated dental assistants and a front-office team that we know youll love working with

DEA certificate

Benefits and perks for you, your family and even your pets!
Medical, Dental, Vision and 401K for full-time positions

job_description.213:
Talbert House has a career opening for a School Mental Health Therapist for Hamilton County

$2000 Sign on Bonus for Dependently Licensed Therapist:

$500 after 1st day, $500 after completing 6 months close supervision, $1000 after 1st year anniversary

$3000 Sign on Bonus for Independently Licensed Therapist:

$500 after 1st day, $1000 after completing 6 months close supervision, $1500 after 1st year anniversary


WORK LOCATION: Hamilton County School District
WORK HOURS: 1st Shift
FLSA STATUS: Salaried Exempt
JOB TYPE: Regular Full-Time
JOB CODE: 1598-460

POSITION SUMMARY:


Our School Mental Health Therapist provides coordination of social and educational services in schools throughout Hamilton County. They provide a continuum of care from prevention and assessment to treatment for school aged youth and their families. Services are provided in the school, community and home. The Therapist will maintain a caseload of clients and may provide assessment, individual and/or group clinical services. Services may be provided in a variety of settings. Duties and additional experience or requirements may vary by position. A dependent license is required.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Maximize treatment outcomes by using approved counseling methods for individual, family, or group sessions.
Conduct assessments (including dependent diagnosis) to develop an accurate diagnostic summary/service plan. Use approved interviewing and observation techniques/instruments to assist with assessment.
Utilize clinical knowledge and training to recognize when medical referral is appropriate and to understand psychotropic medications, side effects and related diagnoses.
Prepare clinical reports and individualized service plans utilizing agency electronic clinical documentation software.
Assure documentation is in compliance with contract, regulatory and agency requirements and best clinical practices.
Efficiently operate personal computer to enter, edit and/or retrieve data and to produce reports and documentation.
Effectively works as a team member, including participating in all required trainings, ensure the safety of others and participate in Peer Review/CQI process.
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

Master's degree
Active Ohio license as a Social Worker (LSW), Professional Counselor (LPC) or, Marriage Family Therapist (MFT)
QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED:

Experience working with youth in a school based and community setting
JOB SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS:

Ability to work independently
Requires work in the community with students and families, as a result candidate must be willing to provide services in student homes and community locations in addition to the school
Talbert House employs, promotes and contracts without regards to race, gender, color, national origin, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, age, sex, religion, or genetic information. Talbert House is an EO/AA Employer/M/F/Protected Vet/Disabled & an equal provider of services.

AGENCY DESCRIPTION:


Talbert House is a community-wide nonprofit network of social services with programs focusing on prevention, assessment, treatment and reintegration. Each year, Talbert House helps thousands of men, women and children across Greater Cincinnati and Northern Kentucky overcome adversity to become healthy and productive citizens through programs in community corrections, mental health, substance abuse, welfare-to-work and housing.

POSITION SUMMARY: With direct supervision, this role performs a variety of routine billing functions to ensure the proper preparation of accurate and timely bills to customers based on service contract terms and also is responsible for related activities.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Following standard operating procedures, this role prepares monthly billing adjustments, obtains required approvals and enters adjustments into the billing system.
Researches and resolves routine billing questions and discrepancies. Refers unusual problems to higher level personnel.
Reviews invoices for completeness and accuracy. Follows up with customers or other division staff/management to resolve identified discrepancies.
May calculate and prepare basic manual billings for non-complex billing arrangements.
May gather and summarize supplemental billing information to accommodate customer billing requirements.
May review various billing system reports to identify billing discrepancies. Makes corrections as appropriate to ensure accurate billing following standard operating procedures.
Posts cash receipts to customer accounts based on information from lock box reports and local cash receipt listings. Performs basic and routine research to resolve differences or unidentified payments.
Posts payments as appropriate into the billing system to clear open obligations, or prepares remittance advices to accompany payments sent to the lock box or corporate office.
May accept credit card payment from customers over the phone and process recurring payments.

May have limited contact with customers to assist with researching billing questions and providing copies of the support documentation.

Some related accounting or office experience.
Directly related experience in which incumbents have worked with customers in a billing function.
A good knowledge and understanding of billing transactions and processes.
Should have basic MS Excel skills.
Demonstrated ability to follow standard operating procedures and instructions to complete tasks in a timely and accurate manner.
The ability to effectively interact and communicate with division managers as well as customers in a professional manner.
Must be able to demonstrate initiative to thoughtfully research and follow up on non-standard situations to ensure compliance with company policies and procedures.
Good math aptitude and the ability to work accurately with numbers are essential.

High school diploma or G.E.D. certification.

Job Description
LeafFilter seeks a talented Business Analyst to join our rapidly-growing company that is headquartered in Hudson, Ohio.

LeafFilter is the nation’s largest gutter protection company, with over 240,000 satisfied customers. From coast to coast, we provide the most effective debris-blocking gutter protection system on the market, paired with an exceptional customer experience from beginning to end.

The Business Analyst is an integral part of our elite team and is needed to support our organization by transforming large sets of data into actionable items. The Business Analyst will analyze Digital Marketing, TV, Print Advertising, Direct Mail, Event Marketing, and Call Center data to identify trends and drive optimizations and improvement through ad hoc analysis. Additionally, you will build and monitor reports for trends, inefficiencies, and outliers.

Run and analyze ad-hoc and pre-built reports that provide insights to support business objectives and drive efficiency
Turn large amounts of data, from a variety of sources, into understandable information used for strategic planning
Transform and analyze data sets, turning raw data into actionable information and providing findings to leadership
Handle multiple projects with different deadlines in a fast-paced environment

1+ years of business intelligence/analytical experience

Excellent analytic, quantitative, and problem-solving skills
High level of accuracy and attention to detail
Superior written and oral communication skills

Knowledge of Microsoft SQL server
Experience with Tableau software

We want to welcome you to the team!

Our company has enjoyed success for over 15+ years as one of the Nation’s largest home improvement companies and we are expanding all over North America as a leader in the remodeling industry to 62 offices (and growing!!!).

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not and will not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, national origin, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

LeafFilter is the #1 rated gutter guard system in the nation, as evaluated by two separate leading consumer publications. LeafFilter, the leading leaf guard company, has installed over 40 million feet of gutter protection on homes across the United States since 2005. Over the past fourteen years, LeafFilter has grown from one small office in Hudson, Ohio to North America's largest gutter protection company.

job_description.218:
Job Description

Job ID: 54738

Quality Analyst. The Quality Analyst in this contract role works closely with business analysts and development teams to ensure applications meet business and technical requirements and are of high quality. The position will estimate, plan and perform software testing for projects of varying size and complexity. He or she will develop a solid business and functional understanding of the system(s) under test and serve as a knowledge resource for team members.

Position Responsibilities:
50%: Create and maintain reusable test cases and execute tests using manual and automated tools.
30%: Analyze test results, document software defects, and validate defect fixes.
10%: Coordinate software testing for releases, prepare release testing status reports, and communicate test results and issues to interested stakeholders.
10%: Monitor project activities, assess quality risks, and recommend mitigation.
Cultivate and disseminate knowledge of quality assurance best practices.
Apply test methodology, engineering and product knowledge in the design of tests and testing strategies for the analysis and qualification of products.
Define and tracks quality assurance metrics such as defect densities and open defect counts.
Position Requirements:
Strong Ruby / Cucumber
Someone with Ruby Automation testing experience is preferred.
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or Business
Related Work Experience: 4-6 years
4+ years’ experience in software development, quality assurance, or management information systems.
2+ years’ experience planning, estimating, and executing testing for large, complex multi-tier applications.

Looking to progress your current sales career? Do you want to work in a fast-paced, dynamic sales environment with real opportunity for career growth and advancement? Do you thrive in a performance driven environment where your results are directly recognized and rewarded?

National General Insurance is the fastest growing Property & Casualty (P&C) insurer in the United States and is recognized for our experienced leaders, entrepreneurial culture, and energetic environment. NatGen is searching for enthusiastic, motivated, and dedicated Inside Sales Agents to join our growing team in the Cleveland, OH office. Prior sales experience is not necessary but the motivation and passion for being a successful salesperson is a must! We offer a multi-tiered and in-depth paid training program to provide you with all the tools you need to be successful in our inbound sales center environment. Training covers the Property & Casualty insurance industry, National General Products and Systems, and proven sales techniques to empower you for success.

Compensation

Our high performing first year sales agents earn an average of $60,000 to $70,000 per year with an hourly base pay and uncapped commissions and incentives. Second and third year agents’ average yearly earnings of up to $85,000. Top agents earn $115,000+!

Company paid training
Above market compensation plan with unlimited earning potential
Plentiful, highly-converting qualified leads
Internal advancement opportunities – grow with us!
Agent, Senior Agent, Executive Agent
Team Lead, New Hire Team Lead, Site Leader, Affinity Account Manager
Sales contests, prizes and competitions
Fun and relaxed work environment including arcade games and ping pong
Primary Purpose:

job_description.223:
Senior Market Intelligence Analyst

JOB SUMMARY

The Senior Market Intelligence (MI) Analyst works with the broader team on flagship MI projects and provides inputs to client tactical projects that are managed by the Account Teams. The Senior Ml Analyst understands key client business issues and determines the best approach to delivering valuable brand insights and relevant local data to support the strategic goals of the project. This person works collaboratively on complex projects and is a strong analytic resource who shows integrity in all aspects of work. Experience in healthcare analytics and project management, and knowledge of public data sources is desired (4+years).

JOB DETAILS

This position will lead, deliver, and collaborate on Market Intelligence projects for Relevate clients, including (but not limited to):
Understanding and interpreting key trends in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industry related to client needs and Relevate tactical program development
Strategically identifying local data needs and appropriate data sources, and presenting back to Account Teams and clients
Having a key role in MI data visualization applications and other analytical processes in support of Relevate tactics and programs
Managing client-specific projects and collaborating with Account Teams to ensure excellent project delivery from project start to end
Working closely with Account Teams in understanding project needs and communicating where and how MI will be involved
Supporting analyses of key Ml topics, supporting training and learning across Relevate organization
Implementing multiple concurrent analyses and projects
Investigating and exploring key data sources to support client projects
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY SKILLS
Applies appropriate analytical methods to customer data and collaborates with MI team to recommend key strategies identified in the analysis
Demonstrates strong hands-on experience with basic computer programs and software applications (Microsoft Office Suites, data visualization software i.e., Tableau)
Acts independently to ensure customer needs are met
Demonstrates excellent communication skills, both oral and written
Collaborates closely with internal functional and account teams
Possesses strong project management skills, with excellent attention to detail
Possesses strong analytical and interpersonal skills
Displays effective time management and organization skills
Works well with others and is a team player
JOB REQUIREMENTS

Relevant Experience, Education, Certification, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Education: Bachelor's degree in a quantitative or business field
Experience:
4-6 years related experience ideal
Prior experience with pharmaceutical, market, and/or customer analytics
Deep knowledge of pharmaceutical data sources
Ability to think strategically and make decisions based on data trends and other inputs
Strong project management experience, including ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Proven ability to translate data to insights, and to utilize information, where appropriate, to support tactical implementation needs
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills required; familiarity with Tableau or other visualization tools desirable
Previous qualitative market research experience desired, but not required
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment - often a virtual team
Excellent communication skills, both internal and external
Familiarity working within small, fast paced, growth-oriented business environment
Workplace Requirements:

Work in an office environment in close proximity to coworkers (cubicle environment)
Relevate strives to hire high-performing, well-balanced individuals who are generous community contributors. Every voice, every viewpoint matters. Were proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation or any category protected by law.

job_description.226:
Job Description

Job ID: 54766

Junior Business Analyst. This Junior Business Analyst contract position will regularly interact with business and IT resources from various levels in the organization and external vendors as needed. The candidate for this position must be familiar with technology, business use of technology, and should have experience eliciting functional requirements from the business and documenting these with feature level detail. Experience and understanding of retail specific technology is a plus.

Essential Functions:
Elicit and document business, non-functional and operational requirements by analyzing business objectives, business and user needs and documenting potential modifications to existing systems
Facilitate requirement sessions with Business, IT, and external resources
Prepares requirements definition including user persona’s, flowcharts and preliminary reports
Provides the functional and technical specifications in the form of Agile user stories and acceptance criteria
Create and/or review “As Is/ To Be” Process documentation
Support inter-team relationships
Partner with others in the formation and definition of scope and objectives through research and fact-finding activities
Critically evaluate information elicited from multiple sources; reconcile conflicts, sort high-level information into details and distinguish user requests from underlying true needs
Qualifications:
1-3 years’ experience as a business analyst
Ability to evaluate, analyze and solve highly technical and complex incidents or business problem
Retail industry experience is desired
Familiarity with standard agile methodologies (Scrum, XP, Kanban, etc.)
Familiarity with planning and development tools such as IRise, Confluence, JIRA, Sharepoint, Balsamiq, MS Azure DevOps
Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent, preferred
Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms.
Preferred Qualifications:
Acceptance Test Driven Development (ATDD) or Behavior Driven Development (BDD) experience
Refinement of User Stories including documenting acceptance criteria in Given-When-Then format

job_description.227:
Trellis Rx is a technology-enabled service provider that partners with health systems to fund, build, and operate world-class specialty pharmacies on their behalf, with their brand. Trellis enables health systems to deliver enhanced experiences and outcomes by helping them offer concierge-level clinical and administrative support to patients throughout their course of therapy. We believe pharmacists and pharmacy technicians are critical additions to the care team and that an exceptional pharmacy team makes superior results possible.

Trellis is seeking a proven leader to help operate a word class specialty pharmacy program for our client, Southern Ohio Medical Center, in Portsmouth, OH. This person would serve as Trellis' most senior level leader of this client program, responsible for ensuring that all clinical, operational, and financial goals are met.

Relocation assistance available.

You would be responsible for:
Developing goals, strategies, and tactics to ensure ongoing customer success. This will include helping our customers grow their specialty pharmacy program and ensuring that their program operates profitably.
Building, developing, and inspiring the onsite team of clinicians, liaisons, technicians, and other staff to outperform targets and create high patient and provider satisfaction. All Trellis-employed pharmacy and clinical staff (e.g. hematology-oncology, rheumatology, gastroenterology, endocrine, dermatology, and transplant) will operate under your leadership. You will be charged with developing Trellis culture at the client site bridging any gaps between Trellis' cultural norms and our customer's norms and values.
Owning the relationship between Trellis and our health system customers' pharmacy and executive leadership teams
Managing external relationships with pharmaceutical manufacturers and third-party payors on behalf of our customers, including overseeing compliance of limited distribution drug and specialty pharmacy network contracts
Discrete project management. You will be expected to identify and engage key stakeholders; plan, develop, and execute the project; and lead change through all levels of the organization towards timely completion.
Forecasting specialty pharmacy operating plans. This will require identifying needs, assisting in financial assessments, negotiating price and value, and managing requests and purchases.
Here's what we'd like to offer to you:
The chance to develop professionally and personally, as an early hire at a fast growing, well-funded healthcare startup
A driver's seat position transforming how specialty pharmacy services are delivered to the most complex patients, to improve their overall experience and outcomes
A platform to meaningfully leverage and further develop your (healthcare) operations, leadership, and management skills, working alongside our senior leadership and premier health system customers
An opportunity to help shape our growing team and mentor future leaders at Trellis and our clients alike
Competitive compensation including a performance bonus
Generous benefits package including:
Health, Dental & Vision that are effective on day one of employment
401K with company match
12-week maternity leave with 100% of salary
6-week parental leave with 100% of salary
Short & Long-Term Disability
Generous Paid Time Off plus holidays and bereavement leave
Life insurance
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Fitness Reimbursement
Employee Assistance Program
Employee Discounts (retail, hotels, food, restaurants, car rentals, and much more)
We are excited to speak with someone who has:
Experience managing and successfully executing complex projects (preferably in a hospital setting), while working with diverse stakeholders
Proven leadership in a specialty pharmacy, health system, or managed care setting with a track record of transforming ideas into measurable operational changes
Influence and people management skills demonstrated by high team satisfaction and customer satisfaction scores
Been responsible for and successfully managed their own P&L
Clear and effective communication skills and comfort engaging all levels inside and outside the organization
A proactive approach to problem solving, working quickly with attention to detail
Proficiency in MS Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Excellent project management skills and process development know-how (using IHI, A3, process mapping, lean six sigma etc.)
At least a Bachelor's Degree in a healthcare-related field or business administration
And bonus points if you have a couple of these, too:
Experience in a start-up company or early stage health care environment
Experience leading various disciplines and levels of clinical professionals
Experience starting and / or running a specialty pharmacy at a health system
Proficiency with standard software used in a healthcare setting such as EMR systems (e.g., EPIC, Cerner, Meditech), dispensing systems (e.g., QS1, RX30, Computer Rx)
An advanced degree in healthcare-related field or business administration
job_description.228:
About Command Alkon

Command Alkon is bringing innovative technologies and systems to the concrete, asphalt and building materials industry globally. Our technology helps our customers improve the efficiency and quality of the foundation of where we live, work and play. What we do best is combine next-gen technologies with over 40 years of industry expertise. We are not a “here today; gone tomorrow” software company, we will be here for a long time and a good foundation for your career…. like concrete.


The Role

The Technical Business Analyst (TBA), COMMANDbatch Insights is a new and exciting role at Command Alkon, leveraging technical and industry expertise skills into “platform experience” thinking on which we will design and deliver value to our customers for the years to come. We consider this position a rare opportunity to engage early in Command Alkon’s platform strategy, pioneering this growth opportunity into a high-performing function delivering value to our customers.

The TBA role is a combination of two traditional roles: Business Analyst and Solutions Architect. TBAs possess a technical & engineering acumen capable of using basic development, querying and troubleshooting toolsets.

TBAs will report to the Product Management organization, particularly as Command Alkon realizes our CONNEX Platform mission. The role requires cooperation amongst our cross-functional organization, and knowledge on our industry and products to synthesis platform capabilities into key features for customers that solve problems and add value.
Generally speaking, the role will require External Focus of ~30-40% and Internal Focus of ~60-70%. Higher travel will be required to kickoff the role, and upon new Insight projects that are envisioned.
What You'll Do
Acts as liaison between both: Customer > Product Management as well as Product Management > Engineering
Determine business requirements that a product or platform user experience must solve (i.e. what is the user trying to accomplish)
Map business requirements to configuration options in the platform product
Identify gaps between requirements and available configurable options
Write business specifications (eg. wireframes, workflows, use cases, user stories) for new platform configuration options that close identified gaps
Create and manage innovative/pilot projects for specific customers (or platform partners)
Ensure customer adoption of key features to achieve intended benefit
Assist in testing prior to implementation and during major feature enhancements
Understanding requirements and breaking down into Features & Stories in a backlog.
This role lives in the market & has exhaustive knowledge of industry analytics needs, especially needs of operators, users and economic buyers
You will be the key contact for Insights at Command Alkon & industry events, including trade shows
Who You Are
Customer-facing, Creative, Problem Solver, Results Oriented, High Pace, Highly organized, Great listener, Excellent written communication
“Servant’s heart” and can speak (or can learn) the customer’s language
Heavy Building Materials industry-related job history is preferred
You’re a high-energy, driven self-starter with an entrepreneurial itch to bring the Insights to reality. You like to try innovative ideas and have had success putting them into practice.
Data driven decision making is in your DNA
You are not a technologist, but follow technology trends that enable our product vision
What You'll Bring
Proficiency in Excel (including formulas), PowerPoint, Jira (or equivalent), Confluence (or equivalent), SQL scripts
Two to five years experience with analytics and reporting, i.e., Cognos, Quick Sight, Tableau, etc.
Bachelor of Science degree with strong mathematics background
Willing and able to travel, with higher travel initially
Why work for Command Alkon?

Command Alkon, voted one of Birmingham’s Best Places to Work in 2016, 2017 and 2018, is the global leader for over 40 years in integrated technology solutions for the concrete and heavy building materials industry because of the committed relationship we have with our employees and our customers. Headquartered in Birmingham, Alabama, Command Alkon has over 600 employees worldwide with offices in Kansas, Ohio, Illinois, Utah, Malaysia, Brazil, Canada, England, France, India and the Netherlands.
For more information about us and our products, visit http://www.commandalkon.com.
Command Alkon strives to be an employer of choice, offering a comprehensive benefit package that includes:
- Employee Recognition Programs
- Casual dress code
- Generous family medical and dental insurance plans
- Company-paid life insurance, short term disability and long term disability insurance
- 401(k) Matching Program
- Tuition Reimbursement Program
- Free soft drinks and hot beverages
Find out more at http://www.commandalkon.com/careers/
Command Alkon is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description.231:
At this time a Technical Business Analyst is needed to elicit and manage technical requirements. . Effectively and efficiently communicates with technical (IT/Software) groups in addition to stakeholders in order to best analyze requirements from a technical viewpoint while uncovering any technical challenges that may come about in the fulfillment of requirements. Captures data, creates metrics, evaluates dependencies, resolves business/technical problems and applies logical thinking to develop options and appropriate solutions.
Role and Responsibilities:
Manages requirements on departmental projects with medium to high complexity
Demonstrates basic understanding of development languages, SDLC concepts and implementation methodologies
Consistently demonstrates knowledge of requirements management concepts and elicitation techniques
Conducts and documents formal stakeholder analysis
Elicits business requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, observation, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis
Documents current state, including as is process documentation or an assessment of current capabilities, and future state by way of context diagrams and flowcharts using tools such as Visio
Facilitates gap analysis with stakeholders to determine differences between the current state and the future state to identify areas for design and development
Facilitates sessions with stakeholders from the business and IT specialists to resolve any differences between the two parties regarding the requirements for or the development of the new system
Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying needs
Displays comprehensive knowledge of the business's technology infrastructure, able to create complex business process flows and/or business process maps, and participates in business process reengineering
Consistently demonstrates ability to apply proven and experiential methods to break down and address complex business and IT related issues
Consistently demonstrates ability to apply appropriate risk model, weigh options, and present recommendations to address complex business and IT related issues
Creates written documentation in the form of use cases, software requirements specifications, and/or user stories
Transforms business requirements into the technical requirements of a project by preparing technical design documents, including Use Cases, web page/form/screen designs, report option requirements, input/output descriptions. Ensures Agile stories contain appropriate technical information for software development.
Creates written documentation in the form of updated business processes, procedures, checklists, work aids, or training materials
Collaborates with business users and QA teams to develop test cases, test scripts, and test plans to ensure that all requirements are properly verified and approved prior to release
Communicates regularly and effectively with project team members to gather and clarify requirements
Communicates regularly and effectively with project stakeholders including business partners to gather and clarify requirements
Scribes, records and publishes the proceedings of requirements meetings
Participates, and in the absence of the scrum master may lead, all agile ceremonies including, Epic Planning and deconstruction, Sprint Planning, Story Grooming, Story Estimating, Sprint Demonstrations, and Sprint Retrospectives.
Provides regular status updates to project team, project manager and/or scrum master
Tracks progress of requirements, maintaining a requirements issues list, requirements traceability matrix, and managing progress to project plans
Manages change requests as stakeholders discover updates to the requirements which are out of scope (i.e., schedule, resources, or budget)
Actively participates in meetings, fosters a positive work environment, and displays a high level of engagement
Coordinates large cross-function, multi-discipline teams to obtain high level strategic business objectives over an extended timeframe
Willingly undertakes work on special projects when a needed arises, as time permits, without impacts to assigned work
Research, review and recommend approaches, technical tools and products that promote an effective and efficient team
Strives to enforce and live the NAE Philosophy of CQSE each and every day
Other duties as requested and assigned
Qualifications and Education Requirements:
Bachelors degree in Information Systems, Business, Communications or related technical field
3+ years of associated work experience as a Business Analyst in a Software Development environment
Advanced skills in Jira and Confluence, including workflow
Practical application ability with Microsoft Office and Visio
Detailed analytical abilities
Strong experience in user testing and project management
CSM or ACP certification is a plus
Work Environment and Physical Requirements:
Normal office environment.
Ability to frequently sit for long periods of time.
Ability to occasionally walk, stand, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel or crouch.
Ability to spend extended hours in front of a computer screen and use close vision, distant vision and depth perception.
Ability to lift at least 20 pounds.
Preferred Skills, Characteristics and Traits:
Excellent verbal and written communication abilities
Demonstration of strong technical aptitude
Refined analytical abilities
Problem-solving and decision-making
Confident yet humble
Qualitative, Quantitative and Visualization skills

job_description.234:
At 3M, we apply science in collaborative ways to improve lives. With $33 billion in sales, our 93,000 employees connect with customers all around the world.

3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas.

Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.

Job Description:

3M is seeking a Sr. Software Engineer for the Health Information Systems located in Atlanta, GA. At 3M, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter. Here, you go.

3M Health Information Systems (HIS) is the world leader for innovating the language of health and delivers comprehensive software and consulting services. Working at 3M Health Information Systems you will be helping with today’s challenges while preparing for tomorrow’s. Transforming health care from a system that treats disease, to a system that improves health and wellness begins with accurate health information and payment. From improving the efficiency of medical records coding to outlining success in value-based care and healthcare analytics. All while working with the best and the brightest to advance more than your own career, you are working to advance the entire world.

Sr. Software Engineer Job Summary:

3M Health Information Systems is hiring for developers from New Grad to Senior level experience.

As a Sr. Software Engineer you will be helping with today’s challenges, while preparing for tomorrow’s. You will be challenged daily on exciting large-scale projects with the latest technologies. You will be part of a team that has meaningful work and makes a difference for both domestic and international healthcare markets. If you have a strong technical background with the ability to efficiently solve challenging problems, you would be set up to be very successful in this position and have a positive impact quickly. Join US!

This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career.



Sr. Software Engineer Primary Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
Be an active member of a scrum team by participating in all phases of SDLC, including design, software development and code reviews
Develop software components based on requirements, architecture and design specifications
Work with fellow software engineers, software architects, quality (QA) engineers, full-stack developers, and other engineering/development team members to design and build required systems
Coordinate and communicate with clinical analysts, product analysts, quality analysts, and other software engineers
Ensure 3M applications integrate with 3rd party vendor software required to deliver the required solutions to 3M customers.
Adhere to team design and coding procedures and standards
Contribute to Security and Risk assessments to aid in the deployment of application components in Production
Help resolve escalated customer support issues
Interact with customers to resolve operational problems and determine customer requirements
Actively participate in relevant corporate programs/initiatives, complies with professional and quality standards complies with corporate policies and procedures, and act in a manner consistent with 3M’s values and ethical standards.


Sr. Software Engineer Basic Qualifications:
Possess a Bachelor’s Degree or higher from an accredited university OR High School Diploma/GED or higher from an accredited institution and a minimum of eight (8) years of experience in Software Development in lieu of the Bachelor’s degree education requirement
Minimum of four (4) years of experience of Software development experience with one or more programming languages, including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, C#, JavaScript, Objective C, Python


Sr. Software Engineer Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Science Engineering, or related discipline
Demonstrated track record of delivering high-visibility projects on a tight timeline
Experience with web application security
Experience developing and delivering commercial enterprise software
Familiarity with continuous integration
Solid understanding of software design principles and architectural patterns
Health Information Systems experience in an IT, Software Engineering, Software Development role.
Experience working in an Agile environment with strong test automation and continuous deployment
Strong experience with cloud architectures and development of large-scale hosted applications
Ability to easily switch between multiple programming languages (i.e. JavaScript, C++, C#, Java, .Net, XML, XSLT, XPath, JSON, HTML5, Angular, etc.)
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
Ability to speak and write English fluently and idiomatically


Location: Atlanta, GA

Travel Requirements: Occasional travel may be required

Relocation: Maybe authorized

Diverse & Inclusive 3M

3M is a place where you can collaborate with other curious, creative people. Where your diverse talents, inclusiveness, initiative, and leadership are valued. Where you’ll find challenging opportunities that make your career exciting and rewarding. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies, and products, 3M is a place to grow and be rewarded for excellence

Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

Looking to progress your current sales career? Do you want to work in a fast-paced, dynamic sales environment with real opportunity for career growth and advancement? Do you thrive in a performance driven environment where your results are directly recognized and rewarded?

NatGen is searching for enthusiastic, motivated, and dedicated Inside Sales Agents to join our growing team in the Cleveland, OH office. Prior sales experience is not necessary but the motivation and passion for being a successful salesperson is a must! We offer a multi-tiered and in-depth paid training program to provide you with all the tools you need to be successful in our inbound sales center environment. Training covers the Property & Casualty insurance industry, National General Products and Systems, and proven sales techniques to empower you for success.

Agent, Senior Agent, Executive Agent
